text: Food was good. But what was better was the service. I told the waiter about my shell fish allergy and he changed from their standard bread because it's heated on the same grill as their shellfish is cooked. Kudos. Good lookin out! Again, food was tasty as you would expect.

The food here is AMAZING!! This was the first time in a long time I ordered a second round of appetizers. The patio dining is beautiful and comfortable. The staff is very friendly...server was extremely cute too.

If you are looking for New Orleans style food this is the place!!!

***anyone who goes to a restaurant on Mother's Day or any other major dine out holiday without a reservation is an idiot***

This place is way better than I expected.  Red beans and rice is phenomenal. The fries are absolutely the best anywhere, super crispy and actual potatoes! This is definitely a great little piece of New Orleans in Las Vegas and a welcome independent experience in Summerlin.  Everyone should try this place!

Amazing! We had a fabulous date night there. The bartender was extremely helpful and made a perfect cocktail recommendation for my wife. Additionally, the ambiance made for a perfect date night with a talented piano player who put a personal spin on pop culture. To top it off, their Cajun dishes had all the right spices and portion sizes. We enjoyed the crab cake appetizer and then the shrimp & grits and red beans & rice. I cannot wait to go back! Well done Lola's!

I've been to the Charleston location several times and it is always a must stop every time I'm in Vegas so I had to try this new location in Town Center. I brought 3 of my friends and as usual, Lola's did not disappoint. First of all the new location is absolutely gorgeous. Loved the decor and open feel of the place.  Very inviting. Finally got to try the crawfish and they were the biggest I'd ever eaten. Amazing oysters too. We were fortunate to have come on a day when Lola made some special cobbler which was amazing even after stuffing ourselves with several menu items. And of course the Banana foster bread pudding was a must as well. Highly recommended. Very authentic New Orleans cuisine. You're doing yourself a grave disservice if you don't stop and dine at least once at one of Lola's locations whenever you're in town. Until next time!
The food is ok and my family loved this place. My brother got a shrimp po boy and he loved it. I had there pasta and I did not like it.

I honestly don't even know where to begin. Great food and I loved the atmosphere! Perfect place to eat for anyone who loves Cajun food. I started off with the Crab Cake, which was full of crab meat finished with the perfect crunchy crust. I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy, fried topped with extra spicy seasoning, and my girlfriend ordered the catfish. I also had a side order of red beans and rice. Everything was amazing. We couldn't stop talking about the food and had no leftovers! I can't wait to bring my family and friends!

Etoufffee, Jambalia, Gumbo, Oysters, Salmon, Po Boys, Bread Pudding...

Fresh ingredients (some from Lola's garden) prepared by a supurb chef, served by confident professional employees in an inviting space is a success formula that works every time!  Thank you Lola for creating the perfect gathering spot.  Kudos to you and your team.

Food was just ok..but the hostess and servers??? 7 11 has better customer service. I don't know that we would go back, the girls up front were talking about certain customers. If you don't like your job..don't come in. How hard is it? One star is over rated

Don't get the crawfish puppies... they're over priced and bland tiny little balls. The crab cake was good value at 6.99 for a nice size. Crawfish ettouffe had no flavor. Shrimp and grits were good but a bit in the salty side. The garlic bread app was grilled bread with no garlic flavor and was overpriced. Good service and nice ambience but food was mediocre at best.
Went for a business lunch and thought the food was amazing. I had the catfish and grits. I usually don't like catfish but the waitress recommended it and it was delicious. Great atmosphere!
Food is cheap and has that "out of a can" feel.  Service is overly pushy.  I saw this restaurant on Diners, Drive ins and Dives and he didn't appear very impressed.  I can see why.

Absolutely delicious!! Hubby and I wanted to try some place new, so happy we chose Lola's!!! We got the crab and artichoke dip, so delish..lots of chunks of crab meat and it came at piping hot. For our main course, I ordered the grits and shrimp dish, literally, my eyes were rolling back the whole time! It was heaven, seriously!! Hubby had the shrimp po boy and he was in love, I tried it also and it was definitely the best I've ever had. We also split a piece of fried catfish. The catfish was huge!! Very meaty, but not seasoned well in our opinion. We saved room for desert, wish we wouldn't have. The bread pudding was nothing to write home about but hey. Overall, the decor, service, and food was impeccable!! Our bill was $61 a bit pricey but worth every penny! A must try!

Came to this restaurant at 11:59 on Mother's Day, we were turned away because we didn't have a reservation and they were holding the tables for Mother's Day, although I understand it's A very important and special day, the restaurant was completely empty and they had more than 12 tables available, they could've very easily sat a party of two...

Guess what Lola's just lost a customer as I will never visit any of the two locations in Las Vegas again.

Items ordered:

Gouda grits - this was the first time I had ever had grits. They were quite tasty. If definitely order that again

Shrimp remoulade - shrimp was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Very flavorful

Cheeseburger - cooked as I ordered. Definitely a homemade patty. Very good. 

Shrimp Po Boy - shrimp was cooked perfectly. Very good except brea was over toasted so ends were way too hard. 

Ate at the bar. So was entertained with conversation with the bartender Lora. And she made me a Malibu Bay Breeze, which I hadn't had in years, and it was perfect.

We visit this location all the time and the food is great and bartenders helpful and remember our beer preference . Great place for a meal and to feel like you belong. Try the bread with hot sauce and oysters when in season otherwise too small and not worth what they charging for them.
Shrimp and Gouda grits, bowl of gumbo and bread pudding= I'm getting it again and again.

Service and food choices in the bar were great.  Last time on the patio the food was not the best.  Service was very slow and server was rude.  If I can't eat at the bar I probably wont eat there again.

Great pick for a Saturday night dinner. It's listed as a Louisiana Kitchen and they have a large number of Cajun dishes. I had the shrimp appetizer along with the red beans and rice. The drinks are delicious too. Great quality food at a good value.

Ooooh my godddd!!!!! This places gumbo is so amazing!!!! I had a client recommend me to come here, and now that I finally did I don't regret it one bit. Holy crap, so amazing. And really good portion sizes for a great price. Tasted fresh and amazing, and I'm from the south so I know good gumbo when I taste it!

I have visited Lola's at the Summerlin location three times and have not had a bad experience with service or food.  Everyone worked hard to make our dining experience wonderful. Happy hour in the bar is well worth it, the drinks are well executed and martini's are served in large glasses filled to rim.  The happy hour menu is light and tasty.  The Gumbo is excellent and served with a dark rouge. For our dinner experience, everyone at the table was very pleased with their meal.  Cannot go wrong with the shrimp and Gouda grits.  My husband had same dish but with catfish. The menu is similar (or exactly the same) to their Charleston location.  Summerlin, please go and support our local restaurant! This place is a gem and worth a visit!!!

I can only say "wow, that was a disappointing meal."  I went with two other friends and 2 of us ordered gumbo. Our other friend ordered barbecued shrimp. My first bowl of gumbo had one shrimp and hardly any sausage. I pointed it out to our waiter and he politely took it back and brought me a fresh bowl. The second bowl had 3 shrimp and slightly more sausage than the first. When I say shrimp I'm talking about small shrimp. I don't know the exact size but I'm sure they are the least expensive, high count size at the butcher counter.  Our other friend who ordered the barbecue shrimp received five shrimp and they were only slightly larger than the ones in my gumbo. He looked at me and said "I can't believe I'm paying three dollars per shrimp for this."  My bowl of gumbo, my friend's bowl of gumbo, and my friend's barbecue shrimp were very disappointing. I basically had a bowl of roux with six slices of sausage and 3 small shrimp. 

On a positive note, the restaurant was clean, the ambience was nice and the staff was professional and polite.

Food - exquisite
shrimp n grits
Jambalaya 
Fig cake 

Music- peppy

Service- warm

Wanted to go back the same evening, sigh

This place is fantastic! Every single item we ordered was delicious. The shrimp and grits (what I ordered) was so flavorful, I ate every last bite. I tried a little from everyone's plate, which included fettuccini Alfredo, salmon, and jambalaya, and all was delicious. The bread pudding was just right to end the night. I am definitely coming back to this restaurant.

Creole food would never be my 1st choice of restaurants to go to. I have heard that Lola's shrimp & grits was to die for. I love shrimp and I like grits... so I finally went to their Summerlin location.  Soooo good!  WILL DEFINITELY go back!

Visited soon after the place opened on September 19th. Was really excited to have something different near the house.When we got there we noticed that it was really hot inside. We had previously made reservations and requested a round table. Hostess proceeds to take us to a long table that had more chairs than what was needed. We asked the hostess if we could please be seated at a round table as requested. After 5 minutes they took us to a back room that had the round table. This room felt even warmer but we didn't want to leave since we were all hungry. The good thing is that they had fans. Ordered 3 cocktails and 3 waters and it took the waitress 10 + minutes to deliver the water and cocktails. To top it off she had to carry it all because she didn't know how to use a tray. I know they had tray's because I saw other staff using them. As for the food, it was not good. Maybe I should have waited for them to get the kinks out. Might give them one more try just to see if what I experienced was because the place had recently opened.

I like Lola's. The crab cake- nice touch with the "L" shaped secret sauce... Or is that mayonnaise? Either way it all blends nicely with the lettuce under it. Kinda like an opened crab cake lettuce wrap. The gumbo was pretty good- nice size shrimp and sausage. The shrimp and grits is the main course every time- I almost think the sauce that surrounds the grits is thickened gumbo soup gravy- I don't know. The shrimp have a nice grilled flavor and they are jumbo. But the "gumbo gravy" makes it go POW! So good.
Authentic Louisiana with a twist. A must if looking for something different in Las Vegas.
Awesome happy hour, great live music and amazing food!! Definitely come check them out for your self.

This was a yummy place!  I am not really a cajun food kind of girl, but everything was delicious!  I tried the catfish on a friend's recommendation.  I don't like catfish because it always tastes "dirty" to me.  This did not.  It was fresh, cooked to perfection and was wonderful.  I didn't know what I was missing.  And the cheesy grits!  I don't like grits either, but these are fantastic!  

If you want to try a little down south food and hospitality - head to Lola's.  Oh - and by the way - if you are a New Orleans Saints fan, you will have a great time!

My husband and I drove to Vegas strip for the weekend and wanted to venture outside to find beignets.. WOW! this place is outstanding!!!! Best meal we have had! My husband lived in Lousiana for a few years and knows good southern food, even he was impressed! We even ordered a few plates to go.. hehe!

It is always great to eat here. Service is always on point and the food was delicious. It was not as busy yesterday, but I do recommend making a reservation because it can get very crowded.  My friend and I also had a couple of cocktails and they were great too. They waitress was very attentive and she was very careful to note that my friend has a shellfish allergy. All and all a great experience.

I give this place 4 stars for a couple different reasons. I liked the aura of the whole set up. It was very elegant and peaceful, very beautifully designed and you almost felt like you were in Louisiana on a nice warm day. I ordered the crawpuppies, Shrimp & Grits and the red beans and rice. My favorite out of them was definitely the Shrimo & Grits, seasoned very well and very filling! Their sweet ice tea was amazing as well, not too sweet and you can still taste the tea. Overall this place was awesome, service was good and food came out fast!! I will be going back to try the other items on their menu

We have been a fan of Lola's since she opened her first place, and we always told everyone we knew they had to eat there. The food has always been excellent. The problem was that the charleston location is kinda small, and we are impulsive eaters. We rarely make reservations, and once she started getting busy they started requiring reservations. However, I don't think they ever handled reserving tables correctly, which discouraged us from going there as often. For us being comfortable is important to the enjoyment of the meal. There was more than one occasion we were told they only had the small, crowded bar table available. Even though the entire time we ate there were at least 5 tables that sat empty.

We were excited when Lola told us about her new location, it was near us and bigger, she assured us we wouldn't have these problems there. It turns out even in this larger place we have the same problems. We went in on a Saturday, we were asked if we had a reservation, we didn't. We were told it would it be 10-15 mins. We looked around they had about 10 open tables, so we asked not to be seated at one of their awkwardly long two tops, no problem. 40 mins later we were taken right past three regular sized tables to one of those two tops. When we asked for a different table the hostess hemmed and hawed, but then took us to one of the other tables. We were seated for about two minutes when the other hostess came over and told us we couldn't sit there. When asked why she said they like to reserve that table for people with disabilities, we apologized and said we didn't realize someone with a disability was waiting. She replied there wasn't anyone with a disability coming in. OK. So we pointed to another table in the back of the room, to which she replied, "no you can't sit there either." When pressed she refused to give a reason.

Like I stated earlier, for us being comfortable is as important as the food being good. If I am going to spend my money on a meal I want to enjoy it, and there are plenty of restaurants that want my money, and will treat me accordingly. This wasn't the first time the hostesses were less than polite. And we had mentioned it to Lola, which can only mean it is her policy. 

Needless to say not only will we not be coming back, we won't be recommending it anymore.
Went here for the first time. Love the atmosphere. Clean, fun and has a cute outdoor patio. The food was flavorful and great service.

Fresh and fabulous Mother's day bunch.  The praline bacon got the most raves. The Leidenheimer french toast is authentic and delicious. We were at the back of the line of the opening (11:00am) rush so our food was a little slow, but no one was in a hurry and we stayed hydrated sipping the bottomless mimosa's  :^)

ATTENTION HORRIBLE PLACE AND OWNER:
 Took my partner and my newborn baby and my niece to Lola's Louisiana Kitchen for my partner's birthday. I had ordered close to $100 worth of food to go and the food was under seasoned. They say the're a Louisiana Kitchen but when I had called to complain I had spoke with Lola and told me to came back down. I told her there was no flavor or seasoning and Lola stated and I quote" If your looking Popeye's experience don't come here you won't find that here"
 I told her that you at least need to put salt and pepper because there was none she came out rude and belligerent and smelled of alcohol. My partner as well as myself have Louisiana and creole blood and have been to Louisiana and know how the food should taste. I know she only said it cause were black/African American. But they make the food bland for all the old people who come here. No young people were found. Good spot to go if you have no taste buds and like talking with business owners who drink (drink and drive)on the job I can't believe people love this place. The atmosphere is a mess no real theme Mitch match decor. I can't believe it was on Diner, Drive ins and Dives. Never trusting the food network again. Stay away from the crab cakes they are inedible and on the menu it says lumps...there are no lumps but you can sue because u will have crab shell to pick from your teeth. Better off getting crab cakes in the frozen section at the market

We came down for my mother's birthday, made reservations for 615 and we did not get food until 745! Very bad service, it was unfortunate because we made a special trip across town. When we asked for the manager the sent some kitchen worker to speak to us, Lola wouldn't even show her face.

Lola:
Sydney and I decided to try your Summerlin location this Fat Tuesday, same great food, a great atmosphere,  as we expected.  Erin our waiter was accommodating with just the right mix between attentiveness and leaving us in peace to eat.  Gilbert, the bus boy, was great as well, keeping drinks flowing and the right things off the table.  I know you read these so, congratulations to you on the Summerlin location and your excellent choice for staff and your proven menu.  Tell Matthew hi.

Went there for lunch today for the first time and had the gumbo, while my colleague has the jambalaya.  The food and service were both outstanding, and while we were never rushed, we were in and out in less than an hour.  The atmosphere was comfortable and the prices quite reasonable --very nice for a business lunch.  I'm looking forward to going for dinner.
outstanding gem in summerlin.  if cajun food sounds weird  just try it.  the flavors a great.  you can get a really good lunch for $15 and the service is fast and good.

If I could have given them 0 stars I would have. Staff is good but the food on the other hand is TERRIBLE! It's 60 degrees outside and they don't have the heat on for 1! 2nd the gumbo isn't made fresh it sits in a pot all day so if u get here at the end of the day your getting Luke warm gumbo! YUCK! This isn't how Louisiana food tastes at all please take a trip down south and come back and get it together!
Great food and good service. The bronzed shrimp and grits was awesome along with the bread for dredging in the delicious mushroom ragu. Definitely going back to try more of the menu.

I've always wanted to eat here especially after hearing the great reviews and spending a year in NOLA. I had high expectations. There's a po'boy that I used to order all the time, roast beef dressed and wet so when I saw the D'Brees roast beef po'boy I was excited to say the least. 

The bread was stale! My companions were trying to explain that the bread is toasted but the reality is that the bread was stale! The picture makes the bread look crusty and the expectation is that it has a little chew. The answer is no. It was like eating the sandwich with a dry sponge. :(. The gravy was also not warmed up enough as you can see in the picture and very much on the salty side. 

I also had their grits with Gouda cheese. It was good. A bit too cheesy for me... 

The sweet tea was awesome tho. !
Heaven is all i can say!!! Bbq shrimp with gouda grits.  We ate here tonight for our anniversary,  cannot believe we haven't dined here before.   Will definitely be back!!!

This is the 2nd location, and they have a full bar and are open on Sunday's with a brunch menu that I love!

Reasonably priced brunch items include my fav, the soft shell crab Benedict.  They also do fresh made beignets on Sunday for brunch only.  Yum!!!!

Delicious food, the grits are insane!!! The staff is so kind and very social. Love, love , love this place! 

Who Dat!
Best shrimp and grits I've ever had.  The staff has always been nice as well as the owner.  The toasted bread is perfect to mop up the left over sauce in your bowl leaving you craving more.

Poor service and food is not great.  Wait staff literally ignored us for 10 minutes when we first sat down and it wasn't even busy - there were only three other tables being occupied at the time.  Luckily, there is way too many restaurants in Vegas with good food and service that we never have to come back here again.

Had lunch here today. Food was excellent. Very authentic. Great atmosphere in a stunning location. Lots of herbs and veggies growing around the parking. I'm sure it will smell amazing once they all fill in. I didn't have any today but based on previous trips to the downtown location, the king cake is delicious. Also, I thought prices were pretty reasonable for very high quality food. I didn't look at the drink menu.  I can't wait to go back during crawfish season. I wish this place great success.

Food was great! We had reservations on Mother's Day and were seated within 5 minutes of arriving. Shrimp and Grits were so tasty! The waiter was great and very attentive. It was a packed house but we were treated like we were the only ones in the room.

Went here last night and was extremely pleased. Worked and lived around New Orleans for over 15 years and found Lola's new location to be as good as top eateries in The Big Easy. Atmosphere and service were excellent   Bronzed shrimp with grits was delicious, just the right amount of spice and consistency.

I've lived in Vegas for 4 years & I've been wanting to try Lola's since hearing about it/seeing the Charleston location. Since that location is a little far from our side of town, I was excited to try the new Summerlin location. My husband and his family are from Louisiana and I much prefer New Orleans cuisine over where my husband and in laws are from (sorry mom in law). However, I have to admit I was slightly disappointed in Lola's. 
First we ordered the crawpuppies. They were just ok, you only get 4 TINY crawpuppies and they are definitely NOT worth the over $5.00 they charge for them. For my main course I ordered the red beans and rice. It was good, didn't knock my socks off, but decent. Not enough sausage, although I could have ordered, and been charged for, extra sausage.
The thing that really irritated me was when we asked for ONE extra side of ranch dressing (cups were tiny) for my kids chicken strips we were told there was a charge for the ranch. The server apologized and was clearly embarrassed to have to tell us that because we all looked at her like, "you're kidding, right?" Now, is 50 cents breaking us? No. However, it's the PRINCIPLE here. I felt like I was being nickled and dimed. Most McDonalds' don't even charge for an extra side of sauce! 
I really don't know if I'll be back.

Went on spur of the moment and was excited to try some Cajun seafood. We had the catfish and soft shell crab. The catfish was great but the soft shell crab was delicious!  We also order a side of the Gouda grits...friggin amazing!  The bread pudding and the chocolate cake are worth a taste as well. I will go back for some more!
ONOLICIOUS!!! The first time I came here i tried the Jambalaya. So far, it's THE BEST Jambalaya I've ever tasted!!! It is a great place! The staff here are friendly and this place looks great!!

Being a southerner I was really looking forward to my first visit. The space, atmosphere and servers were great.  The food was hit and miss. The Bronzed Shrimp & Grits were very good. A nice mix of spice in the ragu and shrimp against the richness of the grits.  The Shrimp Po' Boy was okay but too salty. The Oyster Po' Boy was inedible because the oysters tasted so strong ( as in boardering on being spoiled). Fries were delicious.

Discovered this place by accident.....it was awsome! Shrimp and grits was the best I ever had.  Crab cakes were great, and the banana pudding was ridiculous! Top all that off with great service and atmosphere, this place is a winner.

Dining at Lola's is always a treat!   I celebrate special occasions here all the time.  Today, my friend specifically requested going to Lola's for her birthday lunch.   We enjoyed the crab cake appetizer, shrimp and grits, and the tasty beignets!   The service has always been very attentive. I love the fact Lola's is our little neighborhood restaurant here in the heart of Summerlin

Lola's Gouda grits and fried catfish filet.....I get both as sides ....are the best thing north of Louisiana . The catfish is crisp, sweet, and not at all greasy.
Red beans and rice are also excellent.  It's always hard to decide
Great food and really cool atmosphere. All the staff was very friendly and attentive.

It was my first time here and I must say I was pretty impressed. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our drinks never dropped below the half way mark either. I had the shrimp and grits with the andouille sausage on the side. I'm not a huge fan of creole style food. So when I tell you I enjoyed this place, take note. My friend had the fried shrimp platter. And whatever batter they fried the shrimp in, it was light and flaky. We topped it all off with the banana fosters bread pudding. While it wasn't bad, it was probably my least favorite. The bread pudding was a little too soggy for me. But again, it wasn't bad...just not to my liking. Anyway, I recommend this place, and I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

I have been to the original Lola's which has great food but I was not at all impressed with their service. But the new Lola's in summerlin was amazing. Loved the building and the fact that they show the LSU and Saints games. We went there for brunch and bottomless mimosas, the food and service was wonderful. Highly recommend this place to anyone who knows southern cooking.

By far best fish and grits anywhere!!!!!! We have all of our friends who come in to town eat at Lolas with us. My girl is the hot mixed girl here in yelp pics! If you want some amazing cajon eats you have to try lolas!!!! Amazing!!!!!!!

Food: Delicious
Service: impeccable
Prices: very fair
Ambiance: perfect

This place is legit.....go here!

Something's Missing.....

Was excited to try this place as it is near home and somthing different from the chain restaurants.  We went in around 5:30 PM on Saturday night.  It did not appear very busy, with only one other party in the "main" dining room, a few full tables on the patio and some guests at the bar.  Nice re-decorating of the old Ruby Tuesday's.  The hostess walked us right by 10 or so four tops to a small two top - 
(we are not small people).   I asked to be seated at one of the larger tables and was told, they were all reserved.  When I said: "Oh, really??" while looking at the lobby and the room, she said OK, I guess I can make adjustments.  Please note that during our hour plus time there, only 4-5 other parties came in....did ALL those reservations cancel?  Our waitress did arrive quickly, and took our drink order ( just water).  My husband ordered the fried catffish platter and paid for the upgraded sides of grits and red beans and rice. I ordered the Roast Beef Du Bres sandwich with just the gravy.  While waiting my husband asked me ift we get rolls or bread, and I said I guess not?  It took some time for the order to arrive.  Hubby loved the catfish and the grits, but the portions were a bit small for the price.  My sandwich was disappointing.  It really had a bitter flavor and the gravy was lumpy.  It was like a pulled pot roast with no seasoning.  I guess all of the other mayo, mustard, etc. might make it better, but I always have my sandwiches/burgers plain - I can really taste the quality of the meat that way.  I got the fries as my side, they were luke warm and a bit limp. So I won't order this dish again, sorry Triple D - not as good as I thought it would be.   We decided to try the desserts which we rarely order dining out as we are usually way too full.  We  had the sweet potato pie and the bananas foster bread pudding.  It took about 15 minutes for it to arrive and both were disappointing.  The pie was hot with way too many pecans on top - it was flat and stringing, couldn't taste the crust.  We both had a couple of bites and then left it.  The menu did not state it was served warm - would not have ordered it.  The best thing about the bread pudding was the ice cream and brown sugar topping - I would order that alone. The three pieces of banana were hard and the bread pudding was more like a piece of stale banana bread and pretty bland. 

While eating we noticed all of the other tables were brought a bread basket, some even before they ordered.   Earlier I had asked our waitress for future reference if we had to order bread or did it come with the meal?  She said, it came with "soupy dishes, like the gumbo".  OK, so  why did others with just sandwiches and those who hadn't even ordered gotten bread baskets?  ( I also noticed other reviewers raved about the bread that was brought out right when they sat down.)  I know this seems like I am making a big deal out of it, but I think she just forgot to bring it- why not say so and offer it?  Between this and the hostess, it seemed like a lot of excuses, making the customer feel like they are asking for too much???
The tab was $50 for a meal and a sandwich and two desserts.  The one big thing missing was the "hospitality" piece that makes guests want to return.  Funny, that we found this Friday night at another new spot we tried - they acted like they really wanted us to be there and come back. We will try Lola's again, as I know any can all have an off day - and hubby loved the catfish.  Maybe this time, the "missing" pieces ( seating, bread, seasonings, hospitality) will be in place!  I really hope so, as I WANT to like this spot.

Simply the best Cajon food this side of the Mississippi!  The choices were so good it was difficult to decide what to eat. After the meal we decided this would be one of our go to restaurants.  The food is flavorful, delicious and presented well. Service is fabulous.
Great tasting food and atmosphere just a bit overpriced for the amount of food given aside from that, I would have given it a 5 star
Great atmosphere.  Excellent beer selection.  Great staff.  I had crawfish ettouffe.  Owner was very personable. Will definitely recommend and return.

Lola's has an amazing environment and a great wait staff. We were cared for well. The food was a trip down memory lane of his 'Mawmaw's' cooking for my Cajun husband. Could not come with a stronger recommendation. Chandler took great care of us!

Average, at best.  Service is slow.  Servers are generally not efficient or overly polite.  Worst problem is everything is over-priced.  Plus usually the place is freezing cold and nobody seems to notice.  It's obvious that the owners do not pay much attention to their business operation.  Hush Puppy is a much better option with much larger servings and better prices, the only reason we occasionally try Lola's is because of its location.

Food is great, music on the weekends is a bonus. Usually great customer service. My only complaint is the menu lists one platter at $11.99 including two sides but if you choose a regular side and a premium side, you are charged full price for the premium side. So you may as well choose two regular sides and order the premium side a la carte.

** update: 05/27/18 you can no longer order red beans and rice as a side... 

**update number 2, the bread below looks like they cleaned the grill with it... burnt.. gray/green... I would've been embarrassed to set this in front of my customers. Also have been waiting 15 minutes for a drink ordered at the bar & it's no where in sight.. **once the food finally arrived (around 8:30 even though the restaurant was supposed to close at 8, we found out two chefs had just quit) I stopped eating my chicken half way through because my stomach hurt. My date finished his bronzed catfish and grits and even ordered the bread pudding. He enjoyed it. Later that night/5am he felt very sick. Neither of us ever actually got sick-sick but experienced extreme discomfort. I feel bad writing the review bc the staff were very nice and this used to be one of our favorite places but I honestly don't see myself going back here anymore.

Was skeptical with bad reviews but we live in the area and wanted Cajun.  Downtown location gets rave reviews so thought we would try it.  Greeting was friendly and seated right away.  Our waitress was all smiles, our beers on tap came right over as well as water.  On the table there is a sign reading "grand opening oct 21" and it is only Oct 15th.   I mentioned this to our waitress and she said they had had a soft opening and are still working out kinks and she acknowledged there were some.  Menu is great and priced right.  I had blackened salmon - cooked perfectly with choice of 2 sides (salad and grits).  My husband had the shrimp creole.  He thought it was a bit salty for his taste but then again he doesn't salt anything and he did eat the whole dish.  Desserts or pumpkin bread pudding to die for and sweet potato pie.  Lola - owner - came over to say hello and then when we were leaving made a point of asking us how everything was.  When an owner is out there walking around with her reputation on the line I am definitely impressed and have faith she will get this restaurant running smoothly.  I think we should all give this restaurant a chance.  We are wishing they make it.  It is a nice addition to this area of las vegas.   Our waitress said they had a nice happy hour as well as brunch on sat and sunday.
I think i love the Summerlin location  the best (buy both are great) Summerlin's location is a biy more spacious,  good is a bit more spicy, and yhe atmosphere is js awesome.

We left the hotel after a quick nap and headed out for a good meal. We were having a rather late dinner-8:45 p.m. We were staying on the Strip and were a little exhausted, suffering from very little sleep and a long commute from Cali. SO, we looked for something tasty and CLOSE to the strip and happened upon Lola's Charleston (outside of downtown) location. 

The results were great-my hubby had the Bronzed Shrimp and gouda grits and I had the blackened catfish, homemade fries and greens. My husband raved about his meal and I enjoyed mine too. However, I am a collard green lover, so if you order the greens keep in mind that they are turnip and mustards and you must like those types of greens. HUGE upside-they have peppered vinegar, just like home!  

Try this place with an open mind. I will go back to try several other things. Unfortunately, I was too full to try dessert, but the banana's foster looked tasty!!!! 

I liked the available parking lot and the ability to eat outside on the cute little patio if you chose.  There were families and couples dining when we arrived and everyone was so friendly. The service was GREAT-thanks Dianna!!!!!  We had assistance from the busboys as well. They scooped our plates up when we were finished (after asking politely if we were finished). As you can see from the empty plate they REALLY did not need to ask my hubby if he was finished! LOL!!!!
This place is fantastic ... Great people, great food all giving you the feeling you left Las Vegas.

So yummy! Such a cute hidden Gem tucked away in Summerlin!
Lots of great options for drinks and food. They have Happy Hour everyday EXCEPT Sunday!

Sorry, not a big fan. I had been to the original Lola's on Charleston where I had their shrimp and grits. That was amazing! My kids had chicken tenders then too. Surprised how tasty the tenders were. Could swear they were fresh and not frozen. Fast forward to the present. As a frequent visitor on foodie trips to New Orleans, I was excited to have that great cooking right here. Tried Lola's after they opened on Town Center a while back. Food was good, but I found their prices to be expensive relative for the amount of food received. I was disappointed. Revisited the place a month ago at happy hour. My overall impression was unchanged; service was adequate, food good, and drinks standard. This place is okay, but does not rate high on my list of places to return to as there are many other wonderful places to enjoy. Guess it's still the closest New Orleans cooking you're going to get in Vegas.

Shared poutine and bean/salsa dip with the hubby, and they were both very good. They use creamy gouda on the poutine, and that adds lots of flavors to the dish. 
We had the banana foster bread pudding and creme brûlée for desert. The bread pudding is served warm with ice cream, and it's a generous portion. It was delicious! Our friend had the white chocolate bread pudding (seasonal) and loved it. 
Overall, great experience. The place is clean, nice decor, and the service provided by Ashley was outstanding.
Love this place! The blackened catfish and Gouda grits is delicious and so is the bbq shrimp. Ask for Emily she is a great server with great recommendations. The fig dessert is on point!

Just a top tier dining experience. Excellent and attentive service by waitstaff, have recommendations and was friendly throughout the time we were there. Kudos to the chef and bartender for the amazing creations that blessed our table!! We had the mandarin salad with grilled shrimp, the blackened catfish platter, crawpuppies, and the Bronzed catfish and shrimp Grits. Along with all that we indulged in desserts of butter pecan ice cream, decadent chocolate cake w ice cream and a warm and sinful bananas foster bread pudding. Drinks enjoyed were the Hurricane and the addictive Southern Hospitali-Tea.
Great food.  Fast, attentive service.  Good prices.   What more can you ask for!

I think this is the best place to eat in Las Vegas!! If you want something like mom made in the kitchen. Please, please check out Lola's Kitchen... the locals really know where to go for great food!! The staff is great and Lola is there sometimes cooking herself!! 

Thanks for the great food and great service. 
Mr & Mrs Parker , San Diego CA

Had an amazing meal last night with wonderful service. Cocktails are pretty pricey, but that's my only complaint. The banana fosters bread pudding is to die for. Moscow mule was honestly the best one I've had. Loved this place and will be back for sure!!

Mother's day. We show up to eat at 10.30a even though they open at 11a on Sunday. We understand people are coming in at once. We were told 15 mins then was seated in 30mins. We are not placed together we are a party of 13 and are placed at 5 different tables. By the way there was a party of 6 next to us sitting at a table with 14 seats. They took our order we waited very patiently, received 1 refill then we needed to ask. Seated at 11.35a orders placed 1 of our guest asked for the manager being that now its 12.45p and STILL no food. Matt (the ? manager/supervisor) informes us it is busy and like it was a whatever moment. Then we are told by our server that the desserts are being comp. My cousin notice tables with bread and was told that we are to ask for bread. Our food arrives at 1pm! Some food was cold, some food never came!!!! AFTER all that we then waited for drinks and our bill. A family of 4 was seated by us as we watched they placed their drink order, brought them bread and food was provided within 23 minutes. I asked them if they requested the bread and was told no! Still no bill no communication from the supervisor worst experience ever!! Waited so long some of our party got up and left.... Wont EVER return again. WILL STICK TO THE NICE FRIENDLY CHARLESTON LOCATION!!!!!
Food was fantastic! Service was great! I had the gumbo and jumbilaya. Wine menu can use some work but the ambience was lovely.

This has to be one of the most disappointing meals I've had.  It certainly isn't real Louisiana food.  The portions were so small, the wine pour was tiny and the food had no taste - I had to put a lot of salt and pepper just to taste something.  What a waste of $.

Ok - nice place...clean appearance...nice staff...food was very good(greens were a little salty for me but I think most food is too salty anyway so don't go by me on this one)... we(6 people) ate around 2pm so not busy at all... The waiter had all the tables by himself which I believe he was handling ok... one minor suggestion would be to have someone help him with the drinks when seating people - do not wait for someone to ask you to take a drink order or at very least acknowledge the people at the table.... other than that it was a very positive experience...
Food was good.. Great selection on the menu and great selection of drinks. Incredible piano player there which provided some eating music. Restaurant is a good size especially for big parties.

Beware of take out menu misleading. We ordered the catfish plater from Lols's online menu. It stated three pieces, in which any person would think that you get three filets. Not so, in fact when we opened the containers at home we called the restaurant and we were told that "three is the number of pieces we cut one filet into".  And yes we spoke to the manager. Disappointed at such misleading menu.  Taste was okay but won't be eating here again, $14.99 for one filet and small sides.
Unique Louisiana style dishes right here in Summerlin. Service was great and food even better. Highly recommend if you like cajun cooking.
Authentic New Orleans cooking.  The gumbo and red beans is the best I've had.  Deserts are amazing. They know how to do bread pudding.  Wait staff are friendly and attentive.

Lola's has never disappointed. I love their grits!!! I order the bread pudding prior to dinner, it's just soooo yummy. The staff is beyond nice and really look after you. I am Highly recommending this restaurant. Tonight they even had live music.

Confusion and mediocre food. The only saving grace was our server - Kindra.
Our visit was on Feb 26, 2015. We have been to the East Charleston several times and loved it. We were looking forward to visiting this location for some time. When our city councilman scheduled a meeting there it was the perfect opportunity to go. Arrived an hour before the meeting around 5 for an early dinner.

I told the hostess we were there for the meeting and dinner....confusion.  She  then escorted us to a nice long (high) table in the bar area and said 'They are going to meet here'. No menu's. A server stopped by and asked why we were sitting there so I pointed in the direction of the hostess.....still no menus. The bartender asked us what we would like to drink and recommended the Hurricane. Asked for a menu and did not get one...he also asked why were sitting there. Mind you the place is empty at this point. Now there is a major discussion amongst the troops. Finally our server brought our drinks and whaa -la...menu's. BTW the drinks were horrible @ $10 each. Not even close to Pat O'Briens.  I asked if we should move. "No, No you guys are ok there."

Next to visit our table was the bar manager asking the same question. Ugh. We about had it with all this confusion. We ordered; Craw puppies..they were rather bland but saved by the dipping sauce ($5.29), a crab cake appetizer which tasted like tuna...no chunks of crab ($6.99), and finally to complete the misery Jambalaya which was so dried out and gummy. I think it was leftover and warmed in a microwave ($10.29, plus $4.29 for three shrimp) The dish did have nice seasoning and chunks of sausage (not cajun) but rather dried out.

Now the place is filling up and four additional folks were seated at our table. Which was fun at first...until the (older) gentleman started complaining out loud that he got there an hour early to sit at 'this' table. The two ladies that he was with were rather embarrassed. Guess who stopped by next? Lola. She stood by our table and asked if we were going to be done soon as there was a large party scheduled. I mentioned what had happened earlier and that we were questioned about our location. I also stated that most restaurants have a staff pre-shift meeting to go over specials, parties, meetings....etc so at least her hostess would know what was going on. We then ajourned to the meeting room and had a nice time with our city councilman. 

Our server was fantastic and the only saving grace for the evening. She knew the menu and visited our table several times. I did mention the 'food' and she offered to adjust the bill but we declined and just recommended that she speak to the cook. 

The final masterstroke of confusion was this; By the front door was a chalkboard announcing that there was going to be a dinner with a wine pairing featuring Lohr wines for somewhere around $30/person. Nice. I asked Lola on the way out what was on the menu for the affair. She did not know....."call back". 

The place is big with a nice bar. There is a grill where the servers prepare the garlic toast. The meeting room is large with easy access to the bar and dining area. 
Overall it's a typical Summerlin/Sun City/Denny's kind of place with marginal food but great service.

Sorry...but this location does not hold a candle to the east Charleston eatery.
BTW...the 'large party' was Purdue alums there to watch a b-ball game. 
Sorry for the confusion.....

I took my husband here for his birthday. We were really excited to finally be able to try it since we had heard good reviews. Unfortunately we did not feel the same way. The Gumbo reminded me of the beef gravy you get in a jar at the grocery store with 2 tiny shrimp thrown in. No chicken or sausage to be found.  My husband had the jambalaya with chicken and shrimp. It was mush. There were 3 shrimp and again we were hard pressed to find any chicken. Needless to say we both left without eating very much On a positive my husband did say he really liked their house made whisky and my sweet T was good. My husband is now requesting a do over on his birthday dinner at somewhere he might actually enjoy.
Can't say enough good things about Lola's. Great service, great atmosphere and some delicious food! Lola's is a must for anyone who has never tried the food here. I'll be coming back for sure!

Lola's is a hidden gem.  I have visited both locations and the food at both restaurants is worth the visit.  The Summerlin location has ample seating at all hours.  Regardless of what entree you get, the banana pudding is a must have after your meal.

We went to Lola's for crawfish.  It was simply great , just enough spice .  You order by the pound and it comes with the potato and corn .  My wife had the shrimp and grits ( she always gets that) and she enjoyed it as well.  End the night with bananas foster and chicory coffee in a French press. Great friends for dinner at a great place with awesome food

First off, our server Lisa was fantastic. She was really kind and patient, as it was our first time in. 
The bread they brought out (right as we sat down thank goodness because we were starving) was to dieeeeee for. Maybe I was just starving but dang it was good. 
I got jambalaya, which is one of my favorite things to eat. I hate to sya this but I didnt LOVE it, I liked it. It was just a tad dried and not super flavorful. Whatever. I'll try something else next time. 
On to dessert where it all ended well, it was GREAT. Love the apple bread pudding, so good. 
I will return.

Husband and I went there Memorial Day after 4:00pm and nobody had their A game on , when we got there; the hostess/ server was cooking Oysters on 1/2 shell on the grill and we got seated ordered the  1/2 doz oysters they were ok at least they were hot but we also ordered crab cakes  we were waited another 20 minuets no crab cakes re server kept saying they'll be right out we got tired of feeling like we were in the Twilight zone and couldn't get out we finally asked for the check !! That took to long too
We finally got the HELL OUTTA THERE!
We won't be back ever 
We're very glad we didn't order a full meal, I've never been in a
Louisiana restaurant that didn't offer Blackened anything chicken or shrimp or Catfish

I love the feel of this restaurant and appreciate the Cajun recipe's by Beth. Just walking up to this restaurant is amazing with their wide variety of vegetables and herbs growing outside the restaurant doors.

My favorite item on the menu is the mushroom ragout Gouda Grits. Honestly, I could eat them with any item on the menu. I usually get them with the Bronzed Catfish or the Bronzed Shrimp. People who are not from the South might wince just a little at the thought of having this southern porridge. I know, I understand - I dined with someone who couldn't withhold his grimace that I ordered catfish or grits. In spite of this, I managed to talk him into a bit of my food and won him over on the entire meal combination. 

If you have never had grits, it is ground-corn porridge with Native American roots. Beth takes this Southern meal and adds her unique mixture of diverse elements that include mushrooms.

The draw backs of this restaurant are: The hostesses like to cram everyone in a central location unless you request the bar area, as they close down sections of the restaurant seating when it is not a busy day. This is not always a pleasant feeling for guest that would like some quiet time or want to have a conversation. I personally don't like to sit next to overly loud people, yet their central room has a huge family picnic style wooden table that divides this central dining room. It glows with lights from above and is usually occupied by a large party/family that have to yell to be heard from one end of the table to the other. When, I asked to be moved to another location when seated near this table - I was told the other room was closed. This did not make me happy. Thankfully, I was quickly accommodated by my amazing server Aaron. Good save.

The restaurant also charges a "split plate fee" of $5.00, which is tacky. I understand the business end and reasoning, but it's tacky to read on a menu and personally not a good way to win over a newbie customer. Thankfully, I didn't see that before enjoying a couple meals at Lola's.

With that said, you must try their Fig Delight for dessert and fresh brewed sweet tea with your meal!

My boyfriend and I had thee worst experience here!! When we were finally seated we waited 30 minutes before I had to find the manager to take our order. We waited another 45 minutes. No drinks no food. I inquired about the status of our drinks and the server gave us much attitude!! JUST SAY NO NO to LoLo's. The worst customer service in town!!!!!!!!!!

I was not impressed with the service nor their food... The waitress was inattentive and the black eye peas not cooked well enough.. They were still hard... The crab cakes were full of breading.. The crab was not in chunks.. It was mixed heavily in the breading... The sweet potato pecan pie was bitter and not a lot of flavor... I can tell the potatoes were over boiled and chunky in the pie.. The pie crust tasted like it was pre-made and frozen... It had that odd taste to it... I'm a cook and I make all of these items homemade with a certain approach at home and I must say I do an excellent job.. By the way my husband  ordered the spicy chicken wings.. Not crispy but breaded with sauce doused in the wings... They were frozen wings that came out of the bag..
First time visiting and it won't be the last!  Besides the delicious cuisine, the hostess and waitress were very kind and knowledgeable of the menu!
Delicious and spicy! The crawfish puppies are yummy. The gumbo with shrimp is amazing and the gumbo is great! Worth every penny!
The gumbo and jambalaya were great. Service was also attentive, and the area is perfect for brunch. I would recommend if you're missing New Orleans and some of that good ol cajun.
Love this place and the atmosphere. Food is amazing and fresh. Had a soft crab po boy and was delicious.
I stopped into Lola's for a late lunch. Great Cajun style food. I had the Bronzed catfish (with added shrimp) and grits. Really great tasting flavor. Would definite eat there again.

Drive by this place daily and finally decided to give it a try.  Service was kind of slow but I chalked it up to it being slightly busy.  The atmosphere is nice, noise level was a little high which I like so I don't have to worry about my kids talking loudly.  The food was very good, love the jambalaya and the grits.  The chicken finger were kind of a weird texture and the fries were insanely grease, looked like they were at the bottom of a fry tray collecting all the loose grease.  I will be returning in the next week to try it again and will update my review if I feel differently.

Had dinner with the kids last night around 5pm. Nice setup and interesting modern Louisiana decor. Grilled French bread I guess was a nice touch. Food and service was great, server was accommodating to our pescatarian needs. Everything tasted and seasoned nice again to our requests. I would come back again, great spot to probably hang out in the summer time. Live music on Wednesday nights.
Horrible services!  Sat in a table for 15 minutes and ZERO services.  Not even a glass of water.  The restaurant was not even busy, 3 tables were occupied.

I always love coming to Lola's, this is the new location but I do prefer to go downtown location. We always start with the. Asked if bread, crab cakes and gumbo. I love the flavors they have in everything. I recommended the shrimp creole, I get it every time! For desert we get the Banana bread foster!

Went for the first time for brunch. My husband and I sat outside which was beautiful. We could hear the Saints fans cheering at the bar.

I had a delicious mimosa and shrimp & grits. That dish may be my new favorite thing anywhere! My husband had the jambalaya - also good - but I preferred mine.

The service was excellent, quite a few people out and about to help and our waitress was terrific.

First time visiting Vegas. I tried the char broiled oysters which were not freshly shucked. The oysters had a very muddy and aged taste I couldn't get around. The house seasoning on them was citric to say the least. 

The bronze shrimp and grits was very subpar . Though the shrimp was well cooked, the sauce for the grits was not cooked with the shrimp lacking that full flavor expected.  The grits was over cheesed believe it or not and completely changed the consistency of the grits along with flavor.

Lola's was recommended to me by a fellow coworker and I'm glad I took their advice! The prices are great and the food is authentic Louisiana style. I had the po' boy that was featured on Diners drive ins and Drives and loved it! Getting the New Orleans style bread pudding is also a must with the cream on top! The decor of the place gives it that New Orleans feel and the music was perfect. The staff was really nice!

Wow. 2nd time here and perfect experience both times!  Bartenders are excellent, food & drinks outstanding. Live music was excellent and the clientele was friendly and having a great time.  I will definitely be back to Lola's!!

Pure Heaven In The Salmon 

The Service Was A1. Ashley, Our Server/Bartender, Was Amazing!!! Definitely Ask For Her When You Come.
What a fun restaurant! They have a beautiful enclosed patio with cool air!! The food, service and atmosphere were excellent and we'll definitely be back!

I am an actual Cajun from actual Louisiana and came by here expecting another train-wreck, but I got food that tasted just like what I would get at home. Recommend the chicken and sausage gumbo and the crawfish etouffee.

The food was good but the portions were small. We started with the crawpuppies which were tiny but the Cajun aioli was delicious. I ordered the shrimp creole which was tasty but I have a hearty appetite. Finished off with banana fosters bread pudding. The portion was large and very satisfying.

Left a bad taste in my mouth. Went here 5pm Sunday drinks were fine, ordered wine and a beer and ambiance inside was nice. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. Husband ordered crab cakes which is his go to when available at a restaurant and said was one of the worst he had ever ordered. I ordered blackened chicken which comes with two sides. After checking list of sides I went for grilled veggies and beans and rice. Chicken was just ok, didn't taste any different than the Cajun spice you buy at the grocery story. Nothing special and definitely not restaurant quality. Up to this point I would give 3 or 3.5 stars.  Bill comes and I see if was charged $4 for an extra side. Assuming this is a mistake I let our server know who takes the check away apologizing that she will sort it. She speaks to Lola who tells her that it is correct, I ordered a premium side and I need to pay for it. I re check the menu and it said 'you may be charged extra for premium sides' which, fine. But don't send uninformed staff to tables for a normal order and not inform? Also.. how is paying full price for a side while not getting the two that I paid for fair at all? $4 is not the end of the world but it's the audacity and poor customer service that left the bad taste. I didn't receive what I paid for and was charged extra for something that was not clear. Wanted to return to try the poutine but forget it don't want to give them my business.

I took my husband here for Father's Day. Kendra was my server. I order bottomless Mimosa. My sever didn't provide me bottomless because of some weak excuse about only having 1 large container for the entire restaurant. I will not come to this location again. I live in Henderson and I drove on the other side of town to be provided with poor service. I tip accordingly to my service this will be a 5% tip. So disappointed. Oh and the food was not the greatest. So disappointed! Very Sad.
Love this restaurant. Excellent variety of Louisiana dishes and tastes. Wonderful place to relax and enjoy.
Good food - friendly service     The Cajun food was delicious.     The restaurant staff was attentive and the food was sooooo good

Awesome Soft Shell Crab! Easy atmosphere. and Comfortable environment.  Plus: Easy parking.  Service was friendly and good the food was so good + so much = no opportunity for dessert.
Price was fair and friendly. Menu had numerous appealing options.
I went there once again and its food is overprice for whatever can they get it out of . The staff is unfriendly unless you are of a certain type

This place is so amazing I'm writing this review while I'm still sitting at the table. Hurricane. Shrimp and Grits. And the Pumpkin Bread Pudding (seasonal). We will definitely be coming back here. Sooner than later.

Absolutely delicious! The gouda grits with Ragu is worth it to add on to any entree and the portions are perfect. Everything we ordered was delicious and their Moscow mule was strong  I also noticed that they have a small garden in the front where tomatoes and squash were planted. I wonder if they grow these for items on their menu? Either way I will definitely be back and bring more people to try the food.

I came to Lola's Summerlin on New Year's Day because the Downtown location was closed.  I absolutely love both locations now.  Summerlin is much larger than Downtown but both locations serve excellent food.  Every time I have gone to Lola's I have experienced good food and good service.  While all of the food is good my favorite is when they have the Crawfish, after this I love the catfish, gumbo, crab cakes, greens, crawfish balls and Etouffee and of course excellent bread.  This is my go to place every time I visit Vegas.

This was a delicious find. The place was packed when we got there so we sat in the bar. I still don't know what the restaurant area looks like, but the bar is very nice.

I got the fried chicken salad and I'm telling you...It was delicious!

We got some amazing cocktails as well.

Good place to bring friends or a date. It's kinda tucked away in summerlin, but worth looking for.
One of the best restaurants in Summerlin.  You cannot go wrong with the shrimp or salmon dishes.  They also have the best fettuccine alfredo in Vegas.

Friends had eaten at Lola's a few days ago, loved it and took us back last night.  They were right - Lola's is a great find in Summerlin.  Friendly staff in a family environment.  Lola was there, visiting each table.  The food was great and I had noticed that some of the produce is grown near the entrance to the restaurant.  Try to save room for dessert - I can see why Lola's Famous Bread Pudding is famous!

First time here for my birthday and I will definitely be returning.  My friend and I split the bronzed shrimp and grits and the soft shell crab po boy.  Shrimp and grits were to die for!  My son ate every last bit of the soft shell crab platter and my daughter enjoyed the fried shrimp platter.

Lola's is my FAVORITE restaurant in Vegas, bar none! The owner is a sweetheart, I Love her!
When anyone comes to Vegas to visit us, we take them to Lola's, they've all loved it too!! Usually we'd take them to the one on Charleston, but the new one is closer to home, both are great!
I'm going tonight, can't wait! 
What's GOOD?!
Catfish or Shrimp and Gouda Grits!! Damn!
Fried shrimp!! BOOM!
Gumbo..
Jambalaya...
Fried oysters...
All the sides...
Desserts..Ahhhh...the bread pudding...ohhWeeeeee!!!
I haven had anything at Lola's I DIDN'T Like!!!

Bronzed Catfish & Grits, Crab Cake, French Bread, Southern Hospitali Tea, Shot of Tequila w/pineapple juice back aka #Lunch

I treat myself to lunch at a new spot at least twice a month & today Lola stole my heart..

When you visit a restaurant you're paying for time convenience and great service otherwise you'd cook at home and deal with yourself. Usually my experience at Lolas is ok nothing spectacular but today the energy was off. I asked for a table for 3 and the host asked if we'd like to sit at the bar, it wasn't busy so we did not understand why she asked that. That was odd. I told her no and we sat down in the dining area. We sat down a few minutes before 2 and by the time the waitress came it was 2 on the dot and unlimited mimosas were over. We didn't complain and ordered the mimosas a la carte. There was a mistake with the mimosa order and I joked with the girl who brought them out that she can give me two pineapple mimosas for the price of one after she insisted the order was correct,  and she returned a rude face and smart remark. The energy was so OFF in this place especially for it to be a non busy Sunday. Lolas usually delivers ok to good service but there are far too many restaurants in Vegas for me to spend money at a place that has many employees not delivering great customer service at once.

The food was good as usual. I ordered the shrimp and grits.always a good choice. 
Kelly I believe her name was Kelly was the most friendly. I would prefer her (the waitress) to bring my drinks rather then someone who is rude and looks unhappy especially when the customer isn't complaining about the mistake that was made.

This place was amazing! We went for crawfish and we were 2 days two early, they were not available for purchase, we were all very sad but Lola came out talked with us and brought us a pound of crawfish! So Good, and such a nice thing to do! Restaurants could learn a thing or two from Lola! Please if you are in Vegas do yourself a favor and visit one of the two locations in Las Vegas!

If you only order one thing, order the poutine (gravy fries) - usually only available during happy hour, but oh so good! We ate them so fast, I forgot to take a photo!

Other recommendations - the roast beef d'brees (featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, one of my fave Food Network shows). Basically a roast beef sandwich smothered in gravy. Can you tell I'm a fan of gravy? Lol

Also the Shrimp Charlotte, which was incredible! The sauce was not too rich or heavy, but still very flavorful.

All I can say is EXCELLENT.  I found this place on Open Table the night before Valentine's Day.  What a find!  Authentic Cajun food with a New Orlean's environment.  Plenty of ambiance inside, but if the weather is accommodating, I recommend the patio----beautiful.  The food was excellent, we were a party of 3 and each ordered something different, every dish was very tasty.  Waffles and chicken, strawberry and cream begniets.......yumm....Excellent service and a bit of live music as well.  I think of this place as a best kept secret----enjoy!

This place was hopping when we went on a Friday night! They had live music playing and with a comfortably full bar and dining room, it really felt like a party. I would definitely recommend getting reservation, though, if you're planning on showing up on a weekend night. The food was tasty and budget-friendly. They have a pretty big happy hour, too, which is worth checking out. I didn't order seafood, though, and felt like the non-seafood still tasted pretty fishy. I'm sure it's all cooked right there together, and I didn't mind it too much, but if you're allergic or hate the taste of the sea, I don't think this would be a good option.

So glad that Lola has opened a second branch in Summerlin.  Bigger space compare to downtown location. Great service.  Great food.   The BBQ shrimp reminds me of my aunts recipe- she lived in Nawlins for years.
Awesome atmosphere, food and service!  Highly recommend the mamas beans and rice, crab cakes and artichoke dip with garlic bread!  Great wine list.

Great ambiance. The food was quite tasty but the portion size, for the price, is ridiculous. Had the BBQ shrimp, 5 tiny shrimp for $17.99 and the craw puppies, so yummy but only 4 and the size no bigger than an olive. Left wanting more but not willing to pay for it.
My husband's family is from Louisiana so he is a tough  critic....And he says it was the most authentic he has had outside of Louisiana...leave room for the bread pudding it is the best!

Food was okay, nothing really stood out.  I had the catfish po'boy and it was really skimpy on the fish and dressing.  I've ordered this before at the Charleston location, and it was really good and "loaded".  My husband ordered the platter, nothing was terrible, but nothing to call home about.  The kids all had fettuccine Alfredo with either blackened chicken or blackened shrimp.  They enjoyed the food.  The fried okra was really good.  For what we paid, would have rather gone to another restaurant and really enjoyed the food.

One word, AMAZING! 

Christine W. and I were meeting up for dinner and decided on Lola's after reading the reviews. We made a reservation just to be on the safe side but when we walked in the place was virtually empty, we were seated in a matter of seconds so that was great.

Items Ordered:
Gumbo ($4.79)
Bronzed Shrimp and Grits ($16.99)
Bananas Foster ($7.99)

I started off with a cup of gumbo, it was very thick, hearty, and flavorful with a good amount of chicken, sausage, and shrimp. After finishing the gumbo I moved on to the shrimp and grits,it is definitely a must try, I really enjoyed it. I'm not a huge fan of grits but they really do know how to make them right here, they tasted like gritty mashed potatoes with cheese. We ended our meals with the bananas foster which was good but too bitter for my liking. 

I can't wait for my next visit to Lola's. The food was great, the staff was very courteous, and our waitress was attentive and helpful. I think Lola's is as good as it gets in Las Vegas for cajun/creole food.

My second time here. Their food is fantastic. If you like Creole food the you will love this place. Today the couple next to me asked if it was my first time here, then told me they were from New Orleans and this was a piece of New Orleans in Las Vegas. That being said, I've only been through Louisiana once so I have very little to compare to.  However, authentic or not, their food is delicious. The employees are extremely friendly and the ambiance is nice.

I was in town for business last week, came in Monday night (boss remembered it from previous trip) and enjoyed it so much we brought clients back Thursday. 

It's a great place out of the way, service was excellent (Ruth, you're wonderful) and the food.....I think between all of us we tried almost every dish on the menu except oysters. 

My boss grew up in Mississippi and one of the clients was from Louisiana, they both thought it was on spot and loved it. My favorites were the BBQ shrimp, the grits (I could eat by the bucket), and you have to save room for the banana bread pudding with bananas foster on top. I had mine with a coffee stout of some sort (sorry, bad with beer names) that worked perfect with the food. 

The best part was we had a friend from Switzerland with us and it was his first time having any of these dishes, he doesn't eat seafood (I know, right?!) but he was enamored with the grits. 

This is on my must visit list any time I got to Vegas now.

Heard about this place Lola's from a golf buddy, so I decided to try it. I made a phone order for two pounds of crawfish and Jambalaya.  When I arrived to pick it up, they weren't aware of my order. Apparently, I called the other location. I asked the hostess if she can call to cancel it for me, since this Town Center, Summerlin location is nearest and it's almost closing and she obliged. 

After waiting a few minutes, food was well packaged and I excitedly took it home.

Crawfish was so salty, it made me shiver! I couldn't get it down. I tried to avoid the seasonings on the outside, but the salt was well within the meat! It was so disappointing, especially since I ordered two pounds.

The Jambalaya was pretty mediocre, especially for the price. But I did agree to extra sausage.

Never again.

If I only was allowed to eat one meal for the rest of my life, it would definitely be their Bronzed Shrimp and Gouda Grits with andouille sausage and mushroom ragout.  I'm not even lying,  those grits alone are the stuff of legend!  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and a super cute place for date night or brunch.....aside from the bizarre experience we had on Easter Sunday, where we legitimately had to wait 20 minutes (yes, I timed it)  to receive so much as a glass of water and another 10 minutes to order because only 1 poor very pregnant waitress was literally taking the orders for half of the restaurant while a million bus boys and other staff literally wandered around the dining room.  I actually had to flag down one of the bus boys just to get us glasses of ice water and ask if we could please order our food.  Eventually, the food did finally come and I was able to eat my grits and be happy again.  This was by NO means the poor waitress's fault and she apologized all over herself and was incredibly sweet.  She even took the chicory coffee off of our bill because, for the first time ever, it was actually horribly bitter.  Usually, it's delicious.  I have no idea what happened that afternoon with the bizarrely slow service and gross coffee, but every other time has been so excellent that I will not hesitate to return.  I need my grits fix every few months!  And don't hesitate to order their bananas Foster bread pudding!

Stopped on a Saturday after a beer festival. The staff was accommodating for our moderately sized group. The food arrived quickly and tasted as good as it looked. A little slice of heaven tucked away in Summerlin
Don't order the chicken strips.  Smallest portion ever for 10$.  Menu also needs more diversity
Please please open a restaurant in SD, CA! It's been a few months and I'm still thinking about the Gouda grits and shrimp I had! Oh my goodness

Can somebody say, "Coon ass"? Holy Atchafalaya River Basin! In my travels, I always Google the haunts of Guy Fieri's Triple D, and found the downtown Lola's location. Unfortunately it's Christmas Eve, but some folks hanging out front told us to go to the Summerlin location - and I'm glad they did, because this East Texan who knows Louisiana cooking misses this food. I've been out of my element too long. Char-broiled oysters on the half, low country greens, smokey Gouda grits and an Oyster Po Boy dressed for Fat Tuesday...washed down with a Dixie Blackened Voodoo...can't wait to come again!

Pretty good.  We have always eaten at Lola's on Charleston but they were closed on Mother's Day.  I ordered Gumbo, which was excellent but my dinner was disappointing.  My friend Catfish was watery not crispy as usual.  My husband loved his poor boy.

We started with Artichoke Dip, followed by Shrimp Jambalaya, Gumbo and I had soft shelled crab and greens! We also shared a bread pudding with Jim Beam sauce! We saw Lola's on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! I've never hesrd so much moaning during a meal!!It was a pleasure meeting Lola too!! Very nice touch  greeting your guests!

Going against your initial ordering instinct will get you every time! The Summerlin location of Lola's is beautiful- much nicer than the one downtown. Think upper crust New Orleans rather than Bourbon Street. Service was attentive as well.

But my Shrimp Po Boy ($12.99)  was a misstep, unfortunately. The bread was fine, there was enough shrimp (although the sandwich as a whole was a bit on the small side), but it was super salty. Not spicy, just salty. The tartar sauce even was salty. I definitely should have gone with the catfish and grits, as was my original plan. 

The bread basket was good, warm and buttery, so that was at least pleasant. Despite the po boy,  I'll return, but just will order something else.
 
Perhaps just an off day... Eaux.
By far the best option for Creole cuisine. My favorite is the Shrimp Charlotte. Ask for Lola when you come. Good chance she is here to visit!

This is my second time visiting this location and I love and highly recommend the fish and grits dish it is their best item along with the crab cakes. I had reservations and when I arrived the hostess seemed busy and said it would be an hour wait however because I had reservations she would do her best to fit us in, we waited and waited and waited  after 30 minutes past our reservation time and no acknowledgement or keeping us informed of why my reservation wasn't honored we decided to sit in the bar and have dinner there (something the hostess could have also offered).  My disappointment is that is customers are valuable and our time is valuable simple suggestions, options or better communication could have made our experience better during our last visit.  I will return again because I love the food yet I am not not a RAVING FAN of their service and respect for my time.

This is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!!!  Service needs to improve slightly but the food makes up for it. Sunday brunch is not as extensive as the regular menu but still offers many selections.

Food was just ok.  I had much better at shanihan in forest park,Illinois 
Service was great and that's why I give it the extra star.
Would I got back ? Probably not.

I moved to Las Vegas about 5 months ago and needed a place to watch the Saints play. I'm glad I found Lola's! James is an excellent bartender along with the complete staff who brings out our food! James often recommends different types of drinks and they have not disappointed! The food is awesome as well, I do wish they had a happy hour or some sort of specials during Saints game though.

First dine-in experience:   Hostess was friendly & engaging. We chose to sit in bar area for happy hour & time restraints. Bartender abruptly approached to card my daughter ( 29yrs old), commented on her age then asked what we were drinking. Never said hi, even though I looked at him and said hi, just waited for my daughter's id then left.  Five minutes later I approached the hostess, explained to her it was our first time here, didn't know if someone was coming to take our order, if I had to go up to the bar ? She walked over to bar area, bartendar showed up shortly after that. Food was prompt, cup of gumbo lacked decent flavour. Shrimp in gumbo looked of the frozen variety, roux without flavour, okra cooked to that consistency which makes people not like okra. Asked another server passing by for check. Proprietor walked around chatting with patrons, but said nothing nor smiled at us. That is rude behavior in the eye of a dining, paying patron.  The hostess opened the door for us as we left, thank you. Her's was the best service we had from here. Did not feel welcomed. Will not return. The stars are for the Hostess.

I had heard rave review about this place and checked it out for lunch and we both got the Roast Beef from DDD, thinking it would be the best thing on the menu and it was just fair, especially with all the hype.  The place was clean and the service was good and the sides were really good-We got one order of fries and one order of grits ($2.99 extra).  I would give this place a try again, but not my favorite place is summerlin.

I can honestly say never been to Louisiana but since the day went too the original Lola  on Charleston. I feel like jumped on plane right on to bourbon street. Just soaking all the finest things the Big Easy has too offer especially the FOOD! Lola she all about keeping too her creole background and sticking with traditional fare but doing it right way from family secrets passed on from one generation to the next. The original location I have been couple times always end up going with one of the Po-Boys. Too DIE for and the most legit ones find in Vegas hands down!! So hearing that they opened second location one much closer on my side of town. Excited! 

Second location sometimes have my doubts. I always think about "is bigger always better". You start to lose focus on the things that made you popular in the first place and consistency of the food more locations add. Lola not only small restaurant but great story (one that featured on triple DDD). I love seeing small business owners successful. Right off the top from the moment walked in the vibe, and everything about the interior design screams at you Big Easy. It has the old school colonial look all around, they have area that assume all clams or oysters on ice shuck fresh too order, the bar area think really nice with the brick back splash look to the many widescreen televisions around it, different chairs around the bar area from bar stools to chairs, piano in the bar area (I went for lunch no one playing but assume they do have live music), and NO doubt part of Lola personal taste not miss. She big Saints fan. Dah! You have big Drew Bree artwork. There this shelf near the bar but it feels more like bookshelf at home.
