Here you have the little things from the mardi gras masks, beads, jars of candy, and all these little almost personnel items. Just the patio area kind of small but had so much personality. They have big oak barrels around, plants, and not just tables outside in open space. Heck you even looking out through window out on the patio area. Just the theme throughout the restaurant got lot of personality but everything that great about the Big Easy. 

The food was awesome!!!! Like I said had my doubts. The Po-Boy went with the Roast Beef. The last time had the soft shell crab. I wanted to knock another one off the list. The bread with any sandwich make or break point for me. Po-Boy had so many imitations that once have the real thing never take step back. Lola is the only place get my Po-Boy on not place comes remotely close. Not just one thing but the BREAD really stands out for me. She gets it shipped in just for the sandwich. It not only the perfect compliment but could get bread all day long. The Roast Beef talk about lot of food. Messy. But nothing better then having the drippings from the beef, sauce, and some hot sauce icing on the cake. It finger licking good. I started with cup of gumbo. Perfect starter! Loved the fact both restaurant felt like the food was consistent. All the things that loved about the first one still are at the original and now the second location. Lola never meet owner that friendly, upbeat, and this passion for food not only saw on the show but in real life. She just happen be sitting at the bar area when I had lunch. It refreshing see owner go around check up on customers and asked my thoughts on my Po-Boy. No doubt plan on coming back again again..

Went there pre dinner as reviews say it gets quite busy at dinner hours. Ordered the char broiled oysters and was somewhat disappointed as the oysters were small and still connected to the shell, for the price..2 bucks an oyster, it would have been nice to not have to use the little 3 pronged fork and tear the heck out of the oysters. I ordered the Bronze catfish and grits which was also raved about. The cajun catfish was good and spicy but the gouda grits were over cooked not like the southern grits I am used to. Randee, our server, was excellent.  One more note, happy hour drinks prices are only given at the bar, what is that about?

Very disappointing.   We read from previous reviews that the service was questionable.   Well that was true.  Waitress approached us 10 minutes after being seated.   The beverage menu was presented in a vanilla folder with stains on the pages.   When my wife asked for a glass with her beer, the response was we don't have any clean glasses but I will do what I can to find you one.   A clean glass was delivered several minutes later.  About 30 minutes after sitting, we had not yet received any food, so the waitress asked if we wanted some bread to tide us over.   When dinner was finally served, 5 of the 6 people in our party expressed how salty (I mean way over salted) the food was.  Lola came out to our table to ask how the food was and we told her ... salty, very salty.   Besides having slow service, the wait staff seemed confused as if they were out of sync.   Sorry but I will not be going back, too many things went wrong and the food quality was only OK.

My sister sings along with the pianist sometimes. She's a grown adult, so that shows that they'll go along with most anything. It's my first time having good shrimp and grits in awhile. They grow their basil fresh, they're trying their best to grow tomatoes in Las Vegas, and you can tell they value freshness. The patio is lovely, the staff is kind, Lola herself is often telling fun stories at the bar. One time I went and someone with us had just been through some insanely difficult life events, but we were all sitting under a giant umbrella, trying each other's meals, singing along to 40s hits, having a blast. It's a nice little escape with real good food.

Went there for Saturday lunch and the place was empty.  Should've gave me a hint.  The jambalaya was terrible.  Seemed like it was made out of canned tomato sauce and rice was hard.  Ice Tea was warm.  Not compared to Lola's at Charleston.  Chicken Strips were hard.  Fries were over salted.  Waiter never checked on us.  Burger was okay.
And the HOSTESS was sooo kind and sweet! Young blonde girl forgot to catch her name but she was so helpful always smiling! She was awesome with my to go!

I have been eyeing this place for a very long time! 

I'm no expert on New Orleans food or anything but I have heard from friends this place is worth a try. 

When we walked in for lunch it was empty and so of course we were seated right away. The server we had very nice and friendly. I forgot his name and its killing me! 

The place is very clean and uniquely decorated. 

My boyfriend and I tried the crabcakes and a cup of gumbo all to share. The crabcakes were tasty with lots of lumps of crab. The gumbo however was very very good! I enjoyed the flavor a lot. They served it with the grilled garlic bread which I liked a lot. I really didn't want to share the gumbo with my bf because I could finish one by myself. 

For main dishes, I got the jambalaya and he got the catfish with green beans and potato salad. The jambalaya was really good and lots of andouille sausages which is so yummy!  My bf dos enjoy the catfish and it wasn't fishy at all but we opted to get it pan seared with their Cajun seasoning, and we both agreed we prefer catfish deep fried. The sides we just ok to me nothing to rave about. 

The service is excellent, they were constantly tidying up our table of empty plates. The server even gave us sweet teas to go when we were leaving. 

Coming back for sure just to try the oysters!
Bad customer service and over priced mediocre food. The owner is rude, I'm assuming it's Lola, if not my apologies to the actual owner.

Last night my wife and I went to Lola's for dinner and were basically refused service.   We arrived at 8:32pm and waited at the front to be seated, after a few minutes one of their people came up and told us if we wanted to eat we would have to eat at a small table in the bar or at the bar that they stopped seating people at 8:30.  I told him that the closing time on the door was 9:00pm nothing about 8:30 and that we wanted a table.  BTW there were people still eating in the dining area.  He refused to seat us and escorted us to the door.  Lola's is across the street from where we live and it is unfortunate that because of poor management they have lost another loyal customer.

My tastebuds are telling me 2 stars, but it could be a 3.

I went to Lola's for brunch a couple of weeks ago. The decor is... random. It was if I was walking into my great Aunt Sally's house who had inherited chairs and tables from thrift shops, garage sales and family members. Maybe that's the theme they were going for?

I was really underwhelmed by their menu selection, but per the waitresses suggestion, I settled on the catfish and grits. I have never had grits in my life, but cheese and starch didn't sound terrible. The catfish and sausage ragout were amazing. The only thing standing in the way of my appetizing dish were those nasty cheese grits! They tasted like salty baby food, just awful!

Service was unmemorable. The portions was pretty small for $16.99, but did I really want more cheese grits? Nope! I hear the bananas foster chicken and waffles is good. I'll try that next time.

Came here with my husband, 8 year old and my inlaws came here for dinner. We are new to Vegas and we were excited to find New Orleans inspired cuisine. 

Everyone at our table enjoyed their entrees. I had the jambalaya. It was full of flavor. The others had red beans and rice, chicken strips, sweet potato fries and catfish. 

I'd like to point out that my sons chicken strips were very good. Tender breast (white meat) with a nice crisp outside. 

We all shared the banana foster/bread pudding dessert. It was warm, not too sweet and the perfect ending to our nice evening. 

I would recommend this restaurant and we are looking forward to coming back for brunch to try their beignets.

We loved this Cajun gem. Had a WONDERFUL watermelon salad, oysters, jambalaya and roast beef Po' Boy. All were great. Wait staff were very friendly, knew their menu well and attentive to our needs. Couldn't ask for better.

Were new to Vegas, part time residents, we are so excited we found this Cajon delight! We ordered the crab cake appetizer, it was amazing! I ordered the bronzed shrimp with the grits and sweet potato fries, all of it was the best Cajon combo I've ever had. My friend ordered the etufie with shrimp and craw fish and rice, also awesome and delicious! We even meey Lola the owner very impressive she cares about her resturant and created the menue and recipes! We will be back! Wish to try the down town location next time!

We had been to the original one downtown but  this was our first trip to this one. Loved the Crawpuppies as an appetizer. The wife had the catfish platter. Loved it. My choice was the jambalaya. Plenty of meat and very tasty. Atmosphere was upbeat and NOLA style. I would definately recommend to anyone in the Vegas area.

Originally visited once two summers ago and returned for the first time the other night since my previous visit. I can't remember the first visit very much, but I do remember leaving satisfied and enjoying our meal.

This time, I was a little disappointed in the quality of the service and food. Our table ordered oysters, bread, the shrimp and grits, a po' boy, and jambalaya. The food was all okay, but service was SO SLOW. It wasn't necessarily the server's fault- she had a gigantic party and multiple tables with very little support. Not sure exactly what was going on, staff wise. We were starving and didn't receive any bread until our entrees came out (not that bread will make or break your experience, we were just hangry) and our drinks were slow to be refilled. We had to ask for utensils and napkins, but again that's just a nuisance, not a deal breaker! We ordered dessert- the banana bread pudding and the chocolate bread pudding. The banana bread pudding was great, but the chocolate bread pudding was just okay- the vanilla ice cream was the highlight of the dish (interpret that however you'd like).

This is an okay interpretation of NOLA-style cuisine outside of NOLA itself, but I've definitely had better. Maybe I'm just a snob because I've been wined and dined in NOLA, I don't know!

We came to Lola's tonight for dinner, it was actually the 2nd time coming here but the first time we sat at the bar for dinner. Before I get to the food I have to mention our bar tender Dominic he was f-ing awesome you have to come see this guy. He let us try this port wine that definitely exceeded our expectations, we are actually a bit of wine snobs. Although I wasn't drinking this night my other half ordered a Moscow mule that was made to perfection, outside of the drinks and awesome service Dominic just has a great personality. For dinner we both ordered the fried catfish platter with the same sides of green beans and red beans and rice which was cooked to perfection. This is a really good place to come to in Vegas for southern Orleans style food.

Ive been wanting to try this place for a long time now after doing so was not happy at all i ordered the crab cakes with the hot wings the wings were great crab cake was horrible my friend tried the shrimp an grits i had to get a quick taste an yes that was horrible also an portions were very small for the price but a 10+ for the wings .....

Just opened, I will give them them the benefit of the doubt cause there other counterpart on charleston, not as good service could be better, layout is nice, ordered the burger, fries where great burger was burnt on the outside despite ordering med well, either they over used a blow torch or didn't clean the stove.

Great food! Last night participated in the wines du jour! Got to sample the Oysters! The grits with shrimp ! Well just look at my pictures they are as yummy as the food! Met Owner/chef Lola and she is very aware of what everyone was doing! Great chef will be back!

The food is par to sub-par in quality. It was sloppy and rushed and in no way memorable. We were excited to have a nicer local restaurant so close by, but this was so blah-I don't know I would be back. 
However, the banana pudding was pretty good-I'd try that again but nothing else to write home about.

I'm editing the review because my neighbors went and got food poisoning. Not a neighborhood gem, more like a dive with sub-par food. Beware!

Love this place! A must visit every time I come to Vegas. You need an Uber or Lyft to get here but it is definitely worth the trip. Try the gumbo,  and the red snapper and grits and you wont  be disappointed. The drinks are good too.

How we managed to get lucky enough, to have a place like Lola's right up the street from where we live, I'll never know. I'm also smart enough to know not to question it - just to be grateful and reap the benefits whenever we can.  And we DO!

The staff is as warm and friendly as the food is out of this world.  No matter WHAT it is you're getting, may I suggest one of the most heavenly side dishes you will ever eat...the Gouda Grits with the mushroom ragout.  Chef Lola was inspired by the divine when she whipped up that one.  It's not just good enough to spread onto a shoe and eat; I jokingly told her once that if I ever hit big money at one of the casinos, I want to fill up a bathtub with it and just dive in!!!

As for the other dishes, this is authentic Cajun/Creole-style cuisine.  I can remember having this kind of food when I was in 'Nawlins' last, so prepare yourself accordingly.  If you prefer your food on the milder, even blander side, this probably is NOT the place for you.  Though as far as my experience goes, nothing here is spicy enough to send you to the ER.  But this ain't bowls of Cream of Wheat, either. 

My typical meal there always starts with the Hot Crab and Artichoke dip.  Served with the freshly grilled Garlic Bread, the creamy, salty goodness of the Dip, with hearty chunks of lump crabmeat and tender artichoke pieces is hard to go wrong with. I usually pair that up with the spicy, savory Crawpuppies.  To be honest, dealing with the real 'crawdads' freaks me out more than a bit, so it's nice that they infused the sweet, briny meat into these perfect spheres that marry it with a really good hush puppy recipe, served with a tasty aioli dipping sauce. 

My favorite go-to for the 'Main Event' has become the boneless chicken breasts, which you can have one of four ways.  Mine is usually Blackened (with outrageous Cajun spices) or fried, with a choice of two sides. I would strongly suggest the aforementioned, nectar-of-the-gods Gouda grits, and the Low Country Greens, seasoned to a level that ALMOST rivals your Mama's. (And if it does, you already KNOW BETTER than to admit it!) The Country Potato Salad is also guaranteed to bring tears of joy to your eyes. But one of those two paired with any of the stunning veggie or french fry offerings will give you a tasty meal to remember.

And to insure that it stays in your memory banks for a good little while, save room - even if it means taking doggie bags with you - and go for one of Chef Lola's positively sinful desserts. 

I shouldn't - and won't - list the sins I might be willing to commit, for another taste of that Bananas Foster Bread pudding.  The Bananas Foster and the Bread Pudding, separately are enough to make your stomach do the happy dance.  But COMBINED? If they served it at a NATO "peace summit", who knows? We might actually HAVE world peace, and Lola would be up for a Nobel Prize! And don't forget to pair it with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 

Running a close second to that is the Fig Delight, a sumptuous serving of sweet, baked bodaciousness that came THISclose to unseating the BFBP as the ruler of my heart. Also good with that ice cream.

To sum it up, one visit to Lola's will tell you why we, and so many other people, have become regulars.  Nobody else in the Valley or outside of it is doing food like this, and we wish for a long and happy run for this restaurant...and plan on continuing helping it along that journey!

Very poor service. Unless you know the manager and/or staff, do not bother going to this location. Unless you somehow enjoy mediocre service. Went with my mom and was instantly disappointed by the absence of warm, sincere service. Bartender randomly appeared and demanded my ID, then left. No greeting. Manager looked right at us but was as friendly as a rock. Only those that seemed to have prior relationships with staff were treated well.

Food was nothing to write home about. Sweet potato fries were good, but anyone that makes poor sweet potato fries has a problem. Mom ordered gumbo and was sorely underwhelmed, as it lacked flavor. Nothing created a mosaic of stirring, breathtaking flavor in our mouths. 

But above all, service was a fatal blow to the visit. Trust me-you can get far better service from the guys at the Burger King right outside the door.

I am not a New Orleans transplant, and I don't know anything about what good cajun/creole is "supposed" to taste like, so all I can do is tell you that the three of us enjoyed what we had. One of the three of us lived in N.O. thirty years ago and he thought the food was pretty good so that might mean something. Garlic bread--plentiful, but not very buttery or garlicky...not really a hit (except it was inexpensive). Catfish PoBoy--I wouldn't eat catfish if you paid me, but my friend with the N.O. background enjoyed it, and my wife sampled the fries and reported them to be good. Shrimp Creole--wife liked it, I didn't try it. Jambalaya (with added shrimp)--I liked it--good amount of meat, and a nice taste with some blackened-like flavor. Mr N.O. tasted it and said it was good, so that might mean something.

The real hit in my book was the dessert. The fig delight was WONDERFUL.The fruity fig taste elevated every bite. That dessert I would confidently and happily recommend to anybody.

First time. Food was good. Service was good. Nothing to brag about. The price for 2 people was about average. Cajun/Creole comfort food was a nice addition to Summerlin. We had the popular Catfish and Grits which was really good. Enjoyed the piano player in the bar area.

What a horrible experience. We made reservations for a birthday party and waited well over an hour for our food. Rude and unattentive waitress. When we asked to speak to a manager she brought out a man in a t-shirt and apron that pretty much intimidated us into paying the full bill even though they provided us with a very bad experience. Have been to the one downtown and this location before and due to this incident will never be back.

Outstanding, service and atmosphere!  We had the gumbo to start and my husband enjoyed the Seafood Platter with the Soft Shell Crab added and I feasted on the Jambalaya with extra sausage and shrimp.  The food was seasoned to perfection!  Just the right amount of spice without burning my tastebuds.  Truly loved the piano bar and after dinner we enjoyed time in the bar just relaxing to the great music!  This local gem is perfect for foodies, couples & families!

I don't know. To be fair I was disappointed. I was so excited so maybe that's part of it. 

The good - the grits. They're very good. My wife had the shrimp and grits which was excellent. The side of grits with cheese that my mom had with the oysters was also good. 

The great - the service. All of the staff busted ass. They were attentive and polite. 

The bad - the gumbo was very over salted. So was the shrimp po boy which is what I had. 

For all the good reviews I was left missing Chicago and a place called heaven on seven.

I got the Spicy BBQ Shrimp. You get a total of 5 shrimp for $12.00. It had absolutely no taste except heat. My husband liked his Po' Boy. It was pot roast with gravy on a bun. The two best things were the bread and my Colorado Bulldog.
Sooooooooo this place is amazing!!! That Shirmp Po Boy is delicious. Highly recommend and will repeat!!

My #1 tip, you have to try the bread here! I have never have bread this good before--it's soft, crispy, and perfectly seasoned. If all restaurant had this bread, I would be so happy. Please try the gumbo, it goes really  well with the bread. I believe the name of the dish I got is called Bronzed Shrimp and Grits. The shrimp was packed with flavors and perfectly seasoned, it went well with the grits. The portions here are very generous! Our waitress was also very friendly and helpful. I'm really glad I got to try this restaurant this time in Vegas!
I love this place! Everything is delicious and the staff are great!! The grits are sooo creamy and the catfish is always cooked to perfection. They truly know how to bring Louisiana to Vegas !

The food is outstanding and the service is great!

However, the servers looked more like homeless people. Unkept hair, tatoos all over the place, unshaven faces and dirty clothing.  It makes you wonder how often they wash their hands and what the kitchen looks like. 

I'll give it one more try in a couple of weeks and If things haven't changed, I won't go back.

Ok let's start off with a simply basic "Yum". The food is tasty. The ambiance is catered to NOLA with love. The menu has arrangements of poultry, seafood and steaks. Our waiter was handsomely charming and provided great service. Should definitely be a spot to try when craving some southern Cajun makings. So why the 4 stars and not 5? Ok so the menu is huge but my portion was a bite shy of a kids meal. I mean, I know I can put down a hefty plate but ONE chicken breast and a half serving of grits? Reminded me of a wedding dish sampler. It was great....but I needed more bites to be sure geez. Slightly overpriced unless you pay for flavor "shrugs". Also, it's supposed to be NOLA styled but they played country music. Ummmmm. Granted it was 4th of July so mayyyybbeeee that had a hand but it was surely awkward. Blah blah blah, will be back for some bronzed yumness but I may eat a sandwich beforehand.

Hopefully this review is indicative of an off night, rather than a change from the usual great food and service.  Although greeted promptly, it took almost 1/2 hour before we could get our order in, and another 1/2 hour (and after several assurances that the orders would be "right up" or "next") to get the food.  While we were trying to get the waiter's attention to order he walked by as if he didn't notice and then after he took several steps past our table turned his head back and said "I'll be right back" as he continued to walk away.  And not in a nice voice.  And he wasn't "right back."  The main dishes were fantastic.  Then another delay to get the check.  Restaurant was moderately busy (about 2/3 of the tables in the room we were in were seated).

I absolutely love this place the owner and the bartenders always make you feel like you belong there. Great wine selection great food fun music. Probably the best part about it is there's no gaming on the bar so people actually talk to each other and socialize. Dominic is a great bartender say hello and get the Grits they're to die for

I have to be honest and say I was somewhat disappointed with this place. We went on Sunday, Mother's Day and it wasn't very busy so that was nice. My friend loves this place and has been trying to get me to go here forever. I was hesitant because I looked at the menu and wasn't very impressed with anything I saw. I got the blackened shrimp with Gouda grits and it was pretty good. The fried oysters were disgusting!!!! I told them that they didn't taste right , I didn't eat them, They said they would let the manager know, and I still ended up paying for them! The Praline bacon was probably my favorite thing I tried. I'm not sure if I would go back.

I absolutely loved this place. The ambiance is spot on. The server was very friendly. We ordered the crab cake and I almost died of happiness. Then we ordered Po Boys. I got mine with blackened shrimp and my husband got the roast beef. They were both delicious and mine was the best shrimp Po' Boy I have ever had. We ordered Stella Artois to drink and the beer was fresh and served in actual Stella Artois challis'. Finished the experience with Bananas Foster and that's when I died of happiness.

The service was good.  Basically, the food was good.  
I ordered an appetizer of grilled oysters.  I have had many, many grilledoysters in New Orleans.  The oysters at Lola's didn't even come close.  I think that they forgot to put the oyster under the cheese topping.  There was a teeny tiny piece as though they cut them in pieces to make them stretch farther.  I sure missed the nice plump juicy oyster that should have been there.

Great value and an overall good dining experience. 
The food is pretty good it's most certainly not the smallish Cajun kitchen place the name brings to mind. Lola's is a typical bar/restaurant in the modern hotel style, clean, bright and efficient. 
The service is fast and professional albeit a little too cold and efficient but that's not a complaint more a reflection of my preference-for a little more warm and friendly service. I enjoyed the blackened catfish platter and my guest enjoyed the crab cakes.

I had high hopes for Lola's but came away disappointed. I had been craving grilled oysters for weeks, and headed to Lola's to indulge. I went during happy hour and took advantage of their discounted menu, opting for fried crawfish tails and grilled oysters. Sadly, the oysters weren't discounted. The fried crawfish tails were lackluster at best, tasting mostly of fried breading and something vaguely fishy. On par with your average fried shrimp from any fast food place. The grilled oysters that I had been craving were just as bad. They were tiny and overwhelmed by the garlic butter. For $25, I came away hungry and disappointed. I won't be making that mistake again.
This is such a gem!  Its nice to get a reasonably priced little piece of NOLA in LV!  The staff is friendly and the food is very flavorful!

I really love this place, great food, great location, great service. What more can you ask for ? This is a very classy restaurant, it's an ideal place for a date with that special someone or just a night out for dinner with your friends or family. I highly recommend Lola's to anyone looking for the ultimate dining experience or just some good old southern, creole dishes ... I promise you will not be disappointed.

Terrible wait time...food came out at sporadic times. One person in our party didn't get her food until we were almost done eating.  Shrimp was too tough to eat. Green beans tasted sour. Had to ask for bread, we didn't get the status of the wait time...it took 20 minutes to take our order an hour to get food after. They brought out a wrong side, said would get the correct one never came out. After 2 hours we just needed to get out of there. Longest lunch ever

Roast beef de'brees is awesome. A triple D rated sandwich!! Good etouffee! Chewy charbroiled fishy oysters. Andouille jumbalya very tasty. Some other dishes that were brought to the table I didn't try but did look appetizing. Fresh cut fries are good as well. However the ants crawling over my food was a turn off. Management did come over and move the tables away from the window where they already knew there was a problem. Really come on people !!!!!!
Once again we dined at Lola"s and the service and food were outstanding. We just love Lola"s

The Summerlin location is only about 3 minutes from our house, but for some reason we kept forgetting it was there.  We finally went for the first time about 4 months ago, and now we can't stop!  My go to dish is the BBQ shrimp with the gouda grits instead of rice, lots and lots of their light and fluffy garlic bread for soaking up the sauce, and a crab cake that is pan fried to perfection and isn't overwhelmed with bread crumbs or other useless fillers.  Just crab crab crab.  Yum-mee.  There's a great bar area for watching the games, lovely indoor dining and perfectly accommodated outdoor seating.  I really could eat here twice a week, although I'm sure my thighs wouldn't love me for it.  The menu has so many amazing looking dishes, and I know I should venture outside of my regular order but it's just so danged good!  But my hubs has had the gumbo on several occasions and raves about it, and our kids love the various po' boy sandwiches and soft shell crab.  Really, there isn't one thing I see on the menu that you could go wrong with.  So glad we finally ventured into Lola's.

I have an office in Metairie just outside of NOLA.  My best friend, an old cajun who's family goes way back, is a fine Cajun chef.   So, i know my food groups from the area.  Lola's is the place.  Just the right stuff to make your experience perfect.  Who cares about anything else.  Lay back, enjoy the experience and chill.  This is where all things Cajun in Vegas happens. Oh, if you're lucky, you'll get Emily to serve you.

Love her new location. The service was great along with the ambiance and seating. The bar looks very nice too. Enjoyed the blend of zydeco (cajun) and jazzy (Orleans style) music playing.. wasn't too loud. My favorites are the Crab & Artichoke dip and Gouda Grits w/ shrimp & catfish ... but today we had boiled crawfish for lunch to get our fix for crawfish season. They were boiled to perfection with the right amount of spicy seasoning. They were easy to peel (especially since they're in season right now) and were medium in size. We're so thankful to be able to get good crawfish so far from home. Ordered beignets instead of the delicious Bread Pudding w/praline sauce this time. It was hard to choose.. they're both so good and are a nice way to end any creole or cajun dish. We're SO glad she opened Lola's in Summerlin:)

Nice happy hour menu. 

Dinner is good Cajun style food. Reasonable prices, friendly service. Today we had Shrimp & Grits and Catfish & Grits.

My wife and I have started going to restaurant's we have never been to before and we rely on Yelp a lot for finding interesting and good places. Yesterday, Kathy and I, along with two friends, John and Amy, decided to try Lola's in Summerlin. None of us had been there before.

It seems that the Yelp reviews kind of ran the range but all I can say is maybe some of these reviewers were eating somewhere else and got confused. We found the service to be very attentive and friendly, as well as offering spot on recommendations concerning some of the dishes on the menu. I have to say kudos to Ashley who was our server. She did a wonderful job. And, Lola was actually in the house and took time to go to different diner's tables, including ours, to check on the food. Terrific job, Lola.

I was anxious to try the gumbo because I love gumbo and hadn't had good gumbo since the last time I was in New Orleans, some years ago. I ordered a cup to start my dinner. It was served piping hot over rice and was full of sausage and (one of my favs) okra, but all was blended into a dark, rich, thick stew that started with an awesome flavor I had experienced only in NOLA. Each bite left a slight but terrifically peppery finish. I'll be going back to have this for lunch very soon.

Kathy and I split the 'bronzed catfish' served with 'gouda grits'. The catfish was beautifully dark, without being 'blackened', spicy without requiring the fire department and moist. What was also nice was this was a thick, fat filet that served both of us and not those skinny flat pieces of catfish you see in so many restaurants that serve it.

Being a southern boy, I had no trouble deciding on the 'sweet potato pecan pie'. I was surprised at how large the piece was. I expected smaller. My first bite was heaven and each bite after the first confirmed my first impression. It was crunchy with the nuts and had a recognizable sweet potato undertaste. The best thing about it to me was that it was not cloyingly sweet and sticky, like regular pecan pie.

Needless to say, we will be going back here often since it isn't too far from home. We are anxious to try their special events, like the pre-Thanksgiving dinner, Sunday brunch and their barbeque.

We have been to Lola's several times and I have to say this was not one of the best experiences.  As an appetizer we ordered the char broiled oysters and it was a disappointment because it did not come out as described on the menu.  The description read "Oysters on the half shell, flame flavored with a lemon garlic butter marinade, topped with Pecorino Romano cheese. Sizzling in the half shell straight to your table" but when we got them there was an unrecognizable taste that I didn't care for.  When the waitress came to take the plate away I asked her and she said that the marinade included their house dressing and I pointed out to her that the menu did not say anything about that.  Because we had eaten them they could not take it off the bill but they did offer to buy us dessert.  I just think that any item on a restaurant's menu needs to be described with everything that is included in the preparation. Thankfully we only ordered 1/2 dozen. My husband had the catfish with red beans and rice and I had the etouffee  and both of them we very good.  We took home the bread pudding for dessert.

We had a wonderful experience. The ambiance was great, the live music was a nice touch and the service was wonderful. We had shrimp and grits and a fig dessert and it was all delicious! We will be back on our next visit to Vegas!
Meh - skip this place - service was not good and the décor is cheap - the food made me and my wife not feel good after and it wasn't that good taste wise.

Very nice place. My husband and I are visiting from Southern California and we love Cajun food. This place has a nice variety of menu items and really good food. We came for lunch. The service was great and food was awesome. I got bronze shrimp and grits and my husband got bronze cat fish and grits. We finished with bread pudding and chickory coffee. We have reservations for a fancy dinner at Cesar's palace tomorrow but I think we might come back here instead.

The good and the bad.

The good.
Waitstaff: lovely
Atmosphere: Attractive
Food: Delicious

The Bad
grilled catfish delic but tiny portion, 1 1/2 fillets about 3 inches
as I type am still hungry
glass of merlot $9 (the least expensive)
with a chintzy pour
Most local places a glass of wine $5-6
Between the small portions, high price for the wine- a nice place but will not be back soon

This place is near my job but I never thought to stop by until today. I had a grilled chicken salad which I was kind of concerned with the price being 10.99 but then portion was huge. The salad did not disappoint and the service was equally as good. This may be my new lunch spot.

Ordered for pick up. Overpriced and the quality was nothing short of mediocre. 

Super bummed, as I saw this was featured on DDD's, so I thought I was in for a real treat.

I ordered the catfish poboy with French fries my sandwich was skimpy the fish had no taste and most of my fries where burnt on the other hand the server was very attentive and nice over all the food was a disappointing and  flavorless

Not good for large groups. We called and warn them that we need to large tables and about 15/20 of us were coming. Only after we settled in the bar area did the agree to move us to tables.  It took over an hour to get food, I'm sitting her still waiting. My order of ceaser shrimp salade came out with chicken. 5
60 minutes, Sent it back and still waiting.  We will not be back horrible service.

Pretty bad experience . My wife and I went there the other night and had a bad experience. First off, we are both from New Orleans and live here now. I do understand that the food might not be just like we would get in New Orleans, but was hoping for something close. Ordered cocktails, then appetizers. Wife got the crab cake and I got a cup of gumbo. The waitress then came back after a bit and we ordered dinner. Shrimp and grits and an oyster po boy. Waited a while and the food came before the appetizers. We told them that we didn't get our appetizers yet and then a guy walks up with the appetizers, but it wasn't our appetizers, wrong table. So, they wanted to leave the dinner and we said we would like to have the appetizers first. Then we were concerned our dinner would just sit in the kitchen and get cold. She assured my wife that "it will be made again special, just for you". So, they bring the correct appetizers out and the crab cake was ok. The gumbo was nothing close to a real gumbo. The flavor was all off and even the okra was CRUNCHY!! I'm not a chef, but I do know you have to cook the okra down. So, I added some seasoning and hot sauce and had just a couple of bites, and guess what? Our food comes out again!! So, we finished our appetizers and my wife bites into a shrimp and the food is cold. She sent it back and did not want it again. The oyster po boy was pretty bland, no seasoning and too much corn meal. However, the French Bread was good. So, we then order desert. Decide to go with bananas foster, which is pretty simple to make and can't really screw that up. Wrong!!! They put a raw banana in the sauce with ice cream. You are supposed to cook the banana a bit in the sauce. We cut into the banana and it was probably just peeled and put in. Then later, I got sick, just me, not my wife and had stomach issues until the next afternoon. Needless to say, we will never go back. I hope that someone from Lola's does read this and can address these issues. If you are going to represent being a New Orleans style restaurant, it should be. The atmosphere and decor remind me of home, but not the food.

The host just sits at the door with a sour face, she did not greet or smile. After being seated I ordered the gumbo and potato salad. The gumbo was good and very spicy. The waitress was terrible, no personality, not attentive, and not at all helpful. I never got my potato salad and never got a refill on my water. The food I did receive was good but I won't be back. That was some of the worst service I've ever had.

Came here on a Tuesday night around 8 pm. We were asked to wait for about 10 mins because there were no seats available. As we were sat down, I noticed at least 2 other empty tables. Why weren't we sat earlier? Whatever, we were hungry and tired. We ordered the Jambalaya and the Gumbo. The Jambalaya was very flavorful but a bit too spicy. I was sharing dishes with the boyfriend so I had the Jambalaya first. As I moved on and had the Gumbo, I tasted nothing but the texture from the Okra. But I really enjoyed the Jambalaya. Though it was a bit spicy, it was good. So food wise, it's a place to try. As for the service, let's just say that the bread was not given to us until our food came out.

Have been craving some Cajun food for a while so we went to check out Lola's.  Seated right away, atmosphere was warm, nice live piano music.  Server was friendly and knew the menu well, might have exaggerated the flavors slightly or the kitchen was having an off night.  We ordered a garlic bread to start along with a cup each of gumbo and jambalaya, gumbo was tasteless, more of a bean taste, needed hot sauce and seasoning.  Jambalaya was nice, has a nice heat level.  Bread was dropped off, it was crunchy yet soft and quite nice, however we could not taste any garlic.  Turned out it was a table bread and server forgot our garlic bread.
I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo with blackened chicken, was told it was rich and creamy and the chicken would be Cajun spiced.  She was right about the creamy sauce, however the super thin sliced chicken was dry and tasteless, had no taste at all to it.  Johan had the beef and gravy po-boy, it again was on the bland and dry side.  Server did not once check on our meals, not during appetizers or entrees.
Will give the place another go sometime.
OMG this place is delicious !! I go here at LEAST twice a month. The po'boy is the greatest I've ever had! I tried the fried chicken, fried shrimp, and the roast beef! I dream about them lol

This is my favorite place to eat in all of Las Vegas. I LIVE for these shrimp and grits. The servers have always been quick and polite. I recently moved out of town and whenever I come back to visit I make it a point to come here.

total slop garbage, but nice and quick staff. good employees horrible bland hospital food. we wasted about $200.00 that we couldn't consume nor finish.   never again....no seasoning at all.... Not one Creole, Black, or country cook in the kitchen either.

Don't depend on the hostess to give you accurate information. I called to see if they had crawfish and was ensured by the hostess that they in fact did! Well, turns out I drove all the way down there for nothing. And I never even received as little as an apology. I was really looking forward to this place, but their lack of communication is clear right when you walk through the front door.

Lunch at Lola's in Summerlin was delicious. Service was laid back and friendly. Our server was doing double duty, tending bar and serving tables which kept her very busy. 
I liked the wall decorations, a very New Orleans atmosphere.
A complementary basket of toasted bread was a nice starter. The Crawfish Etouffee was tasty and kicked up a bit. Lots of Crawfish among the vegetables and a thick gravy. It is a very hardy dish and a good size portion. The fried Chicken platter is served with a choice of 2 sides. Our sides were French Fries and Coleslaw. The large chicken breast was moist and juicy with a nice crispy breading. The Fries and Coleslaw were both great choices for the sides. The use of several types of bell peppers in the Coleslaw was a nice addition.
Our next visit is to experience the Happy Hour. It's great to have Lola's on west side as another addition to the increasing number of dining choices. 
Let the Good Times Roll.

Came today for the first time and really liked it! The decor is cool, the music is great, and the food is fantastic! I had the bronzed shrimp and grits and will definitely order it next time! Creamy, cheesy grits paired with spicy shrimp and andouille sausage - yum! My husband ordered off the brunch menu and got the French toast with a side of praline bacon. He said it was terrific and I can attest to that, at least as far as the bacon is concerned, because I stole a piece! We will definitely be back and would like to try sitting outside in their nice courtyard (too windy today.)

Wow!  This place is busy!  I went here for dinner with my wife last Saturday around 6pm and the parking lot was packed.

When we got there, we were promptly seated in the back of the restaurant and our drink orders were taken.  My wife god a Sweat Tea and I got a water.  My wife is a connoisseur of Sweet Tea and she was extremely happy with the taste.  It was perfect, she didn't have to add any additional sweetener to it.

As an appetizer, we both got a Bowl of Gumbo and a Crab cake.  Crab cake was good.  I don't really like crab cakes but this one was okay.

The Gumbo was delicious!  I liked the melody of meats contained therein.  One thing we both noticed that was it very salty.  Almost instantly our heads started to pound, so we both started drinking more to offset the affects of sodium.

I was feeling fine after a few minutes and my wife didn't finish her gumbo.  What did I do?  Yep.  I ate hers too. It was soooo good!  But my head almost instantly started pounding again.  So I finished off my second glass of water.

Refills here were super quick, even though we were seated in the back.  These servers have hawk eyes and it's much appreciated!

For a main course my wife ordered the Catfish.  I ordered the Salmon Grilled with Fries and the Vegetables.

Food took a little while to get out, but we were busy with our appetizers and the free bread that they brought out.  The bread was nicely toasted and had a nice buttery flavor to it.

When our main courses arrived, my wife instantly loved her catfish.  I tried some as well and it was pretty good.  

My plate was grilled salmon with fries and veggies.  The salmon portion was pretty generous.  It was perfectly grilled. Not too dry.  The fries were OH EM GEE good! I have a secret (not now so) love for potatoes and it did not disappoint.  Nice, hot and crispy with the right amount of seasoning.  I almost felt guilty dipping them in ketchup.   The veggies on my plate were an assortment of onions, peppers and mushrooms in some sort of oil.  It was good. I ate it all it was so good!

We were stuffed, we couldn't possibly eat anymore.  So what did we do?  We got dessert! :)

My wife got Bananas Fosters and I got the Chocolate cake with ice cream.  Her Bananas Fosters once again impressed her and I got a bite of it as well.  It was very pleasant and sweet.  My chocolate cake consisted of what seemed really more like a brownie with a scoop of ice cream on top.  I'm not complaining, it was very delicious and definitely hit the spot!

We paid or check and finally left.  The service was great, the ambiance was awesome.  It felt pretty intimate.  The place was clean and thank goodness there is ample parking on all sides of the building!

We will definitely start coming here more often now.  Highly recommended to try this place out if you like Southern food!

Awesome, awesome and awesome. Do yourself a huge fave and enjoy some down home cajun cooking. This place is as close to nawleans as you can get! Their specialty cocktails are unbelievable and the bartenders are great people. The staff knows how to treat you right and always nice. Thank god they nestled up in Summerlin!

I love Lola's! We usually eat at the downtown location as it's between work and home but I also have eaten at this location (town center drive). Both have great atmosphere and good servers but the food is why I go (and I often get "food to go").  My favorite is probably the house salad (actually called "Signature Orange Bowl Salad"). I usually get it with the grilled chicken. Great proportions so that each bite has most of all the ingredients (dried cranberries, orange segments, lettuce, candied almonds, good house vinaigrette, celery, and that grilled chicken - might be missing some ingredients but you get the picture). YUM - literally delicious and nutritious.  I also love their hamburgers (fully dressed of course) with fries. Good heavens those fries are good and the hamburger is juicy and well seasoned - simply tastes great! My husband loves their chicken strips and the house-made ranch dressing is outstanding. I also absolutely love the chargrilled oysters - and that bread to sop up all the juices. An amazing dish - just a great mix of flavors. Their desserts are great too (chocolate cake or banana foster/bread pudding are my favorites - both moist and full of flavor and I usually share (but sometimes we each get our own chocolate cake (and comes with delicious vanilla ice-cream). I am making myself hungry just thinking about it.
We really wanted to love this place but the food was just ok. Crawfish were really dry and tasteless. The service was very friendly.

Do you like your grits cheesy? Go to Lola's! On a diet? Have a cheat day, and go to Lola's!

I always get their catfish n' grits... their blackened catfish is spot-on, and their sauce with mushrooms begs for a side of their crispy, Cajun fries to soak it all up.

And save room for dessert!

Also--I loved their pianist in their bar area. Definitely put me in the right mindset! I need to come back for their happy hour!

Very disappointing Louisiana style food, especially at these prices. I tried the Gouda Grits, which were mouth puckering salty. I tried the gumbo, which was a tiny little cup, and very bland. Seriously, if you need to know where to get some decent andouille sausage, I can show you. The red beans and rice was bland as well, probably due to the flavorless sausage again. I won't be back; I can get better gumbo and red beans and rice out of a box.

Excellent excellent food... only reason I didn't give 5 stars is due to the fact they charged extra for every little thing... $2.00 above this listed menu price for salmon... $0.50 for aeoli sauce for crab cake... $0.50 for cheese for pasta... food was still incredible though!

Yummy! We came here toward closing to celebrate a promotion. The service was great, and the food was awesome! 

We started with the charboiled oysters and hot crab and artichoke dip. The dip was good, but nothing out of the ordinary (its a good comfort appy- hard to screw, but hard to reinvent). The oysters were delish, if you don't like them raw. 

I had the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits. I tried some of the crawfish Etouffee, which was also good, but my entree was amazing! 

Definitely come here if you are starving. A great date place!

Lola's never disappoints. We went there for our anniversary dinner and had a great meal...again.
We had the crab cake and hush puppies to start. 
The bronzed catfish with grits for me and the bronzed shrimp and grits for the wife. Had a couple of cocktails which were really good. The sazerac was really smooth. We ended the dinner with banana pudding and bananas foster bread pudding. We are stuffed. So glad there's one closer to us now. It'll go into the "local" rotation.

Made a reservation, so they stuck us in a freezing back room where our waitress forgot about us the whole meal. Seriously took her about 15 mins to stop by the table for the first time. Took another 15 mins to actually receive drinks. She "kindly" brought extra syrup for my daughter's waffle(that we didn't request or need) and then charged us extra for it. All the food came out cold (probably because she forgot about us AGAIN). Don't order the Eggs Benedict with soft-shell crab. It sounds really good but was awful. The crawfish hush puppies were decent, but $6 for 4 tiny hushpuppies is a rip off. Expected at least double what was served. Their menu said boiled crawfish were through end of June, but actually they stopped serving at the beginning of the month. Definitely not worth a trip across town and we will not be back.

Never had a bad meal here yet. Brunch time offered my fiancé her favorite chargrilled oysters with garlic butter. I, as always, savored every bite of the chicken and sausage Jambalaya with extra andouille sausage. One of my favorite brunch destinations in las vegas.

Cute place to have brunch or if you just want some good cajun/creole food.  Southern charm decor as it should be.  Lola's is its own separate house, and there's plenty of seating.  Southern creole is one of my favorites.

Looks like there's a good menu here for brunch, but I was really craving for some Crawfish Etouffe. 

I got some craw puppies to start.  They weren't kidding when they said craw puppies: 4 very small pieces of hush/craw puppies.  Very tasty, but I don't think the 4 is shareable, unless your party of 4 doesn't mind having just 1...tiny...craw puppy.  

Then came the crawfish etouffe, served on a big hot plate.  Since I was served with a huge portion of this, I took it home to go.. Typically, I don't do leftovers, but the flavor was so delightful, that I had it for lunch the next day.   

Between the Summerlin location and the downtown location, I would go back to the Summerlin location for better parking and bigger space.
I really enjoyed this restaurant. I got the Jambalaya and thought it was very good. The indoor atmosphere is really nice as well as the outside space. Highly recommend.

Finally got around to eating here, food was superb.  We had the crawpuppies, hubby had Tchoupitoulas and I had the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits, for desert the Famous Bread Pudding.  His dish was awesome, he loved the crawpuppies too.  I also enjoyed my dish & the grits was very buttery but I thought was a bit thick.  For me the crawpuppies were salty but again, hubby likes it. Desert was delicious and just enough sweetness to it. 

4 stars for great service and good food, we'd return to try other dishes.  However, for a Louisiana type of restaurant, I found the place to be costly and I wish they had binget hence, less 1 star.

This place has excellent food, desserts and service. Full bar with TVs for entertainment, good for large parties, seems pretty relaxed, but nice enough place for a date. Has a separate dining area from the bar,  and has a large room for large family gatherings or corporate lunch meetings.

We ordered the crawfish puppies...you can pass on these. But the blacken catfish and grits was delicious and we highly recommend it. I also order the blacken Salmon although it was cooked to perfection it wasn't as tasty as I had hoped. The banana puddling was pretty good too
The most amazing Cajun food in Vegas!  For brunch they have praline bacon!  What!!  The red beans and rice are so amazing and authentic.

Locally owned and loved, this second location of Lola's is head and shoulders above any other eatery in this food desert location in the north part of Summerlin. The bronzed shrimp and grits is a dish they're known for. It's an excellent dish with five large shrimp atop cheesy and creamy gouda grits with a spicy ragout full of bold flavored andouille sausage and mushrooms. The crab cake platter was decent. Like most other items here, even the crab cakes have some heat. They're pan fried with little filler but also lack the big jumbo lump pieces of crab that make crab cakes meaty.

Desserts are quite good. The signature bananas foster bread pudding is large enough to share. It's a massive brick of custard soaked, creamy bread atop caramelized bananas and covered with a sugary sweet sauce. The sweet potato pecan pie was a balanced display of sweetness with a crust that's thin and flaky.

If you want authentic NOLA cuisine then this is the place. Totally took us back to our trip! The Charbroiled oysters were outstanding, just as good as Dragos! Hubby and I split our meals. The Crab cake dinner was delicious! We had never had crab cakes on green, but the flavors were amazing. Also had the Beef D Brees PoBoy, all I can say is I CANT WAIT TO COME BACK!!!

Every friday during crawfish season, Lola's servers up a fabulous crawfish boil. You order it by the pound and its just so perfectly spiced. Really put a new appreciation for crawfish after going through about 25 of the little juicy critters. Plus the potatos and corn on the cob hit the spot!

Came in tonight for some food after watching the boring Jason Bourne movie.  Our server by the way gave us great service and was very attentive with my Arnold palmer refills.  I started with the wings and French fries.  I have to say that I have never paid $8.59 for only 5 wings.  They were of average taste and served over a bed of French fries.  I probably won't order the wings again. The wings did one with their homemade blue cheese and that was excellent.  I had the bronzed shrimp and sausage with grits for the first time.  That was an amazing dish and I will definitely try it again.  Amber and her team gave great service.  They were right there if we needed anything.  They also did a great time with prebussing to keep our table clean.

It's crawfish season!  Lola's get their live crawfish flown in on a Thursday and is ready to be served to customers that day and Friday.  If you are lucky and there is still the supply, you can enjoy it on a Saturday, but don't gamble and just rsvp for a Friday to be safe.

That's what I did, so Earl and I dine here on a Friday.  The price per pound of crawfish is $10.99.  I ordered 2lbs for myself and Earl ordered the catfish plate with garden veggies, sweet potato fries, an gouda grits.

Each lb of crawfish comes with a potato and a corn on a cob.  Since it is still the beginning of the crawfish season, they are still small in size.  So yes, it's more work to peel each one, but the meat is still sweet and full of flavor.  It got a bit salty for me so I had to eat it with a bite of potato/corn on the cob to balance out the saltiness.  I also had the delicious sweet tea with my meal...I had to.  2lb of crawfish was enough for me.  

While I was still finishing up my pail of crawfish, Earl ordered the Fig newton with butter pecan ice cream.  I took a bite of his dessert and I halted my consumption of crawfish to ensure I get my share of this delectable dessert.  It was so good!  It's no ordinary fig newton...it was fig newton on steroids!  But that combination with butter pecan ice cream was genius.  After we finished the dessert, I went back to finish my crawfish.

It was a delicious dinner and it satisfied my crawfish cravings.

Having a ball at Lola's. As one who lives for the ambiance, I'm loving the piano player and yummy crab cakes. It's a great Valentine's Day with my honey. My husband ordered a Shrimp remaulade. He says it's great. Our waiter Randall is very attentive. It's worth the trip here to rock out to the music and enjoy the lovely ambiance. Bus boy Morgan is also loaded with personality and ready to help with the amazing experience. We will definitely be back.

I wasn't too happy when I came to this place. For one I was unable to get in, because they wasn't open the. time online  And the time on the door was not the same there was a hen written paper on the doors saying that there was a time change in the restaurant. I was super upset because I really wanted to eat here being that its becoming a popular place in Vegas. so I drove over an hour just while on vacation from my husband's birthday but we never got to have breakfast or lunch so we just went to ihop instead. A place where you can always count on them being open!

My husband and I went here for our 12th wedding anniversary, this place has amazing Cajun cuisine.
Loved it, bit pricey but well worth it. The have have Sunday brunch with a some yummy bottomless cocktails. Definitely recommend this place if you want awesome Louisiana yummy ness. Oh a don't forget your Mardi Grais mask .

I lived in New Orleans for a while and loved the food culture of the city. After moving to Las Vegas, i was hoping to find a place to get authentic Cajun and a creole food. I was told by several co workers that Lola's was the place to go. 
Overall food quality was great. It was probably the closest thing to NOLA that Vegas will offer. My favorite part of the meal was the bread- it is truly authentic New Orleans. The red beans and rice were not as I am used too however they weren't bad. I had a Chicken Po Boy and the chicken was blackened and amazing!
The fries were house cut and looked to be twice fried. ( not my preference ) 
Service was a bit slow due to our server having a 10 top party right after we ordered. 
I would go again and you should at least try it for yourself.
Sooooo good!!!! Found this gem on yelp while in Vegas getting married. Had a good size group show up to meet up and it was delightful! We'll be back next time in town!

I have not been to this location yet and decided to walk there after an appointment. 
.5 miles after, I felt I deserved everything I was about to order!!

First, I must say... My server was a man completely void of joy or personality or any kind of zest for "seize the day". No expression. Nada. 

I got the crab and artichoke dip first. Delicious but soooooo greasy. There was a whole layer of oil on the bottom of the dish. Jeez. Well, I ate it anyway. Put a ton of hot sauce on it too. 

Next, I ordered blackened chicken and a side of seasonal veggies and a salad with balsamic. My server, of course, the conversationalist he was, didn't tell me that their balsamic is basically oil, sugar and herbs. Tasty but super sweet and not what I wanted. The chicken was great, juicy and a little spicy. I added a ton of hot sauce (love it) and the veggies were sautéed well but again, sooooooooo oily. Mother of God. Heavy hand in the kitchen. It was basically swimming in oil. Too much for me. I ate them anyway. 

Shrimp Creole was the last dish. Pretty tasty but I am pretty sure the shrimp is farm raised because, o boy, do your hands smell like shrimp butt if you choose to pick them up without a fork!! Gross. But the tomato stew was great with a nice strong creole kick. 

It's good stuff, I love it, but a suggestion or two.. Pride yourselves with Wild caught seafood and ease up on so much oil. No need to drown sautéed veggies in all of that grease. 

Server didn't get a decent tip, I don't tip faceless, removed and bland people. Sorry.

Sweet potato pie anyone? If not, then go straight for the handful of bread pudding options, sure to add a few inches around the waistline. But lets not get stuck on the dessert menu...
Amazing food and a dangerously addictive house scotch will leave you in a heap of trouble, as you attempt to eat your soft shelled crab and shrimp etouffee through the bottom of your 4 empty glasses. Trust me, this scotch is THAT good. I am convinced some magic's are involved in the mixing of this drink. If you do manage to pull away from the drink while still managing sobriety, you will also find the gumbo is quite tasty as well. Oh yes I know good gumbo, and they do it well here. Prepare your forks ladies and gentlemen!

Great food, decent service, moderate-high price, but LOVE the little parking lot garden. 

I've been twice now, once for brunch and the other for dinner. 

Brunch: Great! I had the catfish plate that included two sides of my choice (Grits and Green beans) oh and all you can drink mimosas. Our server was pretty good with the mimosas constantly returning to refill them.

Dinner: OK. We first started in the bar area because it looked cozy so we sat there, they checked our IDs and my friend was searching for her in her purse. Before she could even come to the conclusion she didn't have it the bartender started stating of nevada state liquor statutes. He was so rude. I would have expected him to say, "no worries, you can still dine with us in the dinning room." but no, so i was really not thrilled with him. I chose not to drink in the dining area just because of him. Our dining room waitress on the other hand was lovely and took care of us well. 

*Very disappointed to see that Grits is no longer an option as a side for the dinner entree's. You have to purchase a small bowl of it from the grits section for almost $7. It ended up being cheaper for me to purchase the catfish and grits meal with a side of vegetables.

I called to check if they have live crawfish.
They told me they have it so I went.
Crawfish was dry, too dry.  It's so dry there's no juice in the heads at all.  I just couldn't suck the juice out of the heads. 
I eat fresh crawfish enough to know the difference between frozen or never been frozen.
I've been going LOLA during crawfish season every year to eat fresh crawfish for 20yrs.
I didn't go this year so I've decided come here.
Last crawfish I ate tasted like shit so I spited out and went to restroom to clean my mouth.
I couldn't believe they serve this.

A fun change of pace for foodies in Vegas.  I had the shrimp and grits and they were on point.  The bread isn't as great as everyone claims,  but it could be that it arrived between lukewarm and cold.  The Jambalaya was also tasty!

This was probably my fifth time here as I live nearby.  For starters, I would like to state that this is a very attractive venue that has a separate room for private parties.  In addition, out door patio seating is available as well.  Also, they have an amazing specialty cocktail menu with a talented staff that prepares them consistently well.  However, I was let down on my recent visit.  My wife and I came by for a late lunch and the first thing we noticed is that their prices have gone up quite a bit.  My wife started by ordering a "House Bloody Mary" - $8.00.  For lunch, I ordered a "Family Favorites," Gumbo - $12.29.  The color, (Dark brown) and consistency of this dish was not very appetizing to me.  It came in a shallow soup bowl with a scoop of white rice in the center.  I was expecting more of a stew and it was the consistency of soup.  Flavor was ok.  I would not order this item again and do not recommend it.  My wife ordered a "House Specialties," Shrimp Charlotte - $15.99.  This dish came with medium size sautéed shrimp and mushrooms over angel hair pasta in a light broth.  She enjoyed this dish and would order this item again.  Our meal came with their specialty bread and was quite good.  Bottom line for me, there was a lack of "bank for the buck" considering that $47 was spent, (including tax and tip) for lunch for two on a $8 well Bloody Mary, $12.29 for a bowl soup and $15.99 for a simple shrimp and pasta dish.

For spur of the moment this was an okay. We had the soft shell crab app and it was underwhelming as was the garlic bread. The fries and chicken basket was the best thing but a bit over priced for being in Summerlin, from my perspective. The caesar salad was a bit over dressed but about average. Overall it was all meh.

My first experience was a 2 star.  I actually never finished my review and I'm glad I didn't.  I think I was having a bad day.  I remember hush puppies being hard little moon rocks and not much else.


I went back to eat at the bar on Friday.  It was early and it was packed.   One bartender was clearly having his bad day but Adam was a rock star.  I just wanted a beer but everything that is popular now is kind of "yucky" by my standards.  They popped one open for me and it fit "yucky" and poured me another I liked.  I would have paid for the one wasted but there was no disagreement, attitude or anything but "let's find one you like"  POOF. It appeared.

I had the shrimp and grits.  Normally I am the slowest eater on earth.  Not only did I snarf it up in an unlady like fashion... but if I was at home I would have licked the plate.  The shrimp wasn't the star of the dish.  The gouda grits with the sausage and sauce... one word... OINK!

The new location just doesn't have the right kind of funk for Cajun.  I wish they could do something to the outside.  They are trying on the inside but it still doesn't reek Cajun to me.  What WAS appropriately funky was the pianist that started at about...uhm... 6pm? (early by live music standards)  I loved everything he played and how he played it.

I sat next to a regular who clearly knew the servers and the menu inside and out.  She was very helpful.  As she waived and talked to other people I realized a good portion of the crowd were regulars.  That's always a good thing.

My only complaint is the bar stools were heavy.  They don't swivel and they were tight next to each other getting in and out was hard.  That was minor.  There were some lower tables and chairs in the bar area close to the piano.  I'm definitely going back for the music and food on another weekend.

BTW, it is smoke free (inside at least... I didn't sit outside).  I'm not a smoker but I could totally see a successful cigar lounge attached, outside or next door.

Typical southern cuisine but a lot more expensive than the south!

Came for lunch one day and we ordered a bunch of food to share. Got the fried platter which came with 2 of each of the fried catfish, chicken and some other things. The ingredients were of low quality and not very tasty at all. We also ordered the gumbo and the flavor were ok just waaaay too much rice. 

Service was also pretty spotty. The outside patio area is very nice on a cool fall afternoon but probably not good during the winter or summer.

Since moving from the New Orleans area to the inland northwest, I've been acutely aware that you just can't get good food "around here". So when a business trip brought me to Las Vegas, I was excited to see if this innovative city could produce some authentic creole cuisine.

Service: the hostess was a little bit dry, but everyone else was very friendly and attentive.

Ambience: nice, calm at 11:30am, fleur de lis and other New Orleans inspired decor all around. 

We ordered the catfish and shrimp platter with softshell crab with coleslaw and sweet potato fries on the side, along with a cup of gumbo and crawpuppies as appetizers. The waiter assured us that most of their seafood is sourced from the New Orleans area. When the food arrived, I found that the fry batter wasn't particularly flavorful and the catfish was watery. The crawpuppies were good with remoulade sauce, but it would have been nice to see plain hush puppies on the menu. The gumbo was decent, but not as complex as other gumbo I've had in New Orleans. Halfway through the meal, we were brought a crab cake, which had a wonderful crab flavor and was one of the highlights of the meal, along with the sweetened iced tea - no gritty sugar packet required. 

Overall, this is a nice place to eat, but the food is not the best New Orleans style cuisine you'll ever have.

Delicious.  Had a really good time,  pleasant experience,  great customer service and environment.  Had the mamas red beans and rice,  crab cakes,  grits and bread pudding banana souffle. All were very good. We all enjoyed our meals, no complaints what so ever.  Definitely check out if you can.

We love this place and were usually very happy with what we get but beware of the EXTREMELY OVER SALTED items: 

Collard greens - salt bomb

Green beans- salt bomb 

Our last visit my husband had these two sides with a piece of salmon and poor guy left hungry cuz 2 out of 3 items were inedible :( 

Poutin fries- barely edible

On a better note, the fettuccini with blackened salmon is top notch

All of the shrimp dishes I've had are really good

Fried artichokes are pretty good

Bread pudding is killer

We usually love Lola's because the food and service are both normally great. My wife wanted it for Mother's Day and we were disappointed at best. We rant about the fried chicken and it was bland. My fried chicken platter was bland and the waiter got my sides wrong. We ordered two chicken and waffles. One came with three small tenders and the other came with six or seven large tenders. They completely missed the chicken and fries for my son. Sides were wrong around the table and yet we still decided to order dessert because my wife likes the bananas foster bread pudding. My mother in law got the same thing but we ended up just getting the bananas foster. Food was bad and our waiter wasn't listening to what we wanted. Made for a bummer of a Mother's Day lunch!
My favorite place to eat as the vegetables are grown on site and everything is made from scratch.  I want to try the dessert but everytime I go I eat too much and I'm too full.

Wow.  I used to be a huge fan of Lola's and frequently recommended friends.  Unfortunately, the quality of food and service has plummeted.  It feels like your an inconvenience to the staff rather than a client.  It took nearly 45 mins to grill a chicken breast and when I inquired about the time I was told it takes time to prepare fresh chicken and if I had somewhere to be they would bring it in a box.  I had brought a party of 12 and was thoroughly embarrassed by the attention and care we received.  I'm sure they have plenty of better customers than me so I will not return.  At least I got to watch the entire Alabama game while I waited to eat #rolltide

The atmosphere and live music was wonderful. Service was great. The portions are extremely small for the price. They offer a gluten free option but if you don't eat pork this isn't the spot for you. There was hardly anything for a non pork eater to order.

This place is below average. I have been a few times and have yet to be impressed. Because the location is convenient for me I want to like it, but never enjoy myself. I'm scratching my head at how this place has 4 starts. The food is mediocre and the service is pretty bad. I swear I always get the waiter that's about to get off because that would explain the rushed, half ass treatment I get every time. I give up. They've convinced me they won't get it right!!

The food was outstanding!  We had a group of 28 people for a co-workers retirement party.  All the arrangements for this buffet style event were made in advance.  We all arrived and were able to enjoy excellent food, service, laughter and fun.  The event was a nice send off into retirement for our friend/co-worker.  Lola herself came to check on us several times during the evening!  I highly recommend Lola's for dinner or for larger events.  I look forward to going back - Lola's Catfish is delicious, the red beans and rice, and jambalaya, salads, coleslaw, and desserts were all wonderful!  Highly recommend!

Very good food. Started with the crab cakes which were awesome. Then the shrimp po boy. Very good and very full of shrimp! Only downfall is no beignets. Can't be an authentic Louisiana cuisine without them!!!!

We have been to both of Lola's locations.  This visit was to the one in Summerlin.  We had an exquisite dinner.  The food was absolutely luscious and the ambiance was wonderful.  They also had a live combo singing and playing in the bar which was very good.  We actually stopped to listen and sing with them on the way out.  We highly recommend this restaurant so if you're looking for a great place for dinner that's not your ordinary dinner fare (unless you live in Louisiana), this is the place for you!!

It was my girlfriends birthday, and I wanted to take her there. Overall it was a poor experience. When I made the reservation I noted that we were coming for her birthday. When we arrived I mentioned to the hostess that it was her birthday, and she said "Make sure you order dessert." We sat down and ordered drinks, were told they would be right up. The waiter was working on 2 other tables before he went to make the drinks. They finally showed up and we ordered. The char grilled oysters were extremely small. Not even worth ordering. We were told by the waiter our food would be up 5-10 minutes. He told us that 3 times. Really? I ordered the bread pudding for dessert. No candle, no whipped cream. The waiter came back later and apologized for not knowing that it was her birthday. $100 dinner and they charged for the dessert. we were both really disappointed with the entire experience. Won't be going back.

OH MY!! We came here on a Sunday after finding out the other location was closed on Sunday's and we LOVE this place! The wait staff are so friendly and personable and the environment is warm and inviting. The food.. awesome! I seem to be fixated on the salads but ALL of the food is amazing! Give it a try... we now take friends there who come into Vegas to visit and they love it too! 

Support your local businesses!

Went to Lola's for the first time last night and we were so excited, unfortunately it was not such an awesome visit. The prices reflected on the menu were not the actual prices. When my sister asked to speak to a manager she basically said oh well it is what it is. However, the food was really good everything tasted fresh. Just wish they would train their staff to have better customer service.
Amazing food & service! One of my favorite places. The Shrimp & Grits is my favorite, but honestly, everything I've tried there over the years is great!

Delicious! I didn't know there was a second location for the longest time. Went on a Sunday evening, and was not packed. Service was a bit slow but they may have been short staffed. I tried a cup of the gumbo, which was wonderful. For entree, I tried the Shrimp/Crawfish Etouffee; all cooked well and so flavorful! From my family, I heard that the Salmon Fettuccine Alfredo, Barbecue Shrimp, and Shrimp and Grits, were also delicious. Bread pudding for dessert was the best I've had in a while! Will be back

Love the Charleston location but this one is so-so. I was excited to have my mom try this place after talking about it so much. Had the gumbo, good, but there was a massive chicken bone in it. The shrimp and grits were also good. I asked if it was possible to get a little more of the mushroom sauce and the waitress said sure. When I got the bill apparently the 2Tbs of sauce I got extra was $1. I would have like to have been told of the extra charge. My mother ordered the étouffée on my suggestion. When it came out it tasted of nothing but thyme. Horrible. I'll probably give it one more shot, but I'm afraid they've spread themselves thin with two locations. Can't beat the Charleston one though.

the food is comparable to the Charleston location.  it's ok.  the ambiance is pretty lame.  finally, I realize they just opened but their staff is laughably untrained.  fixable problems but I don't think service and décor are priorities for lola.

This has been on my radar since it opened near where I live.  I've been to the original Lola's on Charleston Boulevard and I wanted to give this place a try.

I was seated promptly and was brought iced tea by a server.  Then I was left to peruse the menu.  Another server came along and asked if my order had been taken and when I said it hadn't, that server took the order.  It was short--a cup of gumbo for an appetizer and the crawfish étouffée.

Then there was a wait for the soup to be brought which was delivered by the original server.  I had not half finished the soup when the same server brought my main course--one of the things I find most disconcerting about restaurants.  The server said something along the lines about being sorry this came out so fast.  Is that OK?  No it's not, but I took the dish.  There was one other table occupied in the dining room and you can't get the courses evened out?

The soup and the étouffée were very good.  There was some Louisiana brand hot sauce on the table that said, "One drop does it."  No it doesn't.  I shook several good squirts and it still wasn't spicy hot but was better.  That has nothing to do with Lola's but Louisiana brand hot sauce would be my last choice in the future.

The étouffée was made with a rich brown roux and had some kick to it, enough that I didn't bother to ask for a different hot sauce.  I enjoyed it the way it was.  There was a good amount of crawfish.  Server 1 also brought me some more bread, thin slices, grilled a brief bit and nicely crisp.

For dessert, I ordered the sweet potato pecan pie with a dip of butter pecan ice cream.  The pie was very good.  It had a very soft texture from the potato and was not a custard-like pie as a pumpkin pie would be.  Very different and very good.

I enjoyed my dinner but I deducted a star for the timing of the service.  That simply should not happen especially in an almost empty place!
I've never liked crawfish, or gumbo. Leave it to Lola's to have the best!! Cutest decor and friendly staff

This is a great restaurant, in Summerlin. I was here for a function, which I missed but stayed back for dinner and drinks. The reason being the ambience, great food and service
Tuesday evening and it was busy, with piano player playing some old southern music. It was just awesome. 
We dined at the bar, the service is spot on and the food was great. The bartender explained their house specialty which we ordered - Shrimp Charlotte - names after the owners sister - thin noodles in mushroom and spicy sauce - was super delicious. We followed that up with I believe a Louisiana  classic - Shrimp Creole spicy shrimp stew- OMG what a dish - we could not stop eating it - just the right spice level - ask for 6 out of 10 on spice level
Overall it was a great dinning experience and we will be back.
