Strongly recommend   this spot

The service was okay the food was warm I don't know if the food was per made but it's was dam near cold I got shrimp and grits and the flavor was ok really small portions the best thing about Lola's is the food presentation
One of the best and reasonably  priced brunches one had in a long time.  Waffle was awesome with a variety  of flavored butters...
Wanted to try this place out again and they still have horrible service. Great food but service needs some improvement.

I think being featured on TV can be a curse as an establishment has to live up to its reputation that is presented to the masses.

I've been meaning to go to Lola's for awhile but the Charleston location just isn't convenient. We drove to the new Summerlin location as the first Friday crowd packed the Charleston location with a 30-45 minute wait as told to us by the hostess. Since Vegas is small the drive wasn't long.

This location is really cute. Who ever did the decorating did a good job. It looked very comfortable, random (in a good way), and not tacky. We sat outside even though it was cold and they had heaters on to help.

I always like to try a variety of things the first time I visit a new place so that I know what to order next time.. If there is a next time.

We got a few appetizers to share: gumbo cup $6, crawpuppies $6, and crab and artichoke dip $10. I'm 99% sure the prices are accurate. I thought these prices were fair for the taste, portions, and quality except the crawpuppies.

As in not from the south I am no gumbo expert but theirs is probably the best I've had. My friends dipped the bread that came with the crab dip into it and really loved it. The crab dip had a lot of real lump crab meat in it and onions. It was good with the toasted bread. The crawpuppies were good but only came with four small balls. It's literally fried dough! I guess the craw fish in them is what makes the serving four.

I got the platter for $25. It came with fried cat fish, 2 fried oysters, 2 fried shrimp, one crab cake, and 2 sides. I was pretty full after our appetizers so idk if that's why I didn't enjoy my food so much, but I was a little disappointed in what I ordered. I'm not sure if the crab cake was the same as the appetizer one or the dinner one but it wasn't as good of a crab cake as I hoped for. Definitely average. They may have just over mixed it but it was a lot of filler. The one in the picture on the menu had big chunks of lump crab meat in it. The portion of cat fish was generous and it tasted good. The fried oysters were good and so were the shrimp. My friends both got bronzed catfish with Gouda grits and the sausage and mushroom ragout.

The last two things I got were the Gouda grits with sausage and mushroom ragout and then the bacon seasoned green beans. I really liked the grits dish. It wasn't life changing but it was good. The ragout really made it as plain Gouda grits would have been lame. The bacon seasoned green beans were over cooked and mushy.

My main gripes were the service and experience. The outside seating area sucked as people stood by smoking at times, the service was slow, and the chairs sucked. It took a long time to get our order taken.. The food was good but not good enough for me to want to go back soon. I think our server was alone so it was not good being seated outside. Overall I was a little disappointed and underwhelmed with the food after getting my hopes up seeing it on tv and them doing well enough to get a second location. I would go back but not anytime soon.

After looking at other's photos I believe we may have went on an off night as our servings of bronzed catfish were significantly less than the photos I've seen.

Here's my quick review of Lola's in Summerlin.  Yes, that's right.  Lola's has opened their doors in Summerlin.  If you've been to the location off Charleston near the Smith Center, then you know what to expect here and that's good grubbin' Nawlins' style.  Unlike the original location out here, this one has more space, doesn't seem to be as busy, and is a lot cleaner.  That being said, I'm still a fan of the original.  However, if I have choice, I'd make my way here when I'm craving the authentic stuff from Louisiana.  We dined on a mid-week night and it was far from busy.  Our servers were pretty good too.  But let's discuss what's really important and that's the food.  I got their the crab cake and their Bronzed Shrimp & Grits.  This was my first time trying their crab cake and it's huge, a creamy for a crab cake, and packed with flavorful crab.  As for their, Bronzed Shrimp & Grits, still as good as it get.  You get huge pieces of shrimp on top of their grits, sausage, and mushrooms.  This was seasoned just right and you can't go wrong with this dish.  In fact, this is the only entree that I have ever ordered when I dined at the original location.  I guess I should be try something different like their Po-Boys, the chicken & waffles, their jambalaya, or their oysters the next time I'm in.  But then again, it's too hard for me to pass up their Bronzed Shrimp & Grits.
I love it here. They allow me to tweak a dish. . Swapping the rice for gouda grits. And the house dressing is wonderful.

As I am writing this review, I am waiting for service with my pregnant wife and sister in-law. We frequent this establishment a lot and have nothing bad to say about it's good food and Great Desserts! Today sitting here watching this bartender serve everyone but us is becoming very annoying and disappointing. I am not lying we are sitting here for about 20 or so minutes waiting to be served by someone with no personality and completely rude! As I am finishing this review I am walking out the door and will never be back again. Hey you need great people working for you as well, even if your food is good. I am sorry but you lost me after we waited and was not even acknowledged, you were good before but today this taste is something I do not crave or deserve.

DeBrees sandwich is my favorite.


Great location. 

Live piano player added to experience ..





Like this place and would go back.

I have been once for Sunday brunch and once for dinner.  Had I only been to Sunday brunch, I would have knocked a star off because the menu is limited (discovering right before going in the menu online and having my pick ready to go before finding that out).  

My first visit, I had a crab cake appetizer (which was very tasty) and chicken wings  - they asked me what level of heat starting with 5 and going way up from there.  I said a "6" and the things nearly burned my lips off but they had really good flavor.

My next visit, I had the bronzed shrimp and grits.  Fantastic flavor but damn spicy!  About mid way through, the spice again started to make me uncomfy.  I should mention I have had grits before and these were the best I have had.  Maybe it was in combo with the sauce which contained andouille sausage - which was nice too, but they were cheesy and tasty.

The staff was friendly and attentive and the atmosphere nice and "New Orleansy".

I think what makes this place a 4 star instead of 3 1/2 is that it's different than the place down the road and that's a good thing to me. I'll come back again

The food was just MEH, but the bottomless mimosas, atmosphere, and staff saved this place :)

We have eaten at the other Lola's location, and were pleasantly surprised so we tried this place. I thought their breakfast menu was limited, and I was disappointed with the food that arrived. I ordered the poached egg with grits, it was plain. I got the french toast, it was ok. The staff was great, the mimosas were great, and the atmosphere was awesome. We will give it another shot, just not for breakfast.

My family and I were looking for a place to eat on our side of town this past Saturday and my mom suggested Lola's.   I am so glad she suggested Lola's because we had a great dining experience with the service and food!  We came in around 5 pm right before the dinner rush and were able to be seated right away.  I think this used to be an old Ruby Tuesday's or Rubio's but regardless it was renovated very nicely.  They have a large patio area and garden with real herbs and vegetables out front.  As for the inside, it is a nice mixture of rustic and New Orleans Mardi Gras decorations.  Our server was extremely friendly and efficient adding on to the overall experience.  
 
We ordered:
-Crawpuppies ($5.29) - deep fried crawfish balls, a little on the salty side probably wouldn't order this appetizer again
-Shrimp and Crawfish Etouffee ($15.99) - served over rice, the shrimp and crawfish are smothered in a flavorful sauce, really liked this would order again    
-Oyster Platter ($14.99) - mom ordered this, the oysters I was able to steal from her plate were fried to perfection and were juicy, came with 8 oysters and 2 sides
-Fried Oyster Loaf ($12.29) - dad ordered this, didn't have any but it looked tasty and good portion size as well, dad said he enjoyed it
 
My family really liked this place we will definitely be back!

Ordered the gumbo, obviously supposed to be fresh and hot but wasn't even luke warm. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits, he said they were okay. Service was okay. Will never go back for food, can find better gumbo @ other places.
This place is awesome!!! Fun, nice and friendly staff.  Great food !!! Great ambience !!! A must !

All I can say is AMAZING, The staff greeted you right when you walked in. When we sat down the order was very easy to read. The waitress was very pleasant and very nice. The building and set up is so cute very southern. I love this place in the area is great. It's right next to Summerlin. Once we order we were so excited, we're going to New Orleans this summer so coming here was a must. My friend ordered gumbo my other friend ordered red beans and rice and I ordered fettuccine with chicken. First off I want to say that the chicken was so well cooked and seasoned I wanted more. They brought out bread and it was delicious. We all decided to split out the males because they're very big in proportion. I had a little bit of theirs and I might add on that I'm not a big fan of a lot of brown spices. So I wasn't really able to enjoy their dish but I did love mine. I do recommend this place to anyone that wants a little southern food in their life.

First time visiting the Summerlin location which is in a newer building compared to the original in North Las Vegas. The interior décor is full of southern charm and Saint memorabilia.

Being a Sunday, the restaurant offered unlimited brunch mimosas, a brunch menu and beignets. Unfortunately they ran out of fresh crawfish.

I inquired what was popular and my friendly waitress suggested the Drew Brees po boy sandwich - in addition, we had a order of jambalaya and beignets for dessert. Overall, the food was solid and satisfied my Cajun craving.

I enjoyed the atmosphere of this location over the original not to mention this is spacious inside even at the tables in the bar. I'd recommend Lola's if you're in the mood for some southern hospitality.

Love this place!!! Staff is awesome !!! Love Randal !! Food is awesome!!! They have a great variety of cocktails too which is a bonus !!!  Portion sizes are perfect... not sure how people can complain about that.... perhaps supersize ur meal at mcdonalds instead

Had dinner there last night, the atmosphere was good.  Ordered their Catfish n greens, selfish.  My husband n son the Rice and Beans which was really good,  daughter in law ordered Jambalaya and that was good ang spicy.  Grandson ordered chicken strips.  The portion was good and over all the food was fantastic

Came for a quick lunch and had a taste for Cajun.
Order a jambalaya to try it out, not bad not bad at all. The portion is decent and the price is reasonable. Definitely will be one of my regular spots.

Honestly love it here. I need gluten free options, and this place delivers! The chicken platter with sweet potato fries and green beans gives me serious cravings. The atmosphere seems really fancy with a strong New Orleans jazz theme in the entrance/bar area/adult seating area, but the family seating section is more casual. It's a real relaxed vibe in this restaurant, so it's perfect for going out casually with friends, but definitely not bad for a nice date.

Cat fish and grits is amassing. 

Cole slaw is better than KFC. 

I haven't had a better desert in recent history.

I've eaten here twice with last week being the second time.  We started off the meal with the char-broiled oysters...so good!  For dinner I had a sample plate (red bean and rice, shrimp gumbo, and jambalaya).  Every item was incredible!  I was also able to taste the salmon and the catfish courtesy of friends...absolutely delicious!  Some of the best salmon I've ever tasted!  

For desert we shared a Fig Delight...again, amazing!  On my next trip to Las Vegas I'll be coming here again!
The food and service was great. My wife and kids are already to go back. My wife and I aren't grit eaters but it was great at Lola's.

My wife was craving some Louisiana food on our way back to Vegas from Pahrump Winery, so I immediately thought of Lola's. I've never been, but heard good things about it. 

When we arrived @ 3p, the parking lot seemed empty so we both didn't know if the place was even open. We checked the hours, and yup it was open. So we went in, the bar, tables, etc empty. We stood at the hostess stand for a few minutes to be seated, but my wife had to use the restroom so as she walked passed the dining area, she finally found a server to show her where the bathroom was. 

We were told we could sit anywhere in the bar area, so we sat at the bar and were greeted instantly by the bartender, Dominic. He was great. Very personable. He let me sample a few of their beers before I found the one that was right for me. 

We ordered our meals, I had the Roast Beef Po'Boy and my wife ordered Fried Chicken, side of Greens and fries. Everything was delicious. 

All in all, everything was fantastic. I gave it four stars because of no one being at the hostess stand to greet customers. Not very professional. 

Would I be back? Yes.

I love Cajun food, but this place just never seems to ring my chimes.  We've gone back three times, always giving it another chance but it never fails to disappoint. Blackened catfish isn't very spicy. The Gouda grits aren't very good. No okra on the menu. Need to find a good Cajun place in Las Vegas.

I'm giving 5 stars because of the food and one particular server my husband and I had lunch there on Monday we come here all the time because of the awesome food but my experience on Monday made me write this review our server and runner and boss boy was a delightful young man named Danny kind respectful and cheerful which was a wonderful change from before thank you Danny for making our lunch special
It is an amazing experience. The food and atmosphere is fantastic. My friends and I really enjoyed Shanna's hospitality.

The food was amazing!  The service outstanding.  I was a little upset by the size (or lack there of) of our appetizer.  We got the crawpuppies or something like that.  You get only 4 and they are the size of large marbles.  While they are very tasty, it most certainly wasn't worth the price.  Other than that, I highly recommend this place.  I had the Shrimp and Grits and it was so good!!  We will be back.
On Dirty Dining!!!!! And I fucking ate here. Gross as fuck!!! Over 30 violations if I recall right.

Yummy. So glad we stopped here spontaneously. Sat on the lovely porch and had brunch. Had some regular menu items too since it was our first visit and couldn't resist. Lol. It was all scrumptious. Everything we ordered was yummy and super flavorful. Their bread is to die for as well. They have it flown in from New Orleans. Yummy! 

They have herbs and vegi's growing all over. In pots on their patio and throughout their parking lot. 

Definitely will be returning. So glad we found this place. Thanks Yelp!

AMAZING food! AMAZING service! Shrimp and grits are to die for! The blackened catfish was so tender and buttery with a lite crisp on the outside. Gumbo is some of the best I've ever had.The Shrimp Creole is so delicious!  We all shared eachothers dishes and we were all so happy. Both locations are fantastic, but the Summerlin location is more mellow while downtown is more the party lolas our server Ashley was the best! We will be asking for her again... love this place!

First time dining at Lola's in Summerlin and will definitely be returning. We were celebrating our Anniversary AND America's birthday (July 4th). Our waiter (James) was friendly and offered suggestions when inquiring about various dishes. The char-broiled oysters were large & delicious. Ordered a couple of Po'boys, shrimp was very tasty with just a touch of spice and the roast beef (DeBrees) was everything advertised on DDD. Enjoyed a couple of Hurricanes and Anita beer. Couldn't get away to NO, but Lola's is the next best thing.

Love! I came here for a friends birthday and honestly I probably would have never tried Lola's if it weren't for that occasion. I'm so glad I did though! I will definitely go back again. The service, drinks, atmosphere and food were all great. I saw someone reviewed the bronzed shrimp and grits and said it was good even though they normally aren't into that sort of dish and thought the same, I wouldn't normally either and if they liked maybe I would too. That dish is SO GOOD OMG! Those cheese grits are to die for! I can't wait to go back!

Mmm Mmm Mmm!

Came here on a Sunday evening-- glad to know this location remains open versus the one in Downtown which seems to be closed on Sundays. 

Made reservations which, while there was a few open tables, it was definitely still busy.

Ordered the following: 
-Grilled Garlic Bread (definitely recommend-- the char paired with the garlic and crunch was delicious)

-Appetizer Bowl of Gumbo (enough to share with my husband-- great for warming up your appetite and to get a nice taste of their gumbo without being full for dinner)

-Catfish and Grits (DEELICIOUS!)

-Roast Beef Po'Boy (SO SO GOOD! Might not be your typical fried seafood po-boy but the mix of meat, bread, and dressings was so flavorful. The gravy was the best part-- especially sopping it up with your fries. Can get a little messy but don't be afraid to lick your fingers!)

-Bananas Fosters Bread Pudding (Perfect for sharing-- hearty, warm, and a great ending to the meal)

Generally I can't do spicy (hot sauces, sriracha, etc.) but the way this food is made is a good spice that brings a nice warmth of flavor to your mouth. We will definitely be coming back... hopefully to try their brunch! 

Service was awesome also :)

Love this restaurant! We usually dine in for dinner. Our usuals are definitely the Bronzed Catfish & Gouda grits and the Bronzed Shrimp. I would advice not to order any gumbo as, both dishes are served with it as as. First off, the grits are amazing! If you love cheese you'll get a cheesy bonus as these grits are made w/Gouda cheese! The catfish is great not too much of a fishy flavor just the right amount of seasoning. The shrimp is grilled perfectly not over cooked. 
For appetizers we ordered the pull n peel shrimp basically shrimp cocktail. They were huge and super juicy! We also ordered the Crawpuppies. They were amazing, just like mini crab cakes. For dessert we had the sweet potato beignets. Baked to a perfection sprinkled w/powdered sugar.
This place is one of my top favorite restaurants. If you're looking for a taste of Cajun this is definitely the place!

First day in Summerlin, we went here because it was across the street from where we were working. New Orleans Cajun menu, I had the Jambalaya with a side of red beans and rice. It was good but not great. Service was very good and they have a nice little bar.

We came here for my father in law's birthday dinner.  Ordered the crab cakes which were great, then a cup of gumbo which I was most disappointed in.  It was very bland and flavorless and just seemed like a cup of muddy mush.  My son had the chicken wings which were too spicy for him to finish.  Dessert was great, bread pudding and bananas foster.  Their specialty cocktails were AMAZING.  Overall the food was just ok.  I like the new location, but the ambience was pretty dull.
Best "soul food" in Las Vegas Southern style!!! And both locations are simply wonderful!

Came in less than an hour before closing and every employee who helped us from the hostess to the server and food runner was very kind and attentive. Upscale version of the traditional Louisiana/Cajun style seafood type of restaurant. (Boiling Crab/Crab Hut)

Foods we tried:
+ Mandarin salad: had everything I look for in a salad. Fresh crisp greens, crunch from the sliced almonds and sweet mandarin oranges and dried cranberries. Can have with shrimp or salmon. Shrimp was bigger than I expected and the perfect addition to the salad.
+ Ettouffe: Kind of like gumbo (little kick of spice) with a scoop of white rice in the middle. You can choose shrimp or crawfish or a combination. 
+ Side of sweet potato fries: I couldn't stop eating these. Soft on the inside yet perfectly crispy on the outside. It's a big portion perfect to share. 
+ Banana foster bread pudding: perfect, warm with a scoop of either vanilla bean or butter pecan ice cream. Highly recommend! :-)

Unbelievably good. I'd come back just for the fries. I had the fried catfish po'boy. It was the best po'boy I've ever had. Also tried the beignets, which were freshly made and better than the ones I've had at Cafe du Monde in New Orleans.

Overall I really enjoyed my experience at Lola's. My boyfriend loves Cajun food so I thought it would be a good idea to find a Cajun restaurant while staying in Las Vegas for a week. Lola's just happened to be only a couple of miles away from Red Rock Resort where we were staying. The ambiance and decor were delightful with Italian lights everywhere. My entrée of fettuccine Alfredo with bronzed chicken was delicious. The pasta tasted homemade which I love and the chicken was tender and flavorful. My boyfriend ordered the jambalaya which he really liked. Lola herself stopped by our table before we ordered, she asked if we needed any help and she steered me towards the bronzed chicken which is not quite as spicy as blackened and was perfect for me. What a lovely, elegant lady! Our server was very charming and nice as well. I just have to take off a star due to the "garlic bread" basket that we ordered. I liked the fact that the bread was grilled but other than that it was plain, I couldn't taste any butter or garlic. I think bread like that should come with the meal and not be an extra charge.

This location in Summerlin is not quite the same as the other location on Charleston. 
We went for lunch on a Saturday about 12:00 and the dining room was pretty empty, only two other tables of patrons, never a good sign......
Service was friendly and timely. 
We had the Blue Crab Cake as an appetizer. It was tasty, a fair amount of crab. The lettuce it was served on was sad and wilted.
The Soft Shell Crab Po Boy was good. Not great. Crab was nice and crispy but toppings were very sad ( same wilted theme from the appetizer) and this really took away from what I was hopping for in the sandwich.

Lola's was okay. The staff was friendly like the other reviews stated. They did seem understaffed.

Crawfish puppies- were extremely dark in color and I almost thought they were burnt. The dipping sauce was cold. Like unable to dip, had to be scooped out with a knife.
Crab cakes-were good. I'd recommend ordering them 
Gumbo-the roux was extremely dark and almost burnt. It wasn't served hot at all.

I ordered 
Shrimp & Catfish bronzo
It was close to be being burnt but nonetheless it was flavorful
My family ordered 
Alfredo(yes I know, it's a southern restaurant)
It was just okay according to them. The salmon came with the skin on which I didn't understand. The Alfredo sauce was overpowered with garlic.
The portion weren't huge. My 13yr old daughter finished her entire plate. The good thing about the desert is it comes in a huge portion. 

The service was subpar to say the least.

Wow!!!  What a find!  We ordered the gumbo, jambalaya, shrimp remoulade, and soft-shell crab platter with greens and green beans.  The gumbo and jambalaya were flavorful and packed with sausage.  The shrimp remoulade was generous with shrimp, and the remoulade was perfect.  The 3 soft-shell crabs were perfectly fried, fresh tasting, and VERY reasonably priced.  The service was attentive, prompt, and friendly.  Lola's is definitely on my revisit list when I return to Las Vegas.

Authentic Cajun food! I m from New Orleans and know the best! This is Las Vegas best kept secret to good food. I almost cried, I haven't had food this good in 30 years! Thank you, I' lol be back again and again. Hey La Ba!

Delicious doesn't cover it, it's the best I've tasted. If you've never been you should try it. I got the blackened shrimp , yum. Roast beef debris was great also. Best Cole slaw ever in my life!!! Chicken strips & fries were also great. Chicken didn't have a lot of breading which was good so we could taste the chicken. Sorry no pictures this time ,, too excited to try the food!!! Great service very attentive. Server Amber, all smiles & very polite .
Never disappointing. The shrimp po boy is my favorite. Service has always been good and I've never had a bad meal here :)

We went Here today for Father's Day! First, they were very accommodating with our reservation when we wanted to change our reservation from 3 to 7. They have the table set up for us when we got there and we had a private little area in the back room. The food was amazing!! Most importantly, my dad had his bananas Foster's French toast which gave him a great Father's Day! We will definitely be back here and seriously love the food!
Excellent fish and grits every time I go. I love the toasted bread too and the staff is always courteous. If you like Lousiana food you'll love it there.
We had Jambalaya and Gumbo. Both were delicious. Alex was our waiter. He did an amazing job!!! We WILL be back!

To be fair we ate there the first day they opened so there was a lot of issues. The A/C was not working properly so it was hot and steamy...maybe they were trying to replicate summer in New Orleans but it did not make for a pleasant dinner. Service was ridiculously slow and they could not get the credit card machine to work so we ended up paying cash after waiting nearly 40 minutes to track down our waitress to find out what the hold up was. Food was ok...crab cakes were really good but the rest was mediocre.
So I went back a few weeks later and they still have issues with the A/C. Service was better but not what it should be. We asked for bread and it did not come until nearly the end of our meal. Eek!
Had the crab cake again...I really liked it. My husband thought it was so-so. The shrimp and grits were amazing. Our son had the Crawpuppies and they were bad...none of us enjoyed the over cooked, fried mess. The gumbo was yummy and our son also enjoyed the red beans and rice. We tried Bananas Foster for dessert and hubby loved it, son and I thought it was just ok. Their wine selection by the glass is miserable. Overall there were a couple stand outs but not worth going back for.  Maybe they will get their act together as we were hoping to get a really good new restaurant in Summerlin. I'm still over the moon about Jacques in the Trails in Summerlin.

This is for take out since I haven't ate in here yet.

Their take out is pretty good and placed in good containers that's able to hold good portions.  

Their rice and beans with extra sausage is really good for the price.

Every time I come here to pick up their always dead ? Hopefully they don't close cuz the food is good!

I came with a fairly large group of people... Half of them loved their meal... Half of them were lukewarm.
I had the crab cakes made with lump crab, and I have to say there were no lumps of crab to be found- these were mostly filler and highly disappointing.
My friend and I had a post birthday lunch here and we love the place, cozy good hearty Louisiana food and love the service especially Lisa our server. A must see must try restaurant!!!

If it was not for the poor service I would have given them four stars. The food was really good. We ordered the crab cake appetizer which was full of crab meat! (A must try) for our main course we ordered the jambalaya and the shrimp platter. The Jambalaya was good, it had a very rich flavor. The shrimp platter was even better! The deep fried shrimp was amazing, the shrimp size wad very generous and the badder was very tasty. We ordered that with a side of red beans and rice which were great. I'm truly not a fan of beans but these were so rich in flavor that I was very satisfied. For the second side we ordered Louisiana cole slaw which was super good! It had yellow peppers which gave it a good spin from your traditional cole slaw.
For dessert we ordered the Lolas bread pudding. Well that one was a disappointment. It was warm in the outside and cold in the inside. There was really nothing special to it.
As I mentioned before the food was good but the service was horrible. It took 35 minutes to get our appetizer! At that point they should have brought us bread or something to entertain ourself. Then we asked for cocktail sauce and that arrived 10 minutes later. And to top it off it took about 15 minutes to get a dessert that of-course is already made! Hopefully they work on it because with that service not even good food is worth it.

One of my favorite spots to go to when in Vegas. The atmosphere is like Bourbon St. The Shrimp and Grits are to die for. We also had the crab cakes which were scrumptious. The drinks were great, got to try a Kentucky Mule. Its my new favorite drink. Oh and let's not forget about the bread pudding for dessert.

Not bad but not orgasmic omg I have to come back a billion times.  If you're craving some southern food then yea shrimp n grits are the way to go.  The crab cake was a little meh but the soft-shell crab was on point.  Fried oysters were ok too, that bread is to kill for but it definitely needs some type of dipping sauce to send you to the moon.
So happy to have one of our favorites in the neighborhood! Gumbo, crawfish étouffée, shrimp creole, shrimp n grits, po' boys and Abita on tap! Little bit of Nawlins in the hood! Whoop!

My boyfriend and I came here to experience that Louisiana good cooking and was disappointed by the food. 

We ordered the gumbo, oysters, and crawfish. The gumbo tasted a bit burnt and the appearance was not appealing. The oysters were interesting but prefer raw. However, the crawfish had great flavor. 

Overall, I would not return but glad I was able to try this place.

WE LOVE LOLA's. 
"If you love it so much, why don't you get married there?"
WE DID.
My husband and I have been frequenting Lola's since they opened their summerlin location, casually making our way through their entire menu, sampling their specials, enjoying their friendly staff, and maybe more than enjoying a beverage or two. Not once have we been disappointed by the food or service, and every time we leave it's with smiles on our faces. 
When we decided to get married and skip the whole "big wedding" thing. We wanted something small, just us, our parents, my kids, in a place that meant something to us. And that was Lola's. Their patio is beautiful, we all fit at the big table, we all ate whatever we wanted. Everyone raves about how good the food was, and how wonderful it was for us to be able to share that moment with friends and family. 
Obviously I recommend it for date nights, family dinners, st. Patrick's day celebrations, birthdays, anything. Go there. Eat anything and everything. Drink drinks, watch a game, enjoy live music. We will visit Lola's as long as she'll have us. Hopefully we see you there!

Ugh...I made the mistake of accepting an invitation here. I thought maybe it would be better than the other location. Boy, was I wrong. This place is a disaster across the board. Amateur hour on every level. Give it up, Lola. Lol.
Great soft shell crab and fried catfish. I love having classic cajun food less than a mile away from my house! 10+ stars

This restaurant, specializing in Cajun/Creole cuisine, reminds me of many we have frequented in New Orleans. There was a piano player near the entrance that we enjoyed as we waited to be seated.  We shared a Caesar salad that was delivered on 2 plates for us along with a basket of sliced garlic bread.   For entrees which each chose bronzed catfish over gouda grits. The entrees we good, but our fish were spicier than we have experienced at Lola's original, downtown location so be forewarned.

Found this place on yelp thought I would give it a try. We had a crab cakes as an appetizer and hot wings. The crab cake didn't taste like a crab cake at all, you could barely taste any crab. All I tasted was whatever they used as a filler. The hot wings weren'tanything to rave about. For our entree we shared the red beans and rice, that was pretty tasty. We also tried the bananas foster bread pudding and that wasn't too bad either. The waitress was really nice and the live music was a plus. I would try this place again. If you are a true lover of crab cakes, DO NOT GET THE CRAB CAKES!! You will be disappointed.

My boyfriend and I went there for the first time a couple of weeks ago and loved the food! We told our server that we were disappointed that there wasn't any fried okra on the menu. To our delight, she stated that although it wasn't on the menu, she would be happy to order some for us. The crab cakes were amazing and the catfish was just right! The bread pudding was the cherry on top.

1,822 miles north west of the French Quarter of New Orleans, and in the middle of desert mountains might not be where you would expect to find an authentic Cajun-creole meal. That's exactly what they serve up at Lola's of Las Vegas- southern hospitality included. 

Once you pass through the the glass doors you are greeted by an ornate fleur-de-lis and drawn in further by the savory aroma of Cajun blackened dishes and distinct creole spices.  Subconsciously you (along with the other patrons patiently waiting for a table) start licking your lips in anticipation.  For those visitors seeking just drinks or don't mind sharing a table, Lola's offers a full bar along with a beer-hall-style long-table immediately upon entry. 

For Lola's 2nd location in The greater Las Vegas area the atmosphere and decor modestly highlights some stereotypes of NOLA but doesn't overdue it with kitschy stuff thrown on the walls. Instead, the cuisine is allowed to dominate your experience and memories. 

The menu offers a hearty blend of Traditional Cajun dishes and classic creole fare from fried oysters to gumbo to etouffee to jambalaya and beyond. Staying true to The Big Easy; the selection of fish dishes are plenty and how you want your fish prepared keeps Lola's authenticity pure. 

For those who seek out new dishes and enjoys discovering flavors this place offers a whole new worlds while keeping you comfortable in knowing familiar choices are ready for plating. 

This food doesn't disappoint at all.  Rich in spice, alive with freshness and packed full of authenticity.  This food is so authentic New Orleans my father ( who was born and raised in just outside of NOLA in Bogalusa) became full of nostalgic feelings of his grandmother's cooking as he savored bite after bite. He especially recommends the red beans and I the Etouffee!  

The staff is very attentive and offers great descriptions of any dish that you might not be familiar with- without making you feel foolish for asking.  For me, at the end of my meal, my plate was licked clean,  my stomach was full of great foot and my mind full of new knowledge. I'm ready for my next Cajun meal. 

Overall, if you're in Vegas looking for something you won't see on Iron Chef and if you want great food that leaves a lasting impression, get your belly to Lola's.  It's a Mardi Gras for your mouth!

Ehh... I have mixed feelings on my first visit to this restaurant.
Positives:  The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very attentive and friendly. They had live entertainment which was also very nice. The fried puppies appetizer came hot and fresh and I thought  they were a great concept. They made a good Moscow Mule and had some interesting beers on tap, including a beer only made in the Louisiana.

Negatives: I got the chicken and sausage jambalaya. I was enjoying it very much, until I bit into a piece of chicken. The chicken had that awful flavor that it gets when it sits in the refrigerator too long. The chicken definitely was not freshly made. This was very off putting. Also the garlic bread barely had a char on it. It tasted like buttered bread.

Had dinner at this lovely place this past weekend while on a trip to Vegas with the boo thang. We were meeting one of his friends for dinner who recommended Lola's and cited it as one of her favorite places to eat. I've never truly indulged in Creole cuisine so I was really looking forward to eating here after reading some of the Yelp reviews. For me- it didn't disappoint. We arrived to Vegas on Thurs night- around 6:30p...by the time we got dressed for dinner, picked up his friend and arrived at Lola's it was around 8:20 pm and the restaurant closes at 9 pm on this particular night. 

We were greeted promptly by the hostess and our server gave great recommendations on food and drinks. We ordered cocktails but the star of the night for me was the cuisine. For myself, I ordered the "Bronzed Catfish" dish (catfish over cheesy grits w/andouille sausage and a mushroom ragout).  My BF ordered the jambalaya and his friend- the gumbo (both which were served over rice). 

Our food arrived in a timely manner and I have to say I was satisfied. The portion size was plentiful- it came with four catfish fillets over a nice mound of grits. Now I will admit- I'm usually the first person to grab or ask for salt to season my food (old habit) but my BF always gives me the side eye so that I taste my food first. :)  The first bite of grits had me smitten- I love cheese and Gouda didn't disappoint. Between the grits and the sausage/mushroom ragout- the entire dish held so much flavor it needed no additional seasoning whatsoever.  Sold! 

Now my BF and his friend didn't quite feel the same about their dishes. My BF had never eaten at this restaurant but has had jambalaya before- he said the first couple of bites were really good but the overall dish was just "alright" in his opinion. No further elaboration given. His friend said the same about her gumbo- "just alright". Since she frequents this establishment- her offering of why the dish was just okay was that perhaps the chef rushed in preparing our dishes since we had arrived so close to closing time. It's possible- but I'm happy that I was satisfied with my dish. Enough so that the next time I'm in Vegas/Summerlin- I'll try it out again....only in the afternoon this time. :) 

Oh and I did hear that brunch on Sundays is a must try! My recommendation is to try this place out...... #happyeating

This is my first visit to Lola's . Both my boyfriend and I had the gumbo. Good size dish with the mound of rice in the middle of it. Comes with a side of bread. It's not quite the gumbo I'm used to but it was tasty nonetheless and had a little kick to it. I will definitely go back and try something different next time maybe jambalaya.  I really enjoyed the New Orleans atmosphere there . Great music I've never been to New Orleans but I definitely want to go now. We ate on the patio is a little cold at night they had heater set out and it was very comfortable. We were definitely catered to and they made sure that we were all comfortable. I will definitely go back hopefully I can get four stars.

Great meal tonight! I just love those Gouda grits with the mushroom ragout! The crab cake and catfish were delicious too! Sazerac was the best we've had lately! As always, it's nice to see a restaurant owner working her business and visiting with guests. Thanks Lola and staff!

Atmosphere was very relaxed and was not too loud. There was very nice live music that was calming and did not interupt conversations. The food was above average. Favorites were the oyster poboy and soft shell crab. I thought the bronzed cat fish was over priced. A third of the dish was the sausage, another third was grits and the rest was the fish. The sweet potato pecan pie was not worth eating.

The whole experience was ruined by the waitress. The service we got from her was terrible. My son's ice cream has part of the plastic wrapper in it. When we told her she didnt even say sorry and just brought us another one. A sorry would have gone a long way. 

I am disappointed with the whole experience at this restaurant. Again, my experience would have been better is we got another waitress. Everyone else was very nice.

Five stars for the bread and banana pudding. 

Two stars for everything else.  We had appetizers, main course and dessert, and were very unimpressed with it all. My BFF spent most of teen years in Louisiana and I have spent time there as well.  This restaurant offers nothing in comparison to the bevy of delights I have eaten throughout Bayou Country.  Barely palatable, to be honest.

I have returned to get that banana pudding, however. The best banana pudding I have ever tasted, and I know my banana pudding, now. Bread pudding was good, as well.

Nom! Nom! Nom!  This place is so good! We always sit at the bar and we always receive great service! The food is incredible! You can't eat here and not get the crab cake and of course the gouda grits.  I love everything on the menu!

This was my first time here. The food was great and the service amazing. Dominic, the bartender, was very helpful, helping us choose our entrees and drinks. The po boys were awesome. Étouffe was very flavorful. We had la lousianne for drink and if you like bourbon, it's on point. Thank you for an awesome dinner.

Every time we visit Las Vegas I try to visit Lolas and I must say they never disappoint, food is always delicious and service is great staff is very courteous and attentive. My family and I will definitely continue to visit Lolas. 

Also note yelp states they open at 11am but at the establishment it states they have new hours and open at 12 so FYI call ahead we learned this the hard way.
Followup on suspected FOOD POISONING.  My son called Lola's, the response: "We'll tell Lola, sorry about that".  Nothing else.

Enjoyed my dining experience. There's a first time for everything. Started off with some crawfish. Nicely spiced just too small for me. Didn't like the work for so little. Had the soft shell crab and enjoyed every bite! 
Look forward to my return trip.

Dined here for lunch yesterday with a friend. It was my first time here and I was excited to try it because I love Cajun food. We decided to sit at the bar thinking we would get faster service. The bartender didn't have the best customer service he initially ignored us and we had to ask him to take our order so that knocked off a star. Other then that the food was amazing I had fried oysters with greens and potato salad on the side the greens were a little bland definitely needed hot sauce and salt. My friend had the jambalaya which was really good. I'll be back im going to try the other location next time.

More like 3.75 stars. Really good, authentic tasting food and good service and ambiance.. Only problem was that we were still hungry after an appetizer, (don't get the hush puppies, they are so tiny..) entrees AND dessert! Bump up the portion sizes a bit and we will return! Cheers

Okay.  It will do if I want cajun food close to where I live.  I typically get food orders for pick up.  Some of it is good while part of the order is bleh.  I've dined in twice and both of those times everything was good.  However, I always end up with something in my pick up orders that has either texture or taste issues (such as an item being too salty, or the bread of the poboy being soggy from the contents).  The staff is always courteous, but I've been disappointed with the food too many times to give a higher rating.

The crab cakes are amazing! This is one of my favorite places to eat. It can be a bit expensive but the bronzed shrimp and grits are worth it! On my last visit the service was only ok. I have a toddler who was very quiet (for once) and happy to eat lunch with the adults but the waiter was a bit rude to him.

Overall I was hesitant to try this place because living in the south plus being born in Maryland my standards for southern cooking are high . The other location was never an easy option to get to so when looking for a fun place to eat I was excited to see this was here .

My rating is solely based on the food because I believe service can't ruin an amazing food experience .. but our server Emily didn't even introduce herself plus she got our drinks mixed up which is a problem since my mother and I both had surgery that makes us sensitive to sugar and dumping . Plus before we even realized the drinks were wrong she brought my children's drinks in adult cups and made me feel terrible for asking for cups with lids my son is only seven and my daughter is ten but with special needs (not visible ) but I didn't even feel right having her switch her drink just had to be a drink monitor 

Not only did Emily not apologize for mixing diet and regular but I legit had to ask if she wasn't comfy serving us . Then she just stated she felt like she poisoned us and very clearly it just wasn't a match .

When I return I will make sure not to have her serve me .

I accidently made the reservation thru yelp and I don't know if she treated us this way due to that or she just did not like us but definitely a coaching experience is here to have her be a little more friendly. The food however made up for it .. I saw how Emily treated her other guests and she just wasn't friendly with us which definitely on a tab that is $100 with tip kind of sucks.



I ordered two appetizers and a bread basket to start. 

The garlic bread is so delicious but there are so many better ways to fill up your tummy unless your starving id probably skip it.

Next up was the crab cake and crawpuppies both were super delicious and had the balance of flavors I look for in soul food .

I ordered the fried oyster platter and southern beans with bacon and potato salad and it's huge I couldn't finish it all after sampling my family's food but it's so good.. the oysters were fried to perfection and great quality ..

My sons burger was just a party with cheese since he's young but man it was juicy and home made and I even liked it (I don't love beef much ) but this was a win .. which my son eating makes it worth coming here 

My daughter got shrimp charlotte which tasted just like the menu states 

My mom got the roast beef po boy named after Bree's and honestly it was super delicious too

We will definitely be back to try a bunch of other stuff especially dessert .. looks like they do some fun brunch options ..

I'll just be sure to make sure I don't get Emily and hope I get good service otherwise I will be back to update my review but the FOOD is so good..

Plus I love to support local

Good food, good drinks, good service, what more could you ask for! Oh yeah, live music too. 
We will be back.
Great food and atmosphere, perfect for Mardi Gras Day!

We tried a little of everything. Purple Haze on draft, crawfish puppies, chargrilled oysters, red beans and rice, pecan crusted trout with Gouda grits, and ettoufee. Banana fosters bread pudding for dessert. Everything was amazing! I would recommend everything we tried!

Another season of craw fish is upon us and if you haven't had them at Lola's, you're missing out.  They are spicy and perfectly seasoned.  They are never greasy,  as we have seen with other crawfish places in Vegas.  The atmosphere is relaxed and the staff kind,  helpful and fun you be around.

Cold sides , cold shrimp , stiff grits ; ordered 2 desserts cause the pumpkin bread pudding is usually our fav and both were cold as well . They messed up the sides and gave us the wrong ones as well . It was a pick up order and we had to wait 10 minutes to pick it up so you would think, that we were waiting on our food to be finished right ? Got home and as you read everything wreck .  We spent about 70 dollars on a dinner for 2 people and it was waisted . Hopefully the desserts microwave up decent or something cause this was terrible . We were frequent flyers with Lola's until now .

I'm not sure why it took us so long to mosey our way down here since this location is closer to our home.  So we decided to make our trip down on Saturday night. 
If you haven't been to either Lola's, you're missing out. I feel as though this place is a staple for Las Vegas. There aren't many Lousiana style food restaurants here. But this one takes the cake. 

This location, I prefer. Mostly because they have more options for alcohol, bigger, nicer and they have a live pianist that plays on Wednesday's and Friday's. You best believe I'll be going there for that. We were warned that Friday is usually packed though. 

The bartender, Dominic Trupiano was awesome. You can tell he loves what he does, and he's very good at it. He was super friendly and quick to serve. He also was extremely knowladgable in his liquor, so it was nice to have someone be able to pick something we'd really like. He had be try Haig scotch -- because I like more of the floral notes. It was excellent. And it's David Beckham's scotch. Nice work, Beckham. 

For dinner we had:

-Shared Cesar Salad. Always excellent. 
-Their amazing crab cake appetizer. This is one of my, if not favorite thing here. It's always crispy on the outside, and packed full of crab. This is hard to find with crabcakes. They're usually filled with other things, such as corn meal or breading so they don't have to use as much crab. Lola says, "No"...apparently. 
-Shrimp Creole. Man oh man, was this good. I hadn't tried this yet. It was so spicy (which I loved because I've been sick) and full of peppered flavor I loved it. The only thing I don't love is the pre-cooked rice. I don't know if this is a Lousiana thing. I'm assuming it is because I've been to Lousiana a few times and a ton of places there used pre-cooked rice. Being Asian, it's one thing I will always stand against. But, the dish was still excellent. 
-Bronzed Shrimp & Grits. If you didn't know, these grits are with gouda cheese. Which happens to be MY FAVORITE cheese in the world. These are the best damn grits I've had in my life. This is one of their best dishes, and it's very easy to taste/smell why. 

This place is just great. We'll frequent here more often for sure. So if you haven't been and you like Louisana style food, this is your place, my friend.
Service was fast and friendly. I think it may have been because we went because it was busy but the shrimp cocktail appetizer was the worst I've ever had. Our entrees were ok but not great.

We enjoyed lunch here and the food was good and the service average. We had the hush puppies with crawfish and while tasty they were really small. For the main course I had the Catfish with Gouda Grits which was great. My wife had jambalaya which was just okay. The portion sizes were just right for lunch, not too big, but not small.

Have been here several times.  We WANT to love it  as we have a sentimental connection to NOLA.  Yet, as hard as we have tried, it continually falls short.  The food is decent but I'm sure any New Orleanian would say the same thing:  there's just no genuine Southern hospitality or love.  It seems to come from the owner Lola.  She offers no "warmth" to the guests or even her staff - just cold.  If you sit in the bar, she just broods and frowns and makes it feel like any other faceless, cold bar in any town.  Nothing is genuine New Orleans except Dominic the bartender ~ he's a gem.
I've never really had southern style cooking but I'm willing to try anything. I did not thing I would enjoy cheesy grits with fish but it was fantastic. Loved it

I took my husband for his first time and he loved the food and atmosphere, set by Luggnutt, on the piano playing and singing jazzy blues music. The soft shell crab and fried oysters were fantastic. Huge portions of the delicious gumbo and jambalaya. They brought out grilled baguettes that I thought was the harder kind, but it was slightly crispy with a soft center. Big basket, all gone!!! 

To top it off, my husband ordered the chocolate cake for dessert. Yummy.

Lola's is quickly becoming a favorite place for my husband and I. We have been several times, tried different dishes each time and never been disappointed. I am from Shreveport/Bossier Louisiana, so am kind of snobby when it comes to Louisiana cuisine. Everything I have eaten there has been wonderful and reminded me of home. The gouda grits are absolutely amazing!!! The ambiance is wonderful and makes me feel like I am sitting in a restaurant in my home state and service is fast and friendly. If you love Louisiana cooking, go! you won't be disappointed.

Had the Shrimp Remoulade: 
"New Orleans tradition! Shrimp dressed in a traditional Remoulade sauce, served on a bed of shredded iceberg " which I really enjoyed! It was light and fresh and had plenty of delicious shrimp.  I love the decor here and the outdoor patio was very inviting even though we decided to eat inside. I was visiting a friend and she took me here and I am happy she did!

From the waitress to the food, I did not enjoy my visit. The crab cake was over cooked and looked nothing like the pic in the menu. It looked more like a flat hamburger patty. The roast beef debris poor Bo' had no flavor at all and the bread was hard. The soda was flat. I ordered a side of their grits and it came out in one of those little bowls that sauce usually comes in. It was tiny. Two spoonfuls and it was gone. It was the only thing that was decent.  I was so upset by the food, I didn't feel like being disappointed by the dessert.
Our waitress was Emily W. and we saw her when we ordered our drinks and lunch and when she brought the check. She never came and checked on us and didn't thank us when we paid or when she saw us leave. Not returning
Amazing service... hostess Chandler, server Alex. ZD Pinot was so smooth.  Shrimp and grits YUM! The bread pudding was fabulous!  Live music very  talented.  Great night

Some of the best food we've had in awhile. Red beans and rice-yum! Shrimp and grits-outstanding! Grits  and gouda cheese--I thought I was in eating heaven!  D'Brees Po-boy--can't wait to have another--my favorite by far! Also had the bronzed chicken Po-boy and added the Mardi grad coleslaw--wow! 
Soft shell crab and crab cakes with lemon aioli for appetizers-wet our taste buds for more!
Not only was the food terrific the waiter Alex really knew his stuff. He made some great recommendations that did not disappoint. 
We also liked the atmosphere. The restaurant was busy. Normally when people are seated next to you on all sides their conversations become part of the dining experience. We were never bothered by that. What we did hear was the best LIVE piano jazz. Truly New Orleans style! 
Come for a meal, come for an appetizer-the soft shell crab was to die for with its Creole mustard dipping sauce-YUM, stop by for an adult beverage and great music. Chances are you'll catch the owner  Lola Pokorny helping in the kitchen 
All I can say is we've  never gotten a bad meal. True Southern food and hospitality at it's BEST

Items Selected:
Beignets
Cinnamon Roll
Baked French Toast with Norris Cane Syrup
Andouille Sausage
Leidenheimer Grilled Garlic Bread
Fried Chicken and Fresh Baked Waffle with Roasted Pecan, Fig, Strawberry Butter
Bronzed Catfish and Grits over Gouda Grits with Andouille Sausage and Mushroom Ragout
Bronzed Shrimp and Grits over Gouda Grits with Andouille Sausage and Mushroom Ragout
Sweet Potato Pecan Pie with Chantilly Cream
Louisiana Chocolate Cake with Vanilla Bean Ice Cream
Bananas Foster Bread Pudding with Vanilla Bean Ice Cream

Owned by Lola Elizabeth Pokorny, with one successful spot already located downtown, Lola's: A Louisiana Kitchen in Summerlin opened without much fanfare amidst the hubbub surrounding the 'new' Downtown, but with the mall mobbed by crowds a short drive up Town Center Drive found Ms. Pokorny's renovated space to be a pleasant experience - the truncated and unannounced 'weekend brunch' menu aside.  Apparently once a Ruby Tuesday, with a sunny patio offering an al fresco option to those not sold on modest Mardi Gras décor, our party of three was sat quickly at a cozy four-top and with the dining room mostly empty while the bar bustled with football our service could not have been better, a duo of young ladies eager to answer questions and seek feedback while beverages remained brimming.   Happily conversing beneath upbeat Cajun instrumentals it would not be long after ordering that the first round of food would arrive and although beignets were a bit too 'bready' while Leidenheimer French Toast proved overpriced and underwhelming compared to the restaurant's signature bread pudding both the supple cinnamon roll and spicy sausage were excellent, the later a recurring theme in round two.  Admittedly a bit disappointed in the lack of oysters on the brunch menu, but soon to find solace in items offered as "signatures," it was with two plates of creamy gouda grits that the meal moved on and with the stick-a-spoon-up-straight base punched up by rich mushroom gravy and snappy Andouille both the shrimp and flaky fish equally shined, an order of chicken and waffles entirely forgettable in the face of such greatness as I mopped the bowls clean with complimentary grilled bread loaded with garlic.  At last arriving at dessert, the full menu offered in addition to two specials, it seemed only proper to select the items designated as Lola's signatures and although the soft chocolate cake was light yet intense while the hybrid pie was truly a 'best of both worlds' amalgam of sweet and savory neither could compare to the bread pudding - a steamy block of custard teaming with cinnamon beneath praline crunch and brown sugar sauce tinged with rum.

Long lamented for being a cookie-cutter planned community where PF Changs and Olive Garden continue to generate long lines, Lola's is a welcome addition to the area and the sort of place I can only hope continues to proliferate West as "Downtown Summerlin" develops.  Obviously new and still finding its footing, particularly with regard to a 'brunch' menu that seems muddled and poorly conceptualized in its lack of NOLA favorites like oysters or crawfish, I look forward to seeing how the restaurant evolves over time and only hope that the unwieldy location does not prove too daunting for those preferring to stick to the same ol' same ol' spots further south.

With the closing of Commander's Palace in Las Vegas, I thought I would never find another good Cajun/Creole restaurant in town....until now.  The roast beef Po' Boys are better than what I've had in New Orleans!  Lola's makes the best banana pudding I've ever tasted. No soul food restaurant in Vegas can compare to their heavenly banana pudding.

Nice local spot with good food - unpretentious and reasonable.
Little bit of New Orleans in Summerlin.
Nice staff - Angela provided excellent service above and beyond.

Excellent food great service very flavorful.  Cocktails are phenomenal! Kudos to the bartender! Randall, our waiter, was pleasant, attentive and charismatic.  Thoroughly enjoyed our visit! Don't cheat yourself, Treat yourself.... Get to Lola's Summerlin STAT

I go to New Orleans a lot and been to most restaurant there for many years it's hard to find one focused on authenticity but I kept trying till now. Found one! What a great surprise to find this gem in sumerllin north of Vegas, the ettouffe is spot on as is the red beans and rice try the fig tart with caramel ice cream for something different. Excellent! I'm a retired corporate exec chef and pastry chef traveling the country for 40 years. Trust me on this one.

I haven't had much cajun food in the past so I'm no expert on how it should taste. 

I love eggs benedict. So, I wanted to try theirs. The server did say the portion is on the smaller side. She was definitely right. Compared to what you could get at several other places I would say it was overpriced for the amount of food you get. The benedict did taste good. 

We also ordered the beignets to share. They were a nice treat. Only thing I had issue with was that one of the three had none of the sweet filling, where as mine had a lot. 

The other people I was with had more traditional lunch meals and enjoyed theres. 

I would like to try this place again.

Sat on the patio which was lovely. We had the bronzed shrimp po'boy and the roast beef D'Brees po'boy. Both were fantastic, but the brown gravy on the roast beef had a slightly peppery heat that was just spectacular. Server Liz was first rate.

We had a staff lunch today at Lola's. The service was exceptional from the minute we walked in the door until we left. The food was delicious and our waitress was very eager to make sure our food was as ordered for each one of us, eight in all.  We will definitely be repeat customers ~ Children's Dental Center

My all time favorite is shrimp and grits.  The gouda grits are to die for, and the andouille sauce with the grits....well, I can always use more of it!  La Louisiann cocktail is my go-to drink but the happy hour specials had me going with one that tasted like a jolly rancher.  Can't recall the name....something "bomb"

Hands down best place to get shrimp and grits! Great balance of spice and savory goodness.  Be sure to also gobble down Lola's red beans and rice (love mine with Cajun spice, adds a great kick!) Awesome place to enjoy the cozy atmosphere with friends and fam.

Same foods, same great flavors, same menus, but a more comfortable setting and a full bar.

I do enjoy stoping by when I'm in town

You got to eat here. You won't be disappointed. It's the best meal I have had in Las Vegas.  The food, drinks and desserts were very good. We were celebrating my in-laws 60th Wedding Anniversary. The service was great. We will come back every time we're in Vegas.

For outside of Louisiana on a Sunday at 2, this place was great.  Much better than expected. My buddy from La agreed it was pretty legit. Gumbo was pretty darn good.  Crab cake was excellent,  and the jambalaya was exactly what I was looking for.  Great service,  nice ambience as well. I'll be back here for sure. And get the fig dessert if you like fig Newtons... It'll blow your mind.

We had the best time.  No rush, just a very enjoyable evening for four.  The hanger steak special was the BOMB.  Loved the shrimp and grits.  Best grits in Las Vegas.  Service...wonderful.  go, you won't be disappointed.

Repeatedly had to ask for water, never gave us plates when the food came, brought the food out at strange times, never brought us sugar when we ordered coffee twice, one of the food runners spilled coffee all over a stack of spoons and napkins and didn't notice (we asked for more and  we did not get any more spoons or napkins), same food runner spilled water all over my friend's shoes and didn't notice either. All over an mind-boggling 2.5 hour brunch because the service was so slow.

Gumbo was good, crawpuppies were good, french toast was good, Andouille hash was good (came out cold), po'boy was good, praline bacon was good, bananas foster was great... Overall food was good. There was an amazing live singer - she was great. Wouldn't come back for the bad service though.

My, my, my this was so good we started! We started with a couple of turbo beers. We had soft shell crabs, catfish, polenta sides and had the soft shell crab Po Boy, gumbo's all around. The friendliest service and a really fun ambiance. I highly recommend this place
Unbelievable. When you just need a solid meal with quality ingredients and serious authenticity ... Lola's every time . The Bronze shrimp and grits will change your life .

I was very pleased with my meal here. I LOVE Cajun food. I've cooked it myself, and I will practically eat the table as well when I visit New Orleans, so I am picky.

Lola's however, was great. My first thought upon walking in was "This place could really use some Zydeco music right about no....", and it kicked in before I could finish that thought.

Their gumbo is tasty, as is their seafood. I tried their crawfish etouffee, and they definitely know their stuff for this selection. The missus got the blackened fish with grits, and that's definitely prepared Southern style.

The atmosphere is nice, the servers were friendly, and the drinks were strong. I had a Bloody Mary, and the missus had a Blood and Sand. I was definitely cozy post-meal.

Cajun places are just hard to find in Las Vegas, but I will definitely return to this one as it's a respectable contender. Definitely worth checking out if you're in the Summerlin area.
The best salads!  Always fresh.  The fried chicken tops it all off!!  Service is always over the top.  I look forward to my weekly visits!!

Wasn't sure what to think of this place, we pulled into the parking lot and there was only a few cars.  Walked into the place and got seated right away, there was only one table of seven.  We weren't sure what to think but ordered anyway.  So glad we stayed everything we ordered was so yummy.

Husband has been wanting to come here in forever. Actually, it's the Charleston location that he wanted to visit. However, with two babies in tow and knowing space is limited...Summerlin location is the best fit for those who have stroller aged children.

It was rather slow when we arrived. I clenched my butt as it was Father's Day and I was expecting chaos and a wait. But just as I told my husband on the way...nobody gives a shiz balls about Father's Day. Lol. We had reservations and so we were immediately seated. Probably because it was slow. The hostess was very welcoming and pleasant. 

I can only offer a 3 star rating because for one, I'm allergic to shellfish. Gumbo, and all that you come for gets thrown out the window. So, I opted for the blackened salmon with green beans and rice. It was literally a 2 star dish to me because my blackened fish, personally, was overcooked. Nothing exciting about it all. I mean, twas salmon. Tis all. 

I didn't expect my green beans to be like mush. It was like collard greens, bit made out of green beans. Perhaps I'm not as thoroughly familiar with southern food as I thought...but I really disliked the mushy green beans. Though, I ate the thing anyway because Iz wuz hungray. 

The husband ordered a small cup of their gumbo and had their jambalaya. He's such a whore to such dishes.  I was hoping he'd ooh and aah and spice up my yelp review, but as much gumbo and jambalayas he's had...no oohs and aahs. He said they weren't bad. Just alright. Okay, if his fatass says just alright, then it's just alright. On a sidenote, he also had his eyes glued to the start of the game 7 nba finals so maybe he wasn't fully being one with his dish. BUT! BUT! If it was something that locked his jaw out of goodness, no NBA game could.prevent that. So I'll have to have faith in his just alright.

I thought they'd bring out bread or something as you wait...I even thought they'd give bread with their gumbo or something, everything we ordered was literal. No garnishments to make it look fancy. No side pieces for flavor enhancement. You order the fish, you get the fish. While delicious food should not need fancy garnishments or bread to.scrape.your soups with...the fish would've tasted alot better had it had a lemon near it or something. I literally thought, I could've did this shhh...myself. 

We also ordered their fries which came out last! Seriously. There was a whiny baby with us who clearly NEEDED his fries because his life and mother's sanity depended on it. Hahaha. Their fries were pretty interesting though as there were different sizes of fries. There were thin and thick cuts and I feel like not having the monotony of same size cuts of potatoes is what made the fries. Weren't bad at all.

Our server wasn't bad. He just gave off this I'm a new guy vibe so he seemed timid? Hesistant? Not sure. We asked for a high chair but my husband ended up grabbing one ourselves because our waiter clearly forgot. I think he was the bartender as well? Either way he served his purpose. Good enough. 

Overall, we spent 50 bucks on 2 alcohol beverages, fries, cup of gumbo, jambalaya, and salmon. It wasnt a complete satisfying-rub-my-belly-wholly-crap that was awesome 50 bucks, but we went out...we ate...it wasnt busy...staff was nice...they had the game on...we had a nice time anyway, so mission accomplished. 

Would be come back? Perhaps. Wouldn't go out of our way and probably wouldn't be on our list of "we should go to........"  I will note that the front of their restaurant is their garden so it's nice to see fresh tomatoes growing knowing they're self-sustaining to a certain degree.

Definitely kid friendly. Highchairs with working buckles, yay! Certainly stroller friendly if it isn't busy in there. If you need a southern fix that's not some.hole.in the wall...I'd recommend them.
Awesome place for a Louisiana style food.  Great atmosphere and people.  I had the Jambalaya and it's perfect.  Best bartender

Spicy! Seasoned vs blackened you're dealing with a different spice palette. The grits were delicious and the shrimp was tasty. I had mine without the ragu & it was still too spicy for my taste, but cooked well for sure. We also had the crab & artichoke dip which was super yum, a couple glasses of wine & dessert. It was a great ambiance (you'd never know what the place was before if you hadn't ever been there) and our waiter was hilarious and attentive. They let us linger long after dinner to finish watching the game. All in all, good food, especially if you like spicy, good ambiance & wine. A tad pricy, but nice for a special occasion.
I always get either the shrimp & grits or the catfish and grits and also the gumbo is great! If you like po'boys are great too! Love this place

Meh, definitely not impressed with this place. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday dinner since he's been craving some Creole/Cajun food and man, we were pretty disappointed of our meal.

We came in around 5pm which was during their happy hour and though we wanted to order from their menu (drinks are half off) they didn't allow us to order if we ate at the dining area which was a bummer so we didn't end up getting anything off their HH menu. I don't understand why it was an issue to order at the bar and just drink the drinks at our table but we just went with it. 

We went for the gumbo, crab cake, and the étouffée with half crawfish and half shrimp. 

Gumbo: 2/5 - felt like I was just eating soup from a can and I barely tasted any shrimp at all.

Crab cake: 4/5 - probably the best thing we ate out of all of the food but the portion was very small, not shareable at all.

Étouffée: 3/5 - very bland. We had to add salt but it barely helped. The shrimp was good but definitely wasn't satisfying at all.

Service was good and we got complementary bread before our meal. Not sure if I'll try this restaurant again but it definitely didn't hit the spot we were hoping to fill.

Fabulous food! Service was on point. Comfortable  no rushed atmosphere.
Enjoyed hot artichoke dip with freshly grilled garlic bread, Shrimp and grits was perfect, have the Bananas Foster Bread Pudding (with vanilla ice cream & Carmel) so good!
Portions are generous, prices are good for quality of food.

Really reminds me of NOLA! The beignets also are really good! Not exactly like Cafe Dumonde, but pretty close! Sooo good to dip into your coffee. We had it as an appetizer, ate it in between our meals, and finished another order for dessert.

We started with charbroiled oysters. It was very good. Esp if you like parmesan cheese. We wanted to relive our meal at Drago's in NOLA. But it was too charred. Left on the grill a little too long I think.

For main entree, the hubby and I shared a jambalaya and the bronzed shrimp and grits. Sooooo gooooood! Very good flavor and perfect spice level. 

One less star because the food took forever to get ordered and took forever again to get to you. If you're a in a rush, this is not the place to be. 

Overall, great lunch!

For fans of the Louisiana-style Lola's on Charleston, this second location should please you.  It's a bigger restaurant with a large bar area as well as an outdoor patio.  Located on Town Center Drive near Summerlin Parkway, this Lola's sits behind the Sinclair gas station.   I don't remember if there was ever a restaurant there, but it's definitely a nice space.  We came for an early dinner on Wednesday around 5:30pm and the bar, complete with 3 flat-screen TVs, was busy with happy hour patrons.  We sat in the large dining area where there were two other parties present.  The décor has the New Orleans theme, with plenty of fleur de lis and Mardi Gras masks on the walls.  The menu is the same as the original location's, with dishes such as gumbo, jambalaya, crab cakes, po'boys, shrimp creole, and oysters available.  Dessert items include bread pudding and Bananas Foster.  
I had the jambalaya with shrimp.  The shrimp were large and grilled just right.  The jambalaya had a nice little kick to it, but was not overly spicy.  I ate a lot of the boyfriend's grits from his shrimp and grits order since they were nice and buttery.  We had good service from our waiter the whole time.  My only gripe is that I wish they'd serve some bread; give us some carbs while we're waiting for our food, y'all. I just love bread, though.  Other than that, we had a good experience and will come back since it's more convenient at this location.  Also, there's a lot more on the menu I want to try next time, including the dessert.  Who dat!

Food was delish! Staff were kind did I mention food was excellent? I had the shrimp and Bronzed Catfish & Grits, and it was mouth watering tasty! My company went with the Gumbo, also another great choice.  Didn't care much for the soft Deep fried Soft Shell Crabs- delish but my taste buds were not as happy. 
Overall, yummy food is available for your tummy.

I had heard of this place years before in New Orleans and I was pleasantly surprised when I saw one open in Vegas.  The restaurant is located in Summerlin, a nice town just outside of Vegas.  The ambulance was laid back and the music was fantastic for a sleepy Tuesday night.  Lola, the owner, was present and greeting each guest as she made everyone feel welcome.  The bartender seemed to call ever patron by name and even had their drink orders memorized...

I had the catfish and grits and the pecan pie for desert.  They were both excellent choices.  Full of flavor and pleasing to the eye.  I will most certainly be back whenever I'm in Vegas

The ambiance was pretty good for a Vegas resto.  Better than the usual franchise or strip mall setting... still a little too dark for my taste.  The service was mediocre, we sat in the bar so I didn't have super high expectations on that front.  The crab cake was pretty marginal.  There was more cake than crab and seriously... squirting mayo on as a garnish is something I would expect to see at Red Lobster (not that I have ever eaten there) not a garnish I would expect from someone that calls themselves a "chef".  This appetizer was served on a small saucer barely large enough to hold the crab cake so that each time I tried to take a bite the sad looking leaves of spinach (not bed of mixed greens) slid on to the table.  The gumbo was a salty cup of brown sludge which was mostly rice and somewhat grainy.  The sweet potato fries were dry.  The bronzed catfish & grits presentation left a lot to be desired.  On a positive note the fig delight was indeed just that, a delight.  We got out for $170 with tip for 4 people.  When considering this included 2 HH drinks and only 3 entrees and factoring in the quality of the food this didn't feel like a good value.

I had the sample platter I think with catfish and shrimp and crab cake. 

Ok so the crab cake - I felt like saying "Can I have some crab with this stuffing " 

This is crab cake made with a stuffing and it just is not tasty to me at all. It was mushy and the flavor was not great. I felt like I was eating a stuffing patty with crab mixed into it. Overly stuffing. 

The fry on the catfish and the fried shrimp was On point perfection.  

Now I am a salt sensitive human I detest overly salted anything. 

That being said the catfish and seasonal vegetables had Zero salt or flavor. Like add some salt. 

My brother had the Shrimp Creole it was tasty. 

Coming from a family of fine diners and my brother being an executive chef formerly of Rosemary's who had the best food in town I can't say this is the best I've had because it is not. 

I've given it a higher review then my pallet would normally suggest because instead of now basing my review off of just the food or just the server I'm going off of my whole experience. 

Here are some negative remarks 

1. Why are you in the edge of summerlin with a restaurant setting yet not 1 manager came to our table to greet us or to see how things were going. If you want to charge people the finer dining prices or the lower end of that, then you should probably practice the art of fine dining in your restaurant. 

It's dark there , there's no real flow to a theme just Knick knacks everywhere which the eclectic is fine however not 1 personality or any brightness of cheer in human form exists in this facility. 

It would be so cool to see people happy to see other people and not just working and doing their jobs. Tell some of those men to tuck in their shirts as well. 

2. When people order salads etc and a server suggests something they should probably describe in detail what it is they are suggesting. I like the house vinaigrette did not let me know this vinaigrette is overly sweet and packed with about every herb you can imagine giving it no real direction as far as flavor is concerned. 

3. I even saw the owner there and she did not make eye contact she did not say hello or anything. Very rude and very uninviting. I own a few businesses and never would I not say hi or anything to anyone contributing to my success. Ever just horribly rude. 

Positive Notes : 

1. The server was very polite and she was attentive. 

2. The food didn't take forever to make. 

3. Even though the catfish lacked salt the fry on it was impeccable and the quality of the fish and shrimp was magnifique. 

4. The Veranda looks quite lovely  

Honestly I can't say much more. There are too many things I found mediocre. 

I'm sure if the manager had greeted the table considering there were only 5-7 tables filled that afternoon that would have raised it another star for me. 

If you want to be in the restaurant biz have hospitality in every aspect with every employee. I couldn't even tell which was the manager apart from everyone else.
