Lola's was amazing for dinner last night. We live in Orange County and wow do I wish we had a Lola's in our neighborhood. We started our meal with a cocktail and the Charbroiled Oysters, which were served immediately with amazing bread.  My husband had the Jambalaya and I the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits. Let me tell you, the Ragu that comes with the Gouda Grits was the start of the show! The shrimp and Jambalaya were great but, the Ragu & Grits... Oh boy! With the bread!!! Yes!!! I liked it can you tell?
No dessert for us but we'll be back for sure.

Service was friendly and fast, maybe even a bit too fast. Dinner was served before we could finish our drinks. We may have even had two even given the chance. We were in and out in 40 minutes. Great if you're in a rush but we were not.

If you like mediocre cocktails with the smell of burning bread in the background and bartenders that act like they would rather be anywhere else but there this is the place for you !!! Not quite sure how they stay in business but do know I'll never go back !!! Oh we were going to have dinner but the total bad vibe sent us elsewhere !! Hello !!! Hire a Manager and clean house with a whole new staff !!!
Lola's shrimp and Gouda grits with ragu is still on my last meal menu.

Went there yesterday for dinner with friends. My family is from New Orleans and I was excited when a friend recommend this spot. The ambiance was nice. The food not so much. They advettise lump blue crab cakes on their menu, but they served us salmon croquet. The gumbo was thick, too thick and desperately needed some fi'le. Then the waitresses accidently spilled water on one of our guest wetting him and his bowl of greens. (By the way the vegtables and fish were also bland). Instead of offering compensation they OVERCHANGED him for the meal and explained that complications with their register prevented them from doing a price adjustment. On top of that she took it upon herself to include a 20% gratuity to his bill. The nerve! Needless to say we won't be back and I couldn't in good consciousness recommend this place.

Wow...... and that is NOT in a good way. We attended a birthday dinner for 8 last night. Walked in to pleasant surroundings that are mildly reminiscent of New Orleans. Sadly, that was the last positive thing I have to say about Lola's. The joint was dead at 6:30 which seemed like a big ol' warning sign. But hey...it's almost Christmas so maybe?

Service was friendly but amazingly slowwwwww. I ask the server for suggestions on the menu and he did my big no-no...."EVERYTHING" he says.  Come on dude, there are better items that you can suggest instead of letting a new customer throw out a line hoping they are going to find the big one!  I also wonder if they were trying to emulate their idea of the big easy with this "going in reverse" kind of service. If so, it ain't workin'. Odd that you sit around a dead restaurant twiddling your thumbs with absolutely nothing to nibble on. Oh well....maybe the dinner will make up for this. NOT!

Dinners arrived with absolutely no mapping by the server so the expediter is wandering around the table asking where each (different) dish went. The funniest part of this was that some of the dishes had the wrong sides so nobody knew what was really their dinner. That is where the entertainment ended. 

We had a very eclectic array of dishes and NOT one of them was up to par so let me point out the worst of the bad. Crab cakes....They looked so promising. They arrived looking like a crab cake should but when I/we took a bite they were absolutely mush.....not cooked through and not warm all the way through. EEW!  I NEVER send food back but this was a food poisoning in the making. Sure enough....the crab pinched at my queasy stomach all night. The other guests said their crab cakes were mushy but they ate them anyway....... out of shear desperation for food I suppose. Wonder how they did last night? The shrimp on my grits was tiny and tough. My hubby's catfish was mush. Looking around the table, not one thing looked good. In fact, no one said a word out of politeness but it was apparent this was a huge disappointment for everyone. Jeez...eight bad dishes. Well...I guess Lola's is consistent and NOT in a good way.

Almost forgot to mention. We brought a birthday cake and they wanted $1. a slice to cut it. I brought all the equipment, plates etc. so I cut it FOR FREE. God knows a dead restaurant with bad service doesn't want to cut a small cake. To top it off, they served the worst coffee ever. (dessert) I was expecting a lovely blend of chicory and french roast but instead they served a watery substance that they called coffee (thinking swamp water)  in the tiniest cups with no refills. What a joke!!

Commander's Palace....you got nothin' to worry 'bout........and my prediction is Lola's Summerlin will not be around long. My predictions have been spot on so far but I will eat my words if they are a resounding success. BTW... my words are tastier.

If you are searching for fantastic NOLA cuisine, LOLA's is AMAZING!!! Food is the best Creole/Cajun in Las Vegas. Service is great, and the atmosphere is comfortable. I have had plenty of food down in NOLA, at the "best" or "most recommended" for local cuisine, and none of them even come close to LOLA's. A MUST if you love spicy, savory, and delicious Louisiana cooking! I recommend the Bronzed Shrimp and Grits!
The jambalaya was delicious, but the bananas Foster bread pudding was incredible! Service was very good and the ambiance was nice.

Went to have an early Mother's Day brunch with my mom... place was pretty busy around noon on a Sunday, i was seated pretty quickly by the lovely hostess. I guess they were short one server we had to wait a bit to get drinks ordered but we were in no rush. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my mom ordered the jambalaya everything was pretty flavorful. Ordered the banana fosters bread pudding for dessert. Would definitely come back!

OMG it was like being back in The Boot! I am a super Creole/Cajun food snob and side-eye any place outside of Louisiana or my family's kitchens that claim to serve this cuisine. But Lola's is the truth! From the Gouda shrimp and grits to the decor, everything about this place is authentic and delightful. I can't wait until football season starts so that I can spend many Sundays watching the Saints and eating beignets at Lola's!

Get your britches in here, order the shrimp and grits AND the beef po' boy. Shut up, don't argue, just do it. Split both with someone, get a sweet tea too and then commence yummy sounds... No dinner convo required,  although a tums might be.
Louisiana cusine home away from home that's legit for sure.  Just love the atmosphere it's fun & definitely a place anyone that appreciates cajun & creole food would love.

One word: Delicious. 

This is my 3rd time dining here. I haven't ordered anything that wasn't fantastic. The gumbo is one of my top favorites. The banana fosters bread pudding is a MUST!

My cousin and I wanted to check this place out (I was craving gumbo) so we did. After, we decided we'll go back. The price was right, the atmosphere was very nice and relaxed, the service was good and knowledgeable. The food was yummy, everything each one of us ordered was cooked well, seasoned well, and tasteful. I only gave four stars because even though the food was good I feel it wasn't "OH MY GOD GOOD"!

A little off the beaten path in Summerlin, but well worth seeking it out for authentic bayou food. Catfish, shrimp, crawdads, mussels among other Louisiana delectables with a choice of down home sides are the mainstays here, prepared most any way you like it.  For real authenticity try the bronzed catfish with grits and andouille sausage -- my favorite.    You won't go wrong with any of their menu specialties.

The original is on charleston. I love this restaurant.  I've been to both locations.  My family loves this restaurant. I have family that comes from out of town.  They insist on going to this restaurant every time.  The bronzed shrimp is my personal favorite. The grits are yummy. The toasted bread is great to finish the sauces.

We had an out of town guest and were looking for a new restaurant to try with her that we thought she'd enjoy. As she's from Georgia I thought Lola's might be a good choice. This was based on reading on line reviews and two recommendations from friends, not personal experience.
The look of the place is NOLA authentic. We were seated at a nice table in the large dining area but could still enjoy the live music from the bar area. The menu is pretty varies. Between the three of us we had the gumbo, hot wings and fries and the golden shrimp and grits. The shrimp dish was pictured on the menu and in my experience that is a good sign; I was correct. The gumbo was very good, the hot wings were crisp on the outside but juicy on the inside. The choice of sauces range from 1 5 which is a little hot to a 10 which is omg serious heat. The shrimp were delicious and the grits with the mushroom and sausage ragout were spectacular. Had we not had a freshly baled pecan pie at home waiting for us I would have tried the bread pudding. Something for next time.
Lola, the owner, was there and making the rounds to the tables in play. She is really friendly and spent a lot of time with us discussing her restaurant, the food, her plans etc. She made us all feel as though we were her friends who had stopped by her house for dinner. She's very warm and engaging.
The service was excellent from hostess to waitress to attentive bus boys. We had a great time. This was our first visit but definitely won't be our last.

Ragin' Cajun eats comes to Summerlin! 
Met a rowdy bunch here in the bar for March Madness and enjoyed the atmosphere.
The fact that they agreed to host us shows they have style! And tolerance.
I had the gumbo and a basket of garlic bread. Loved the gumbo, could have kept eating bowls of that!
The garlic bread was just OK, wasn't garlicky enough for me. 
The Happy Hour menu is OK, draft beer is $1 off and there are a number of smaller plates for happy hour prices. The decor is festive and reflects the Louisiana roots of the owner. A great place to stop while in Summerlin and try something new.
Food was great!  Owner and staff very friendly.  We will be back!  Oh yeah love the man buns! LOL
Amazing food. Shawna was the best waitress ever and friendly.  Made our experience great! New Orleans hospitality at it's finest.
We had the Catfish and grits that everyone is raving about.  What the heck?  A plate full of grease! If that's their best effort- pass. There's other NOLA cuisine restaurants that are much better.

I came to Lola's with some coworkers for lunch. I made an OpenTable reservation before we arrived but there was really no need since the restaurant was completely empty around 11:45am. 

We were seated quickly but service started off slow and remained that way for our entire meal despite the not being too many other diners around. 

Our group started with the grilled oysters and some chicken wings as appetizers. For my main course I ordered the catfish and grits. I don't usually like catfish but I wanted to try something different. 

The food was ok. The flavors weren't as dynamic as I was hoping for and bordered on bland for some of the items. Overall the food was not particularly memorable. One coworker who had suggested the place for lunch was disappointed with her meal and mentioned she wasn't interested in returning again.

Service was friendly but forgetful often leaving our glasses empty far longer than I would have liked.

I don't see myself going out of my way to return.
Terrible service, greens were so dry like welted grass. The service was bad and the manager was asked to approach us after we complained . This was our first trip to Vegas and we chose the spot.

This place was amazing! Food was out of this world delicious, staff was super nice and atmosphere was wonderful! Nice background music playing. Didn't feel rushed. A new favorite place to dine for our family!
